column1: I tried to ask the bank teller why it changed, but she didn't speak English well enough.So I decided to go to the magazine shop. The one around the corner.And I bought an American newspaper ;
column2: What happened?
column3: It seems that yesterday the Mexican government declared wouldn't pay back the loans it got from the World Bank.The government declared a default on the loans.
column4: That's serious.
column5: I know. The economy here is having serious problems.But because the government declared a default, the currency value went way down.
column6: So now Mexican pesos are worth about half as much.
column7: Yes, it's an amazing drop.
column8: Wow. I feel sorry for the Mexicans. But it's good for us.
column9: Yes, it's very good. We suddenly have twice as much money to spend here.Our hotel is now half as expensive as when we got here! Isn't that strange?
column10: Yes, and you know what?

column1: Good morning. Your ticket and passport, please?
column2: Here you are.
column3: Do you have any baggage to check in?
column4: Yes, one box.
column5: Would you please put it on the scale?
column6: OK. By the way, can you tell me how many kilos of free baggage each passenger is allowed?
column7: The baggage allowance is different according to the class of your ticket. What class are you travelling?
column8: First-class.
column9: For a first-class passenger, the free baggage allowance is forty kilos.
column10: How many pieces of baggage can I carry on to the plane?
column11: Passengers holding first class tickets may carry 2 pieces within the total weight of 5 kg onto the plane.
column12: If my baggage exceeds the allowance, what should I do?
column13: If the checked baggage is over the allowance, we will charge you for the overweight.
column14: I see. Thank you very much for your information.
column15: You're welcome. Your boarding pass and baggage check, please.
column16: Goodbye!

column1: Can ’ t you come in and have tea now, Peter?

column1: How about the hiking? It was freezing yesterday, are you all ok?
column2: Can ’ t be better, it was wonderful. We had a lot of fun there. There was so much joy and walk and breathe the winter air. We arrived at the park at 9 o ’ clock in the morning and didn ’ t leave till 3 o ’ clock in the afternoon.

column4: Of course not! We built a snowman, some snow dogs and one big snow fort. We went sliding on the nice hill. It was a real work out. At noon, we had the most special winter picnic outside. Fortunately, we got it all on a video tape. You must come with us next time. I bet you will love it.
column5: Well. You know I hate walking, but I can ’ t wait to see your guys ’ video.

column1: Hey honey, how was your day?

column4: Well, his son had an accident and Bill doesn ’ t have health insurance. This really got me thinking, and I wondered if we shouldn ’ t look into a couple of different HMO ’ s.

column6: Exactly! I searched on the web and found a couple of HMO ’ s with low co-pays and good coverage. The deductibles are low, too.
column7: Sounds good, although, do you think we can qualify for insurance? Those insurance companies are real pirates when it comes to money.
column8: Well, we don ’ t have any pre-existing illnesses or conditions, so we should be fine.
column9: I wish our company or country provided us with healthcare.
column10: Not in a million years!

column1: Howdy! Nice car! What seems to be the problem?
column2: I don ’ t know! This stupid old car started spewing white smoke and it just died on me. Luckily, I managed to start it up and drive it here. What do you think it is?
column3: Not sure yet.How about you pop the hood and we can take a look. Mmmm, it doesn ’ t look good.
column4: What do you mean? My daddy gave me this car for my birthday last month. It ’ s brand new!
column5: Well missy, the white smoke that you saw is steam from the radiator. You overheated your engine so now the pistons are busted and so is your transmission. You should have called us and we could have towed you over here when your car died.
column6: Ugh... So how long is this going to take? An hour?
column7: I ’ m afraid a bit more than that. We need to order the spare parts, take apart your electrical system, fuel pump and engine and then put it back together again. You are going to have to leave it here for at least two weeks.
column8: What! How am I supposed to get to school or go shopping? This is not happening!

column1: Excuse me. I ’ m a stranger here and lost my way ;
column2: Can I help you?
column3: Sure. Can I get to the central department stall this way?
column4: uh... Yes. Turn right, then take the second turning on your left.
column5: Is it far?
column6: It ’ s about fifteen minutes ’ walk. That ’ s all.
column7: And do you know where the national bank is?
column8: Yes. It ’ s on this street. Keep walking for two blocks and it ’ s on the corner on the right.
column9: Thanks very much.
column10: You are welcome. Good luck.

column1: Hello, Ken.
column2: Hello, George.
column3: Have you just been to the cinema?
column4: Yes, I have.
column5: What ’ s on?
column6: Paris in the Spring.
column7: Oh, I ’ Ve already seen it. I saw it on television last year. It ’ s an old film, but it ’ s very good.
column8: Paris is a beautiful city. I have never been there. Have you ever been there, Ken?
column9: Yes, I have. I was there in April.
column10: Paris in the spring, eh?
column11: It was spring, but the weather was awful. It rained all the time.
column12: Just like dear old London!

column1: May, my grandpa is ill. I will go to look after him. Catch you later!
column2: OK. I will catch you later.

column1: Have you had enough time to look over the menu?

column10: Please bring our salads to us now. We are hungry!

column1: which countries have you been to?
column2: I ’ Ve been to most of the countries in Europe, several countries in asia, china, Japan, korea, and Thailand, and to the united states and Canada.
column3: I thought you had been to Australia too.
column4: no, but I ’ m planning on visiting Australia and New Zealand soon. I ’ Ve heard that they are beautiful countries. Which is the most beautiful country you ’ Ve been to?
column5: I think I'd say Norway. It has many pictures as fjords, waterfalls, and mountains.
column6: isn ’ t it really cold there?
column7: well, the north of Norway is almost always cold, but further south it can be fairly warm in summer. It ’ s a wet country, so there ’ s snow almost everywhere in winter.
column8: I ’ Ve been to other Scandinavian countries, but not to Norway. Perhaps I should go and do some winter sports there.

column1: Can you believe me?

column3: Please count on my love.
column4: I will.
column5: I'll be yours through endless time.

column8: I'll never hurt you ; I'll never lie.
column9: My love will grow, like a river to flow.
column10: It can't be dry, and can't die.

column12: Aha, Aha...

column1: Is there a lot of crime in your city?
column2: There ’ s some, but I don ’ t think it ’ s a big problem. A lot of it is petty crime, burglary and car theft. There ’ s very little major crime.
column3: It ’ s the same in my city. We also have a lot of drug addicts. A lot of the crime is committed by drug addicts who need money for drugs.
column4: That happens in many places. In my city, there is a very good drug rehabilitation programme. The police and courts are also tough on people who commit crimes, but I don ’ t know if that ’ s the reason for
column5: Some people believe that a tough approach is better. Other prefer a more lenient approach.
column6: I think that the best way to reduce crime is to spread wealth more evenly. If most people have similar amounts of money, they will not think of stealing from others.
column7: That ’ s possible, but I ’ m not sure it would really happen like that.

column1: Excuse me, what's the screen near your steering wheel for?
column2: It's a portable TV. It's a popular thing now.
column3: Oh, that's new to me. So what's on everyday?
column4: News about current affairs, documentaries, music, movies, noncommercial ads and so on.
column5: Is there anything interesting?
column6: Yes, there are something good and informative. I think that many people underestimate the value of TV in education.
column7: I agree. Are there any commercials on the TV?
column8: Of course. Because the TV stations need to make money from commercials between the programs.
column9: That makes a lot of sense. Does the TV work well?
column10: Not always. It depends on the transmission of the satellite signals.
column11: I got it. Do you pay for the programs?
column12: Yes, 50 Yuan per month.
column13: It is a little bit expensive, but it's worth it.
column14: Yeah. You know driving is boring. TV can get me out of the fatigue of driving.
column15: It can also entertain your passengers like me.
column16: That's the point.

column1: Dear Anna. I really love you.

column8: I trust you. We'll be happy.
column9: Let me wear you this diamond ring.
column10: It's so beautiful.

column10: It's hard to say, but I do love the foxtrot and waltz.

column1: He's going too slow.

column1: Can I get you something to drink?
column2: No, that's okay, I already have a coke.Why don't you have a seat, you look like you've been on your feet all day.
column3: I guess I could take a break.So, how do you like Denver?
column4: It's great! The mountains here are beautiful and the skiing is spectacular.Have you been here for a long time?
column5: About six years...
column6: What do you do for a living?
column7: I manage one of the ski lodges.It' s a great job, I can spend a lot of my time outdoors, and I also get to ski for free all season.

column9: That's okay.If it weren't for you accountants, nobody would have the money to go skiing!

column1: How was your trip to Brazil? Did you learn anything?
column2: I had no idea how seriously that country takes soccer!
column3: Tell me about it.
column4: Okay. In the middle of their streets there are parks, big soccer fields as far as you can see.
column5: Really?
column6: That's not all. They use them! Every night men, women, children all out there till 3 and 4 a. m.
column7: Are you serious?
column8: I don't know how they function the next day! It's like they eat and breathe soccer!

column4: I'd like to, but I'm afraid I can't.

column8: You said you wanted to improve your English, so how about coming with me tomorrow? I can also introduce some friends to you.

column10: They are not geeks. They are also interested in singing, dancing, and so on. They are excellent, and they can always help me a lot.

column4: No, the other three girls major in a computer science, and they can help me a lot with the computer operating.

column1: A guy in my office got the flu the other day. Today I seem to have come down with it, too.
column2: Very likely. You have a slight fever. Do you have a headache, too?
column3: Yes. I wonder if you could do something to help me recover soon, because I'll be on a business trip in two days.
column4: Well, you have to let your flu run its course. You must stop working and stay in bed to get plenty of rest. Usually it will take 4 to 6 days to make a full recovery.
column5: But I'm going on a business trip in two days!
column6: Maybe you'll have to cancel it or postpone it. If you go out while you are sick, it won't help you recover. You may even pass your disease on to others.

column7: You may ask if you can take a half-price ticket.
column8: Yeah, I make certain. A half-price ticket cuts us one point five Yuan.

column1: Do you like watching the Winter Olympic Games ;
column2: Of course. It's the tradition game in winter, and with good reason. Don't you like watching it?
column3: Of course I do. I love it. All the games are exciting and the competitors are respectable.
column4: That's true. For various reasons, it takes more to hold a fierce game for Winter Olympics than it does for Summer Olympics. You know, the low temperature may cause many problems.
column5: Yeah. What's the difference between the Winter Olympics and the Summer Olympics?
column6: When the Olympic Games started in modern times, only summer events were included. When it grew popular, there came the Winter Olympic Games, which includes a variety of winter sports.
column7: I see. Then, what's your favorite winter sport?
column8: Figure skating. In my eye, nothing beats it.
column9: Then you must know Shen Due and Hao Hongbo.
column10: Oh, I didn't expect you to know them. But yes, I love them not only because of many medals they've won, but also because of their spirits.

column1: good morning!
column2: good morning, Gav! Did you sleep well last night?
column3: I slept like a baby. I fell asleep right away last night, didn't wake up once, and didn't have nay nightmares!
column4: that's great news! You look much more relaxed than you did yesterday.
column5: I feel much better, but I'm still worried about something.
column6: what's that?
column7: well, I have to drive to school for a meeting this morning, and I'm going to end up getting stuck in rush-hour traffic.

column10: just breathe deeply when you feel yourself getting upset.

column12: is there anything else bothering you?
column13: just one more thing. A school called me this morning to see if I could teach a few classes this weekend and I don't know what to do.
column14: do you have any other plans this weekend?
column15: I'm supposed to work on a paper that'd due on Monday.
column16: try not to take on more than you can handle.
column17: you're right. I probably should just work on my paper. Thanks!

column6: About two months.

column9: But I prefer warm weather.
column10: Spring will come soon. And we will have some pleasant weather then.

column3: Are you sure you have the time?

column5: What would be the best time for you to help me?
column6: Tomorrow night would work for me.
column7: Should we just meet here?
column8: OK, and I'll bring some information that helped me with my presentation.
column9: I'll see you then.
column10: See you tomorrow night.

column1: Excuse me, could you tell me where I can get a shopping basket?

column3: Well, I can't find the way to the entrance. Would you tell me where the entrance is?

column5: Thank you very much. By the way, where are the vegetables?

column1: Do you have any hobbies?
column2: Yes, I like collecting things.
column3: Oh, that ’ s interesting, and but what kind of things?
column4: Several things, for example, Very coins, stamps, stones and so on.
column5: Stones? I know many people collecting coins and stamps but stones?
column6: Yes, stones.
column7: well, I can ’ t just imagine it.

column1: How's the weather today?
column2: It's hot.
column3: I really don't think this weather will last.
column4: Let's just hope it doesn't get hotter.

column1: I don't know why people are just mad about David Peckham. Is there really anything so fascinating with him?
column2: He appeals to the fans thanks to two things
column3: You mean he plays well? Yeah, he often scores by free kicks in crucial games. But a football match is by no means merely a show of taking free kicks.
column4: Certainly not. What really counts is to play as a team, passing the ball amongst each other, dodging defenders. Free kicks are a result of all the teammates' collective efforts.However, a few free kicks often make everything different, especially scoring one such goal in the nick of time.
column5: In the case, maybe facial charm should be his leading card. After all, the majority of his fans are girls.
column6: Yes, his face looks are manly, with a straight nose and infinite eyes. As a man of medium height in the West, he keeps a powerful but elegant figure, looking neither lanky nor stout.
column7: And he is English! He makes a model gentleman when he puts on a black suit and speaks with a typical British accent.

column1: Oh that ’ s a lovely necklace.
column2: Thank you. My husband gave it to me.
column3: Oh I didn ’ t know you were married.
column4: Yes I am. I got married five years ago.
column5: Oh I see. That ’ s nice. Did you meet your husband at work?
column6: No, we met at university.

column1: Hello.
column2: Hi.
column3: How are you?
column4: I'm good. How are you?
column5: Good. Do you speak English?
column6: A little. Are you American?
column7: Yes.
column8: Where are you from?
column9: I'm from California.
column10: Nice to meet you.
column11: Nice to meet you too.

column3: It's possible because everyone wants to travel during the holiday weekend.
column4: I should have booked the tickets in advance.
column5: Take it easy. I'll like you know if anyone decides to cancel his reservation.

column1: Hi, how ’ re you doing?
column2: Terrible.
column3: Oh, what ’ s the matter?

column6: I ’ Ve already tried some but it didn ’ t help.
column7: Well, it ’ s necessary for you to see a doctor.
column8: Yeah, I guess I should.
column9: Well, you ’ d better get some rest.
column10: Thank you very much.
column11: Bye.

column1: How do I set up an E-mail account?
column2: Oh, that's easy. Go to www.onxiu.cn. Now, click on the link with the picture of an envelope.
column3: Which link?
column4: That one, the one that says Mail.
column5: Oh, no. What did I do? It's asking me for a password.
column6: Don't worry. See where it says, New User?
column7: Yes.
column8: Click on that.
column9: Oh, I see.
column10: Yeah, just fill out this form and choose a password. The computer will do the rest.

column1: Look! Mom, that's amazing! I can't believe the girls have so neat movements.
column2: Yeah, they all received very strict training. A minute on the stage takes ten-year practice.
column3: And all their movements are so elegant. It seems like dancing in the water.
column4: Exactly, you know, water ballet puts dancing, music and swimming together.
column5: There you go! Daddy has told me that water ballet is also called Synchronized Swimming.
column6: That's my boy! Katherine Curtis created this activity in 1920. And in 1984, it was authorized as one activity in Olympic Games.
column7: Wow, Mom is more knowledgeable than Dad. I must learn from you.
column8: My little boy, you should learn more from me. I'm almost thirty years older than you.
column9: OK, you're the boss. Look, Mom, one guy has just jumped into the swimming pool.
column10: Oh, my God. It's so dangerous. And he might break his leg. You mustn't do anything like that.

column1: Have you anything to declare ;
column2: One bottle of perfume and a watch.
column3: Where did you buy it?
column4: In Boston.
column5: Do you travel a lot?
column6: Oh... I go to see my sister twice a year or so.
column7: Twice a year? How long has your sister lived in Boston?
column8: Nearly ten years.
column9: I see, that's a long time. How much was the watch?
column10: I can't remember, but I've got the receipt somewhere. Would you like to see it?

column1: Excuse me. Who is the person responsible for handling complaints here? I would like to make a few complaints.
column2: I am the manager here. You can complain to me. How may I help you?

column4: I apologize for everything disturbing you. We will give another room to you right now. Please wait a moment.

column1: Did you put the blue bin out on the street?
column2: Oh, no. I forgot.
column3: Well, you'd better take it out front.
column4: What time does the recycle truck come by?
column5: It usually gets here at noon on Tuesday, which is tomorrow.
column6: I'll just take it out to the street tomorrow morning.
column7: Oh, no, you don't.
column8: What do you mean?
column9: Every morning you get up late and rush off to work late.
column10: Do you think I'll forget to do it?
column11: You'll remember to do it, but you won't have time to do it.
column12: Okay, I'll take it out front right now.

column1: Here we come.
column2: Thank you.What' s the fare?
column4: How can it be?
column5: Well, the rate is two dollars for the first two kilometers and twenty cents for each additional two hundred meters.
column6: I see. Thanks for your drive.

column1: You're being childish. Your nose will heal. And so will your pride, if you let it.

column4: Let's just say there could be some big changes around here.
column5: Is that right? Like what kind of changes?
column6: You'll see. Oh, yeah, you'll see.
column7: Come on, grow up. Have you seen Vince around?

column1: Let me help you with that.
column2: Thanks very much.
column3: You really shouldn't be lifting this by yourself.

column2: Yeah. My whole GPA is screwed up now.
column3: Why? What happened?
column4: Well, I bombed my econ final and ended up with a 1.7.
column5: Ouch. You must be very disappointed.
column6: Well, it's my fault because I didn't study as much as I should have.
column7: Why don't you re-take the class next year?
column8: That's what I plan on doing unless I keep screwing up. How did you do this semester?
column9: I didn't do that well either. I ended up with a 3.2 this semester. That drops my total GPA to 3.45.
column10: My GPA is pretty similar to yours. I have a 3.1 now because of the stupid econ class.
column11: What was your GPA before this semester?
column12: I was sitting happy with a 3.4.
column13: Why did it go down so much?
column14: Let's just say I screwed up more than my econ class.
column15: What happened to you?
column16: I started playing starcraft and ended up wasting a lot of time.
column17: You better stop slacking off.
column18: You're right. I'm not going to play games during school anymore.

column1: Is that room service?
column2: Yes.What can I do for you?
column3: The maid has just delivered some laundry to my room.But it's not mine at all.
column4: I am sorry.sir.We will send someone immediately.

column1: Hi, Sam. I want to buy a pet. Do you have any ideas ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: why? anything special there?
column4: it's more than special. You can find as many kinds of animals as you can put a name to and more.

column6: snakes? there are even rodents and monkeys! it's a world of exotic pets.
column7: that's terrific. I can't wait to check it out.
column8: Hang on. are you sure you want to keep a non-traditional pet?
column9: why not? it's so cool.
column10: but it will pose a risk to your health.

column1: I met Mark yesterday. He looked blue.
column2: He ’ s been on the gravy train these years, hasn ’ t he?
column3: It belongs to the past. He lost his job the other day, and he ’ s up a tree now.
column4: It seems that nobody can always expect things to pan out well each time.

column1: Have you bought a bus pass yet?
column2: I'm not getting one.
column3: Why is that?
column4: It's cheaper if I don't buy one.
column5: Buying a bus pass will save you money.
column6: How do you figure that?
column7: There's no limit to how often you can use your bus pass.
column8: Really?
column9: Plus, you don't have to use change for the bus anymore.
column10: I like that.
column11: You want to buy one now?
column12: I'm going to.

column1: Excuse me! What time is it? My watch stopped.
column2: Let me see. It's 9
column3: Is your watch right?
column4: I think so. I set it by the radio this morning.
column5: By the way, can you tell me what the date it is today, and what day it is, please?
column6: Well, it's the 10th and on the Tuesday.

column4: It was very good. I followed it right to the end.

column1: What's your number?
column2: I'm number seven. What about you?
column3: Five.
column4: Hah hah! You have to go before me.
column5: You think it's funny. I'm terrified.
column6: Don't worry. It's safe.
column7: But I've never jumped off anything in my life. The highest thing I've jumped off is my bed. I'm scared.
column8: You are the one who wanted to come here, Sandy. You should enjoy it.
column9: I guess I'm adventuresome, but then I'm scared too.
column10: I'm not too scared. But I've done sky diving before.

column1: Good morning, madam. I think I'm lost here. The place I want to go to is a hotel called the Hilton.
column2: Do you know in which area?
column3: No, I am sorry I have no idea. I am a stranger here.
column4: I see. Well, do you know anything near the hotel?
column5: Oh, yes. My friend told me the hotel was near the Central Railway Station.
column6: Then you'll have to take a bus and get off at the Central Railway Station.
column7: Can you show me where the Central Railway Station is on this map?
column8: OK.

column1: It's Chinese New Year! That means it's time to eat hot pot!
column2: Let's eat the kind that has both spicy and mild broth in one pot.
column3: You mean half-and-half?
column4: Yep. That way I can satisfy my craving for spicy food and you can eat hot pot without burning into flames.
column5: Good idea.

column1: Would you like to go to a party tonight?
column2: That sounds like a good idea.
column3: Would 7:00 be OK?
column4: That's fine. I'm looking forward to it.

column1: Would you be kind enough to lend me forty pounds?
column2: I'd really like to help you out, but I am broke myself.
column3: That's all right.

column1: So people can go and root for their old school team?
column2: Yep. And relive those good old high school days.
column3: You don't sound too excited about going to your reunion.
column4: I'm not. I get a stomachache just thinking about it.
column5: Are you nervous about meeting up with your ex, Femi?
column6: Ouch, that hurts — did you have to mention her name?

column1: I think my car can run much faster than yours.
column2: But mine equals yours in economy.
column3: That's true.

column1: Excuse me, do you go to the Central Park?

column7: Is it a long ride?
column8: No, not that long. Two more stops, and you'll get off, sir.
column9: OK. I know. Thank you.
column10: Not at all.

column1: Mary, this is your homeroom. It's 213. Remember that.
column2: What's a homeroom?
column3: You sit in there, listen to the morning announcement with other kids, and then you go to your classes.
column4: Cindy, I'm scared.
column5: But I have to go to my homeroom.
column6: Do we have the same classes today?
column7: No.
column8: Do you think the school can put us in the same homeroom?
column9: Stop worrying, Mary. You'll do just fine.

column1: What's your favourite steps ;
column2: It's hard to say. But I do love waltz very much.
column3: How about rumba?
column4: To tell the truth, I don't like it.
column5: Really? You must like tango, right?
column6: Oh, it's really beautiful, but I just can't dance it well.
column7: Don't be so modest. I'm sure you can dance it very well. Let's dance it now.
column8: OK. I'll have a try.
column9: Oh, you dance it so well.
column10: Thank you for your compliment.

column1: Hi, how is it going?
column2: Pretty good, Sam. Only the awful weather, you know.
column3: That ’ s right. I ’ Ve never really liked it since I got here.
column4: Me either, but I ’ m dealing with it anyway.

column1: Hi. Are you new in this class?
column2: Yes, I am. I really don ’ t know anyone.
column3: Did you just arrive in this country? You look a little nervous.
column4: No. I was here last semester, but I didn ’ t find out about this class in time. So I ’ m taking it this semester.
column5: I took this course last semester too. Now I am taking it again!
column6: How is it? Did you learn anything here? Why are you taking it again?
column7: Wow, you have a lot of questions! I learned a lot. In fact, that ’ s why I am taking it again. I get lots of practice in speaking, and also in writing. I ’ m sure you ’ ll be glad you took this course. I ’ ll even help you study if you ’ d like.
column8: That ’ s just what I need. Thanks so much. You ’ Ve been a big help already.

column1: Your 3.5 percent share is going to be worth at least a million.
column2: I need to be motivated, Vince.Multi - motivated. As in multi-million.
column3: What if I said no?
column4: Ever hear of WebTracker?
column5: You wouldn't! If you leave, you'll make nothing.
column6: I might make nothing even if I stay. For that kind of risk, I want to get rich.
column7: OK. If you sign the Stars.com account before WebTracker does, we'll talk next week.

column1: Good afternoon, Johnson.
column2: Good afternoon, Mary. How's business?
column3: Not bad, thanks.

column1: Hello, can I help you ;
column2: Yes, my engine warning light is on.
column3: How long has it been on for?
column4: Just since today.
column5: You can still drive, without problems.
column6: It runs fine.
column7: Let's check it out. There'll be a $ 45 charge to check it over. If you fix it with us, we'll include the $ 45 into your repair.
column8: Okay.
column9: Please write down your address and phone number, and sign here.
column10: Okay.

column1: Excuse me, can I have an earphone please?
column2: Sure, but you have to pay $ 3 for it.
column3: OK. Here you are.
column4: Well, ou can't hear music until takeoff.
column5: I see. Thank you.

column1: Welcome, Ron, come on in!
column2: Hi, Malia! What a nice home!
column3: We enjoy it too!
column4: How long have you lived here?
column5: About four years now.
column6: Well, it is very beautiful.
column7: Ron, have a seat and I'll get us something to drink.
column8: Good! I am really thirsty. You know it really is hot outside!
column9: I have lemonade, iced tea, and mango juice.
column10: Mango juice would be perfect. Thank you!

column1: Veronica! Veronica! Veronica! Are you OK?
column2: Steven! What ’ s going on! Who were those guys? I didn ’ t know you have a gun! What ’ s going on!
column3: I will come clean as soon as we get to safety, OK? For now, you have to trust me, please! I would never do anything to hurt you.
column4: Steven, I...
column5: I haven ’ t been completely honest with you Veronica, I ’ m sorry. I ’ m not a fireman. I ’ m not even from the United States. I ’ m a spy for the Indian government.
column6: What? Why didn ’ t you tell me before? What are you doing here?
column7: When I was a young boy, I used to play cricket my father back in my hometown of Hyderabad. It was a peaceful town, and my father was a renowned chemist. One day, he was approached by members of the CIA, claiming that my father had made the discovery of the millennium in his small lab back at the university where he taught bio-chemistry. I never saw him again. I vowed to discover the whereabouts of my father and consequently joined the Indian Intelligence Bureau.
column8: What does that have to do with those men shooting at us? Most importantly, why did you lie to me!
column9: I ’ m sorry, I wasn ’ t supposed to meet you. I wasn ’ t supposed to fall in love with you, but you have to believe me when I tell you that what I feel for you is real.
column10: I can ’ t believe this! Why are all these things happening to me! I can ’ t take it anymore! Let me out of the car!
column11: Veronica, wait!

column1: Isn't it wonderful walking here?
column2: What do you mean?
column3: I mean look at all these magnificent buildings around us.
column4: Yes, look over there. That's the Empire State Building. My book says it's 102 stories tall.
column5: It's quite famous but don't you think it looks a bit old-fashioned?
column6: You're right, but when it was built in 1930 it was a marvel of technology and engineering.
column7: What other important buildings are we going to see on Fifth Avenue?
column8: Quite a number. Actually every skyscraper has a history. A few blocks ahead we'll see St.Patrick' s Cathedral and just across the street will be the world-renowed Rockefeller Center. It's a landmark in the history of architecture.
column9: What's there after that?
column10: Well then, there's a Central Park. Facing the park on Fifth Avenue is probably some of the most expensive properties in the world.
column11: What are they all for?
column12: Most of them are office buildings, huge department stores, and hotels but some are just private homes. New York is one of the financial centers of the world. And there are lots of very expensive places.

column1: wow, it that your sports car ;
column2: yes, do you like it?
column3: I love it! I used to always want to drive a green jaguar. Is it in good condition?
column4: it looks good on the outside, but the inside is a different story. It needs a lot of servicing before it can go out on the roads again.
column5: what's wrong with it?
column6: well, first of all, it needs a new engine, which is extremely expensive.
column7: when's the last time you had it serviced?
column8: it must have been a few years ago now.
column9: I thought all cars needed regular servicing on a yearly basis.
column10: they do. Once my son was born, there was no reason to drive this car anymore. It's only a two-seater, you know!

column1: I just have to come up for air. I ’ Ve been here for too long a time.
column2: OK. You ’ d better come back in two hours.

column1: My sister was taken to the hospital yesterday
column2: What happened?
column3: She was hit by a car. Luckily, she wasn't seriously hurt.
column4: Let's buy some flowers, and pay her a visit
column5: We'll have to hurry ; visiting hours will be over soon
column6: OK. Let's go

column1: Excuse me, could you tell me how to get to the school clinic? I've lost my way.
column2: Yes. Go straight ahead till you come to the traffic lights, turn left there and it's the first turning on the right.
column3: Straight ahead to the traffic lights, left and then right.
column4: That's it. It'll take you about five minutes.
column5: Thank you very much.

column1: It's a fine day today, isn't it?
column2: Yes, it is.It' s wonderful after the downpour.
column3: How nice seeing the sun back again! The air is so fresh.
column4: I hope it stays nice like this for a long period of time.
column5: Well, the weather is so unpredictable this time of year.
column6: You're right.We don't know what is going to be like tomorrow.
column7: Look! It looks as if it is going to rain.
column8: The weatherman predicts a fine day today.
column9: The weather is often quite different from the weather forecast.

column1: What can I do ;
column2: The system crashed when I was surfing on the internet.
column3: Did you go to any illegal website?
column4: No, But does that matter?
column5: Yes, your computer can be easily infected by virus if you do that.
column6: I see. I'd better never try.
column7: That's wise.
column8: Do you know what's wrong with my PC?
column9: One minute. Oh, yes, it was infected by a virus, and you had no antivirus software.
column10: Is anti-virus software necessary for a PC?

column1: I'm calling to ask about your apartment you advertised.
column2: Yes, we've got great apartments with charming environment and nice scenery.And they are all newly renovated.
column3: That sounds fantastic! But I am looking for something closer to downtown, as I spend most of my time at the office.
column4: No problem. We have a nice apartment located near the Oriental Square. It's perfect for people busy with office work. It is fully furnished with a service staff taking care of the trivial details.
column5: I'm sure they are wonderful, but I need an unfurnished apartment with relatively lower cost.
column6: Ah! I get your point. We have just what you need. Our Jinyuan apartments have several floor plans. The one bedroom apartments are very economical, but their layout makes great use of a small amount of space. I think you can find a very apartment there.
column7: Great! I'll arrange a viewing after work tomorrow afternoon. Could you tell me the detailed dress?
column8: Of course. It's just at 19 Lingual Road. You can phone me again if you can't find the right place.
column9: OK. Thank you.

column1: Jack and Mary broke up ;
column2: It ’ s so sad. They had been together for only two months. Do you know what the matter was?
column3: Mary said Jack was cheating on her. Jack was seeing a girl from his hometown. One day, May saw them holding hands and ended the relationship immediately.
column4: Really? I ’ m very surprised. He doesn ’ t look like a guy who ’ d ever do that sort of thing, right?
column5: No, he doesn ’ t. Anyway, she found out that he had been two-timing her for a long time.
column6: Maybe it is for the best. They are not suitable for each other because they have nothing in common and are completely different people.
column7: How so?
column8: He is an extrovert while she is an introvert. He likes parties while she hates them.
column9: Poor Mary! She really liked him.
column10: Anyway, she was right to end things and she deserves better.

column1: Brooke, I have bad news.
column2: What!
column3: I called the airlines to reconfirm the reservations today.
column4: Don't you dare tell me that...
column5: I'm sorry. I didn't reconfirm in time and they gave away half of the seats.
column6: Well, they should have called you!
column7: They said that they did. I've been so busy...
column8: And you didn't think to leave them my cell phone?
column9: I didn't think there would be a problem.
column10: It's the holidays! Everybody knows how hard it is to get tickets!
column11: I'm sorry. We're still going. I got reservations for all of us on the 31st. It will be OK. Trust me.
column12: Trust you! You can't even handle simple plane reservations!
column13: Brooke!

column1: Thank you for bringing me here Hong, this place looks great!
column2: You ’ re welcome. Would you like some cold dishes?
column3: Let me see. How about the lotus root?
column4: Ok, and anything to drink? Maybe some jasmine tea?
column5: Oh, yes that would be nice.
column6: And for your main course? I can recommend the sizzling beef.
column7: Actually, I ’ m vegetarian so I ’ d like to have the bean curd.
column8: Oh, that ’ s a good choice. Very healthy too.

column1: Excuse me, do you have any English songs?
column2: Yes, we do. They are all in this book.
column3: Great, thanks.
column4: No problem. Just give us a few minutes more to pull them up, though. We don ’ t get that many English singers!
column5: Oh, I see.

column1: What a wonderful dinner!
column2: Thank you. I am glad that you are enjoying it.
column3: Where did you get your fantastic recipes?
column4: I grew up cooking. My mother shared her recipes with me.
column5: I especially like the wonderful chicken dish.
column6: That is a special coconut ginger chicken with rice dish.
column7: Is that shrimp in the soup?
column8: Yes, do you like it? I added a little extra lemon grass and some sea vegetables.
column9: I am happy that the wine I brought for you works well with this meal.
column10: Yes, thank you for bringing the wine. It really complements the meal.

column1: All I do all day is work and watch TV. I really should start thinking about my health.
column2: I never thought about that, but you're right. What do you think we should do?
column3: For starters, we should start doing more outdoor activities. That way we'll get some exercise.
column4: I was thinking about taking tennis lessons. I always have an hour to spare in the afternoon. What do you think about that?
column5: That's not a bad idea. How much is it?
column6: I heard it is only about one hundred twenty dollars a month for 8 lessons.
column7: Playing tennis twice a week will be a good start. Count me in.

column1: How did I do?
column2: Do you really want to know?
column3: Yes, I do.
column4: You did pretty bad.
column5: Exactly how bad?
column6: You didn't pass the test.
column7: I don't understand how I could've failed it.
column8: There are a few reasons why you failed.
column9: What are the reasons?
column10: The main reason is the fact that you're a horrible driver.
column11: Can I take the test again?
column12: You'll be able to take the test again in a couple weeks.

column1: Could you tell me what university you want to go to, John ;
column2: Pardon?
column3: What university would you enter?
column4: University? Why? You asked me last year.
column5: Oh, I forget. Sorry.
column6: I went to Harvard University.
column7: Did you? And what course did you take there?
column8: God save me! Is there anything wrong with you? Didn't I tell you?
column9: I've not known. Perhaps, I've got a bad memory.
column10: I did a B. A. in economics. Remember?

column1: Good Morning.What can I do for you?
column2: Good Morning, I have a bad cough, and I want to see an internist.
column3: Do you have a registration card?
column4: No, I don ’ t. I' m a tourist.
column5: Then you need to register as a new patient.Can I have a look at you ID card? I need your name, age, occupation, address and contacting number.
column6: Here you are.
column7: Thanks. Which kind of medicine do you prefer, western medicine or traditional Chinese medicine?
column8: I ’ d like to try traditional Chinese medicine. I heard it really works quite well if you know what you're doing.
column9: All right. Yes, he does. The registration fee is 7 yuan, please.

column1: Taxi!
column2: Where to?
column3: Beijing International Airport. Would you please help me with my baggage?
column4: Certainly. Let's put the suitcase in the boot.
column5: Thank you. I've got just 50 minutes to go. Can we manage?
column6: Take it easy. We should be able to make it unless we get caught in a traffic jam.
column7: I can't afford to miss my 9:40 flight.
column8: Don't worry. The traffic is smooth. You will be there in time for your flight.

column1: Excuse me, could you tell me how to get to the school clinic? I've lost my way.
column2: Yes. Go straight ahead till you come to the traffic lights, turn left there and it's the first turning on the right.
column3: Straight ahead to the traffic lights, left and then right.
column4: That's it. It'll take you about five minutes.
column5: Thank you very much.

column1: Excuse me, I want to go to Galion by ship. Is there a ship to Dalian?
column2: Yes, there is. There is only one ship there every day.
column3: What time does it leave?
column4: It leaves at 9:30 a. m..
column5: Could you please tell me about the cabins?
column6: Yes, all the cabins are fit for two.
column7: Then where can I catch it?
column8: At Pier Five.
column9: Thank you.

column1: Do you have everything?
column2: Let's see... my ID card, my passport, and my suitcase. I'm pretty sure I've got everything.

column1: How are the children doing in your class, Jane ;
column2: They ’ re all doing fine. Let me show you some of their pictures.

column4: That ’ s Charles.
column5: What a large child!
column6: All my children are large.
column7: And which child is this?
column8: That ’ s James.
column9: What an agile child!
column10: All my children are agile.

column1: Where did you go yesterday?
column2: I went to play tennis in the public park.
column3: How often do you play tennis?

column5: I seldom play tennis. I prefer football and basketball.
column6: What is very difficult to gather team player together.
column7: I usually play with my school-mates.
column8: Do you like watching football matches?
column9: Yes. I went to Tinge Sport Centre for football match last Sunday.

column1: Excuse me, but please empty your pockets of all the metal things and put them in this tray.

column3: Yes, and please step over there.
column4: All right. What shall I do now?
column5: Just open your bags so we can check them. After that you can pick them up right behind that X-ray machine.
column6: I've got film in my bag.
column7: That's all right. This machine will not damage the film.
column8: That's fine.
column9: Can I have your boarding pass? We need to stamp it.
column10: Sure. Here you are.
column11: Thank you.
column12: Am I through now?
column13: Yes. Here is your boarding pass.
column14: Thank you and goodbye.

column1: May I take your order ;
column2: We haven't decided yet. Could you give us a little longer?
column3: Yes, take your time, please.
column4: Can we get something to drink? We want two bottles of beer.
column5: Fine.
column6: Could you tell us your specials today?
column7: The special today is steak.
column8: We'll take this steak dinner.
column9: What would you like to go with your steak?
column10: Peas and carrots.

column1: Where can I find the produce?
column2: Aisle A is where you'll find all the produce.
column3: What sales do they have today?
column4: I'm sure something is on sale. Please check with the produce person.

column1: I ’ m so relieved that your ankle wasn ’ t broken! I feel just awful about this whole thing. I wanna make it up to you. Let me take you out to dinner tonight. My treat.
column2: That sounds great! I ’ d love to! Here is my address. Pick me up at eight?
column3: Perfect!
column4: Thank you for such a lovely evening! The food was amazing, and I had a great time.
column5: Me too.You look so beautiful tonight! I wish this night would never end.There ’ s something I have to tell you...
column6: What is it?
column7: I woke up today thinking this would be just like any other ordinary day, but I was wrong. A twist of fate brought us together. I crashed into your life and you into mine, and this may sound crazy, but I ’ m falling in love with you, Veronica.

column1: does your family have a record of your ancestors?
column2: sure. My mom has been working on our family tree for years. She ’ s always updating it.
column3: do you have a copy of your family tree in your house? I ’ d love to see it.
column4: I can show it to you now, if you like. I think it goes back about 8 generations so far.
column5: that ’ s amazing. Do you have a large extended family?
column6: I ’ Ve got 30 cousins on my mom ’ s side and 10 cousins on my dad ’ s side.
column7: are you very close to your first-cousins?
column8: the ones that are my age are close relatives. Now that I ’ m older, I don ’ t spend as much time with them as I used to, so I don ’ t know my younger cousins as well as the older ones.
column9: I see. who ’ s the head of your household?
column10: it ’ s definitely my mother. And, her mother is definitely the matriarch of the bigger family.
column11: that ’ s interesting. What does your grandfather think of your step-mother?
column12: at first, she was quite critical of her, but now that they ’ Ve been married for a few years, she ’ s starting to accept the fact that my father divorced my mother.
column13: that ’ s pretty much how you feel about your step-mother. Like grandmother, like grandson.

column1: Where's Mrs. Johnson?
column2: Just call her Lisa, Mary. She's cooking dinner.
column3: I see. Can I sit down?
column4: Of course! Make yourself at home.
column5: Thank you, Mr. Johnson.
column6: Please, just call me Tom.
column7: Okay, Tom.
column8: Where's Cindy?
column9: She's upstairs in my room.
column10: Can you tell her to come downstairs? We're about to have dinner.

column1: I didn't expect to see you at this hour. You must have goofed off again.
column2: Goofed off? Maybe, but I'm not a clock-watcher. I finished doing what I should do and then knock off an hour earlier.
column3: You'll be sorry if the boss finds it out. He may probably give you the bag.
column4: I'm sure of what I'm doing.

column1: I am thinking about inviting you to a dinner. When would you have time? And what kind of food do you fancy?
column2: That would be great. I am really in the mood for a spicy hotpot. Any special reason for the invitation?
column3: To thank you for helping me at work last week. If you would not have been so kind, I would not have been able to pick my parents from the airport. You really did me a big favor. Thank you so much.
column4: It was my pleasure. How about this evening? I feel very hungry now.
column5: Fine, I know a good hotpot place in the downtown area, food there is pretty spicy too. Shall we try that one?
column6: Ok with me. You are the boss. I will meet you downstairs after work.

column1: Long time no see!
column2: Yes. It has been a long time since the last time we met.
column3: It's nice to see you again. Have you changed jobs?
column4: No. I've been visiting relatives recently.
column5: That's nice. Where have you been?
column6: I went to visit an uncle in San Francisco.
column7: Are you busy now?
column8: No. Why?
column9: How about a coffee in that cafe?
column10: Great. Let's talk over coffee.

column1: How's your father been?
column2: He's been out of work for a couple of days.
column3: What's wrong with him?
column4: He has a bad cold.
column5: Well, tell him to take it easy and that I hope he feels better.
column6: Thanks. I'll tell him.

column1: Hello. Thank you for calling Spend Mart.
column2: Is this the Customer Service Desk?
column3: Yes. How can I help you?
column4: I bought a sweater from your store a week ago. It says size 12. But actually, it is a size 10. Can I exchange it?
column5: Do you have the receipt with you?
column6: Yes, I do.
column7: I like to apologize for the problem. Please come down with your receipt and sweater to exchange it for the size you want.
column8: Thank you very much.
column9: You ’ re welcome.

column1: I have puzzled my brain about how to teach the children.
column2: What is your problem?
column3: My children can never be obedient even if I criticized them severely.
column4: You need not always do that. Why don ’ t you pat them on the back occasionally?

column1: You should save some money on parking here.
column2: Yeah, I don ’ t have to pay for a space on the street.
column3: Really? How long did it take you to find a spot yesterday?
column4: Well, last night it took me half an hour to find a spot when I came home from work.
column5: You get home late, don ’ t you?
column6: Yeah, around seven. Most of the street parking is gone by then.
column7: Ah, well. You can ’ t have everything.
column8: Yeah. I can live with it. It ’ s great to be living alone.

column2: Is she really? I can ’ t believe it!
column3: Yes. Yesterday.
column4: Good gracious. That ’ s incredible!
column5: She married Jerrod.
column6: You ’ re kidding.
column7: She ’ s going to live in Paris.
column8: Really? I ’ m surprised.

column1: Don't worry. I'm sure you'll do better next time.
column2: I didn't realize it was so difficult though I know I'm always too nervous in such competition.
column3: It doesn't matter. Forget it.
column4: I don't think I performed well.

column7: There's no secret at all. The only thing for you to do is to practice more. You will succeed.
column8: Thank you for your encouragement.
column9: It's a pleasure. Come on. I'm on your side.

column1: Titanic made a hit! It was so touching.
column2: But I see things rather differently.The heroin is not attractive and her acting is just so-so.

column3: What will you do this vacation?
column4: Travel.

column1: What can I offer you here?

column5: Oh, we are skillful in doing that. You can trust us. Our shop has a history of more than 20 years.
column6: It seems I find the right place.
column7: Yes, absolutely! We have a very good reputation in the neighborhood.
column8: When can I have my trousers if I bring it to you tomorrow?
column9: If you like you can wait here. They will be ready in one hour and a half.
column10: All right. See you tomorrow.

column1: He is so kind. I couldn ’ t believe he murdered his wife.
column2: Of course not. I believe he ’ s innocent.
column3: I don ’ t understand.
column4: He nursed a viper in his bosom. His best friend Tony foamed him in. Tony first seduced his wife and then trapped him.

column1: Could we borrow the company van for a fundraiser this weekend?

column5: We will need it for both days.

column8: It needs to be back on Sunday night. Can you arrange for that?
column9: Oh yeah, no problem. Would you mind if we borrowed a few of the chairs from the lunchroom.
column10: Just keep track of everything and get it all back where you took it from by Sunday evening.

column1: Hello. Good morning, Stately Restaurant. May I help you?

column4: For four people. We'd like a quiet table with a fine view of the river.

column6: This is Peter Kaufman.
column7: Can you spell that, please?
column8: Peter Kaufman, P-E-T-E-R ( Peter ), K-A-U-F-M-A-N ( Kaufman ).
column9: Oh, thanks, Mr. Kaufman. We look forward to your visit.
column10: Bye-bye.

column1: It sure is hot today.

column1: Peter, how often do you exercise?

column6: Oh yes, and fruit, I love fruit.
column7: What do you drink?
column8: Well, I never drink alcohol, coffee or tea. They are very bad for you.
column9: What do you drink?

column5: All the laundry will be ready by 5

column1: Oh, my God. I can't take it any more ;
column2: What's wrong, honey? Take it easy.
column3: I am tired of doing that boring work. I just repeat doing counting everyday. It's so terrible.
column4: Me too. But I think we can do something else for a change.
column5: You know I work with my professional knowledge not passion. Sometimes I don't know what the meaning of working is?
column6: But you did a good job. You always perform the best in our company.
column7: Yes, that's in the past. Maybe I need to go to my psychologist for help.
column8: Perhaps you've just tired and you need a vacation.
column9: I was full of ambitions before. But now I have no aim for my career.
column10: Maybe we should keep on studying to enrich our knowledge and make our life exciting.

column1: Oh, come on, Ultraman ;
column2: What's up, Bro? What's in the bulletin?
column3: It says that there will be a blackout from 5 p. m. to 7 p. m. in our neighborhood today.
column4: Blackout? Even the TV has the limit.
column5: Don't you know you will look like a monster in the blackout?
column6: Oops, no, Daddy can't watch American Idol, either!
column7: That's not the point. Come on, can you imagine that there will be no electricity on such a hot day?
column8: Oh, my god! No air-conditioner!
column9: OK, since you are the smart one, can you come up with a better plan? So that we won't be baked like cookies here.
column10: How about playing Barbie out there in the neighborhood?

column1: I'm a little nervous.
column2: Don't worry. You'll be fine. First of all, put on your seat belt. Adjust the mirrors.
column3: You don't think I'll need the seat belt, do you?
column4: Of course not. But it's a good habit to put it on every time you drive.
column5: Just in case, right?
column6: Right. Hold the steering wheel with your hands at ten o'clock and two o'clock.

column1: How beautiful the flower is!
column2: Really, it's so beautiful.
column3: You like it. Well, I'll gather in for you.
column4: You mustn't pick it in this place.

column6: It's a private garden.

column1: Have you made up your mind?

column5: I need to continue to deal with my business. I haven ’ t finished it yet.
column6: Oh, I see. Would you like me to reschedule you for another time?
column7: No. Thank you.
column8: But you have to pay the fee for refund.
column9: OK. I will pay it by my bank card.

column1: I heard that Jim lost 100 yuan. Do you know that?
column2: I don't know.
column3: Really?
column4: Yes.
column5: But some classmates said you took the money.
column6: It is not true.
column7: Look at my eyes.

column9: Return the money to Jim and make an apology. I think he will forgive you.

column1: Happy Mother's Day, Mom!

column4: I forgot what I put up with. In that case, I do deserve these flowers.

column1: How are you tonight, sir?
column2: Oh, not too bad. I'm just glad the weekend's finally here.
column3: I know what you mean. What can I get for you?
column4: Give me a screwdriver on the rocks.
column5: One screwdriver, coming right up. ( He mixes the drink. ) Here you are, sir.
column6: Thanks.

column1: As we know, mobile phones bring people great convenience and shorten the distance among friends and relatives.
column2: It bears a great many of advantages, but also some weak points.
column3: Is it? I've never thought of any disadvantages of the mobile phone.
column4: For instance, the mobile phone seriously distracts the attention of people from work and study.
column5: That's true. Some people pay too much attention to their mobile phones.
column6: Actually, it's not the fault of the mobile phone. But people should have a proper attitude towards it. Mobile phone is a tool serving people, not the fetters restricting them.

column1: What was that all about?
column2: We had a difference of opinion.
column3: Is she going to be okay?
column4: She'll be fine.

column1: Good evening. Do you have a reservation?
column2: No, we don't.
column3: How many people are you together?
column4: Just two people.
column5: Would you like to sit in a smoking section, a non-smoking section or whatever comes open first?
column6: We prefer non-smoking section.
column7: I am awfully sorry but there are no vacancies left now. Would you like to wait for a moment?
column8: How long a wait do you think there ’ ll be?
column9: I think about ten minutes.
column10: Ok, we'll wait a while.
column11: I am sorry for making you wait so long. Now there is a table available in non-smoking section. Please follow me.
column12: Thank you.
column13: This is the menu. Are you ready to order now?
column14: Well, I think I'd like to have a tomato sausage soup first. And the same for him, please.
column15: Yes, and what would you like to drink?
column16: One goblet of red wine and one bottle of beer please.
column17: Would you like a dessert?
column18: What special kind of desserts do you have?
column19: Lemon pie, hot cake in syrup, chocolate sundae and custard pudding.
column20: Well, I think we will order after we finish the main course.
column21: All right. I'll bring your soup right away.

column1: Do you like plum blossoms?
column2: Certainly. I prefer the winter and I love plum blossoms much more.
column3: It's snowing heavily. What about taking a walk?
column4: Seeking plum blossoms with stepping on the snow? That's a good idea. Let's go!
column5: What a heavy snow!
column6: Take care! Don't slip down to the ground.
column7: I've got it. I like the sound of stepping on the snow very much.
column8: Yes. Very wonderful.
column9: Do you smell the sweet scent?
column10: Yes. It should be the fragrance of plum blossoms.
column11: The fragrance of plum blossoms comes from the hard coldness.

column1: I'm going to America.
column2: Any idea when you'll leave?
column3: I hope before the end of the month.
column4: Let me know when you find out.

column1: Is there anything I can do for you?

column3: That's a good place to go at this time. How about this route?
column4: It looks fine. Is this an inclusive tour?
column5: No, sir, you have to deal with your own meal since we charge you only $ 80 for the trip.

column1: What are you going to have for breakfast?
column2: I just have some cereal each morning.
column3: You're supposed to always have a hearty breakfast.
column4: I don't always have time to make breakfast.
column5: It's easy to make a quick breakfast.
column6: What do you have for breakfast?
column7: When I need to make a quick breakfast, I just make some oatmeal, toast, and OJ.

column9: It's not time consuming at all.
column10: It doesn't take much time to make?
column11: Would you like me to make something?
column12: Why don't you make me some oatmeal and toast?

column7: I can come down and fix that for you if you'd like.

column9: How does this afternoon at 2:30 sound to you?
column10: That would be perfect.

column1: Did you watch TV last night, Rose?
column2: Yeah. I saw a science program. It was quite interesting.
column3: What was it about?
column4: Mars. Scientists say there might be water on it.
column5: If so, we may live there someday.
column6: I hope so. Did you know the US successfully sent two robotic explorers to Mars last month?
column7: Sure. I heard about this on the TV. On January 3rd, 2004, Explorer Spirit landed near the so-called Guser Crater. And three weeks later, Spirit's twin explorer, Opportunity, landed on Meridian Planum named by scientists.
column8: Yes. Both have sent back pictures of the planet. And the latter did a better job.

column1: For the 100th anniversary of the opening of the library we are going to have a party.

column7: Yes. And we checked with the city and we have permission to use the park adjacent to the library.

column1: I ’ m so excited, mother. Oh, a new baby!

column9: You ’ re right.

column5: I'm serious.
column6: All right. Next time you will treat.

column10: You should call the Housekeeping Department on 2300. They will replace any stock for you immediately.

column1: I ’ m sorry, dad. But you can ’ t do that. It ’ s for me to decide.

column1: I find that you spend little on handset charge every month. Have you any trick?

column8: In hospitals or on planes, handsets will interfere with some equip-ment, so we must close our handsets. If you set call transfer, the problem will be solved.

column1: Are the ceremony and reception held in the same place?
column2: No, not usually. Most people are married in a church, and then the wedding party and guests go to another place for the reception. Sometimes, however, they hold the reception in a big room in the church.
column3: Where do they go?
column4: Either they go to a public place such as a hotel, a restaurant, or a club, or to the home of the brid
column5: They go to the home of the bride?
column6: Why do you ask?
column7: The Chinese custom is to go to the groom's home-just the opposite.
column8: Oh! In our country the bride's family is responsible for the entire wedding-arrangement, costs, etc. So the reception is held at her home.
column9: That's very expensive for the family of the bride.
column10: Many American furthers joke that they would rather hold the ladder for their daughter to climb down and elope than pay for a wedding.
column11: Tell me something about the bridal bouquet. Isn't it the custom to throw it?
column12: Yes. When the bride and groom are ready to leave on their honeymoon all the single girls gather in one place. The bride stands with her back to them and throws her bouquet over her shoulder and they each try to catch it. The one who does will be the next one married.
column13: Maybe I'll be the one.

You can conveniently pay by credit card, so the whole transaction only takes a couple of minutes. They also provide e-tickets, meaning you don ’ t need to go to any office to pick an air ticket. You go to the airport directly and check in with your ID card.

column4: Yes, therefore they are expanding the scope of their service. For example, hotels can be booked through the same site as well.

column1: I ’ Ve had it! I ’ m done working for a company that is taking me nowhere!
column2: So what are you gonna do? Just quit?
column3: That ’ s exactly what I am going to do! I ’ Ve decided to create my own company! I ’ m going to write up a business plan, get some investors and start working for myself!
column4: Have you ever written up a business plan before?
column5: Well, no.it can ’ t be that hard! I mean, all you have to do is explain your business, how you are going to do things and that ’ s it, right?
column6: You couldn ’ t be more wrong! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less. Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has, history, etc.
column7: Well, that seems easy enough.
column8: Wait, there ’ s more! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services. What they are and how they are different from competitors ’? Then comes the hard part, a market analysis. You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage, where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea.
column9: Geez. Is that all?
column10: Almost, the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis. Here you will calculate and estimate sales, cash flow and profits. After all, people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment!
column11: Umm. I think I ’ ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business!

column1: It's amazing to me how international business has become. Take my store for example. On any given day, you will find imported items from more than 20 different countries on our shelves.
column2: How many different varieties of products do you import from China?
column3: China provides the bulk of our product inventory, for sure. We import more than 40 different items from China. Most of the imports that come out of China are low-grade plastics or toys. Japan produces many electronic exports, Germany produces excellent mechanical exports.
column4: Do you import any food items?
column5: Generally speaking, food items are difficult to import. Food with the short shelf life is liable to spoil in the time it takes to ship from one place to another. The only food items we import are specialty canned or preserved foods. The shelf life is longer for these products.

column1: I think the government needs a radical plan to improve things. The government just talks, but in the long run, nothing is done to improve the economy.

column3: Well, income taxes were decreased last year in hope to give the economy a boost, but I think it's backfired. The immediate effect of the tax reduction was to cause inflation to rise.
column4: The worst part is that the inflation hurts the poor more than the rich. It also leads to more unemployment in the long run. I don't know what a good solution would be to make the economy more vibrant again...
column5: I have a good solution... We need some new blood! We should get rid of this president and boat in some new leaders!

But, what if I'm wrong. Maybe she's just been nice to me out of courtesy and doesn't think of me that way. Oh... forget it. This was a bad idea.

column1: Is there a lot of crime in your city?
column2: There ’ s some, but I don ’ t think it ’ s a big problem. A lot of it is petty crime, burglary and car theft. There ’ s very little major crime.
column3: It ’ s the same in my city. We also have a lot of drug addicts. A lot of the crime is committed by drug addicts who need money for drugs.
column4: That happens in many places. In my city, there is a very good drug rehabilitation program. The police and courts are also tough on people who commit crimes, but I don ’ t know if that ’ s the reason for our relatively low crime rate.
column5: Some people believe that a tough approach is better. Other prefer a more lenient approach.
column6: I think that the best way to reduce crime is to spread wealth more evenly. If most people have similar amounts of money, they will not think of stealing from others.
column7: That ’ s possible, but I ’ m not sure it would really happen like that.

column13: I've always been into it. Have you always liked classical music?
column14: not really. When I was little, we didn't really listen to music at all.
column15: so, how did you become interested in it?
column16: well, when I was about 10 years old, I started playing the piano. I think that's how it all started.
column17: do you still play piano?
column18: yes, it's one of my hobbies.

column1: I've heard of ground-level ozone but can you explain what it is exactly?
column2: Yes, it's one of the main air pollutants. Factories don't emit it directly into the air. It's actually formed when nitrogen oxides and VOC emissions come into contact with heat and sunlight.
column3: Sorry? What does VOC stand for?
column4: Oh, Vous are' volatile organic compounds'. That's a technical term for solvents or other chemicals found in things like paint.
column5: So, what damage does ozone do to the environment?
column6: Well, it can cause smog, which can affect people's health - especially people with breathing difficulties.

column1: Do you mind if I get a lift in your car, please?
column2: I don ’ t see any problem, only the car is a bit old.
column3: Oh you ’ re so kind!
column4: Get in.

column1: Excuse me, I ’ Ve been waiting here for fifteen minutes.Do you know why the traffic is so heavy?
column2: A lorry overturned on the road and blocked it, so all the traffic was held up.
column3: Oh, what a terrible situation! This traffic is unbearable.
column4: Yeah, traffic was brought to a standstill by the accident. If we had gone early we would miss the traffic.
column5: I agree with you. But now we have to wait. The sky is overcast, and it is very sultry. I fear a thunder storm is brewing.
column6: Don ’ t worry. The traffic jam is said to be over soon.
column7: Yes, I hope so. Thank you for telling me this.
column8: It ’ s my pleasure.

column10: In the same way, probably.

column1: David, imagine meeting you here!
column2: Janice, I found you stole my vegetables at four o'clock this morning. Is that true?
column3: All right! I stayed up yesterday and waited for your vegetables. I stole your peaches and flowers.
column4: It is so hard to prevent them from being stolen. I also got something this morning.
column5: How many vegetables do you steal today?
column6: I stole many from Fred's farm, and from yours. I planned to have a dog on farm.
column7: So funny. By stealing, I forgot all my sorrows and pressure from work.
column8: I could not agree with you more. For us, there are so many unhappy things and I am so bored ; however, I got lots of fun from stealing.
column9: I really want to be far away from the reality now.
column10: But we still need to go back to it. Don't overdo it.

column1: where are you going, Jane?
column2: I'm going to the hospital to see Susan.
column3: I saw her yesterday. She was a little better.
column4: Must I catch a number 7 bus to get there?
column5: No, you needn't. A number 13 bus will also take you to the hospital.
column6: Number 13 buses run much more frequently, don't they?
column7: Yes. I caught a number 7 bus yesterday, and they said I had taken a wrong bus.
column8: Thank you, Henry. I'll get a number 13.
column9: But number 13 buses leave from the center of town. You'll have to walk two miles to catch one.

column1: Nowadays, ships and boats are no longer so important in transportation as they used to be.
column2: True. With the extension of railways and highways, and the improvement of safety and capacity of airplanes, ships and boats have been giving place to trains, planes and automobiles.
column3: I read in the newspapers that the passenger liners from Shanghai to Ningpo and Dalian have been out of business ; and the liners up and down the Yangtze River have been reduced by 70 %.
column4: The pace of life of people is now getting faster and faster, so the speed of ships and boats seems to be so slow. I think it may be the reason why people don't like to travel by boat.
column5: But the most of the transoceanic cargo transportation is still carried by boat.

column1: Excuse me. Would you tell me where The People's Park is?
column2: The People's Park is located on Nanjing Road, near Limbo road, just on the opposite side of the International Hotel.
column3: How long will it take me to get there?
column4: Only about twenty minutes.

column6: No, you aren't. Just go ahead, please.
column7: May I take a bus to get there?
column8: You can take the No. 22 trolley bus to get there.

column1: Would you like to stretch your legs ;

column3: Let's get a soft drink.

column5: It's a fifteen-minute intermission.

column8: I can't agree more.

column10: In the United States, yes. But back in China, I went to concerts a couple of times with my parents.

column2: Thank you. Nice to meet you too. I'm John. Is this your first time to take a long-distance trip on plane.

column5: Oh, that's too bad. Do you get a good knowledge of China?
column6: Yes, whenever I think about China, I'd see the Tian'an Men Square. China is a very beautiful country. And I've seen many landmarks in China but I like the Great Wall most.
column7: All of the Chinese are proud of the Great Wall. And it was built before the In dynasty near Shan Haiguan-the First Pass in the World.
column8: Was it built before the In dynasty? I thought it was in the Ming dynasty.
column9: No, before the In dynasty.
column10: Oh, yeah. Thought I am an American, I know quite a lot about China and I like Chinese tea very well.

column1: Honey. The cottages harmonize well with the landscape.That tourist resort is worth travelling to.

column1: How have you been feeling lately?
column2: I ’ Ve been feeling a little light-headed lately.
column3: Has your blood pressure been high before?

column6: What do you use to check for high blood pressure?
column7: I am going to put a cuff on you to get a reading.
column8: What does the reading tell you?
column9: I get an idea of the pressure in your arteries when your heart is pumping blood versus at rest.
column10: I hope that the test results show me to be really healthy.

column1: Good morning, sir. May I help you?

column5: Just a moment, please. I'll draw up your bill for you... Thank you for waiting, sir. Your bill totals two thousand six hundred and fifty-eight yuan, including the phone and laundry.
column6: That much! Would you mind letting me have a look at it?
column7: Not at all, sir. Here you are.
column8: Thanks. Well, It seems to be right. How much is that in dollars, please?
column9: Just a moment, sir. I'll calculate that for you. It comes to 305 dollars and 52 cents at today's exchange rate.
column10: I see. OK.
column11: How would you like to make the payment?
column12: In cash, please. Here you are.
column13: Thank you, sir... Here is your change. Could you check it, please? Thank you for choosing our hotel. I hope you enjoyed your stay.
column14: By the way, please forward my mail to this address.
column15: Certainly, sir. We hope you have a good trip.

column1: are you working overtime again? Over the last two weeks, you have worked overtime every day without a break! Your company is draining the life out of you!
column2: I know, but I don't have a choice, my boss has complete control over our work schedules. I haven't made it out of the office before 9 PM a single day this week.
column3: Well, I hope they're paying you the big bucks for all this work...
column4: No, not exactly, I'm working for minimum wage.And they don't give extra pay for overtime. Overtime is our own time.
column5: What?! Isn't there a law against that, I think there is some legislation that requires employers to give their employees a fair rate of wages. You should know your rights! If you are putting in so many hours, they should give you some kind of compensation.
column6: They do give bonuses at the end of the year for the employees with highest productivity numbers, but frankly, it's not much of an incentive. They give us a bonus of ten dollars.
column7: That's just wrong! why don't you just quit?
column8: I would, but I'm afraid I would't be able to find another job. I don't have very many job marketable skills, there aren't so many jobs that I'm qualified for.
column9: it sounds like any job will be better than the one you have now!

column6: Also some traditional Chinese food, like noodles and dumpling are marketed in modern ways with improved food quality. I heard this year, the government has imposed very stringent inspection on the hygiene conditions restaurants and suppliers of food are also under tighter control.
column7: For sure all the customers will benefit from this.

column1: My lease ends next month, so I have to find a new place.
column2: I feel sorry for you. It's a jungle out there.
column3: Do you know any places?
column4: Well. I guess I can ask around to see if anyone's got a room or apartment available.
column5: Thank you. I think I should also have a look at the Internet to see if anyone's got a sublet.
column6: How much do are you looking to spend?
column7: I can only afford about 1,000 yuan a month.
column8: Looks like you'll have to get a place in the suburbs.
column9: It doesn't matter, but it needs to be close to the subway or on a convenient bus route.
column10: Anything you need to have in the place?
column11: I want a bedroom with full bath, and it'll be better if the bedroom is on the sunny side.
column12: You can also check out university bulletin boards.
column13: Why? Will those be students who are leaving?
column14: Not really, but landlords put up notices to attract students and they often have low rent.
column15: Thank you. I'll be sure to take a look.
column16: Good luck.

column1: What's for dinner tonight?
column2: It's whatever you're planning on cooking.
column3: You're not going to cook?
column4: No, I always cook.
column5: Yeah, and I love your cooking.
column6: Don't give me that. If you're hungry, then cook dinner.
column7: You're being serious?
column8: Look, I'm really tired tonight. I don't feel like cooking dinner.
column9: Okay, I'll make dinner tonight.
column10: Thank you. I'm going to bed.
column11: Do you want me to wake you up when dinner is ready?
column12: Yes, please.

column7: Me too, it's so unreliable.
column8: That is true.

column1: Hey Ayden, I was wondering if you could do me a favor.
column2: That depends. What is it?
column3: It's kind of a big favor. I'm absolutely flat broke, and I owe my landlady $ 200. she's given me until Friday to give it to her, but I don't get paid until next Monday. Do you think you could loan me some cash until I get paid?
column4: I'd love to help you out, but I'm a bit short on cash this month as well. I had to get a new engine put into my car, and that ate up my savings.
column5: If you can't give me the full amount, a fraction of it would still help. I'll pay you back on Monday. I promise.
column6: Let's see, I've got about $ 50 to get me through the weekend. I can only spare about $ 20. I would give you more if I had it, I just don't have much money to my name right now.
column7: Thanks a lot Ayden. Every little bit will help. Tell you what, if you aren't doing anything tonight, why don't you come over and have dinner at my place.
column8: That'd be great. Thanks! What time should I come over?
column9: How about at 6 pm?
column10: See you then!

column1: Dad, you keep talking about family in New Zealand. Who are they?
column2: Well, that's your uncle Bill, his wife and two of their daughters.
column3: Is uncle Bill your brother?
column4: No, your uncle Jack is my brother, Bill is my brother-in-law, your mom's brother.
column5: So his two daughters are my cousins?
column6: That's right, Sarah and Jane are both your cousins although they are step-sisters.
column7: What are step-sisters?
column8: Sarah is your uncle Bill's older daughter. When she was young, Bill's first wife, Sarah's mom died. Three years later Bill married again.
column9: So uncle Bill's wife is Jane's mother but not Sarah's mother. Right?
column10: Yes. She is Sarah's step-mother.
column11: And when are they coming to visit us?
column12: They want to travel to Europe next year, and will visit us at the same Ae.
