column1: Hey there Chris, what are you up to?
column2: I'm just poring over some brochures about various car models.
column3: Oh, so you're thinking about buying a new car?
column4: Yeah, it looks that way. My wife has been bugging me about it. I thought we could probably survive without one, but with a baby on the way, maybe it is time to get a car.
column5: So this would be your first automobile?
column6: That's right. For quite a few years, I rode a bicycle to work. Then I got a motorbike.
column7: Yeah, I think I can understand your wife's position. Asking her to ride on a motorcycle when she's pregnant is a tall order.
column8: Oh... I don't let her ride with me. It's just too dangerous. She takes the bus to work, but it is sometimes difficult to get a seat and it's crowded and hot.
column9: So it's time to buy your very first car! Wow, that's exciting!
column10: Yes, but it's also a pretty big financial responsibility.
column11: Yeah. I still remember my first car. It was an old clunker that my dad gave me when I turned 17. I drove it around for a couple of years until I scraped together enough money to buy a better secondhand car.
column12: I'm having a hard time deciding which model is best for us.
column13: Yeah, it is a tough call. Each one has its pros and cons. Are you looking for a sedan?
column14: Yes, I'd like a Jeep, but my wife says we have to get a comfortable sedan for long drives home to see her relatives.
column15: I'd advise you to listen to your wife. She will be sitting in the back taking care of the kids so whatever she prefers is probably the best choice.

column3: It's not just about the things that you learn, you know... seminars are a really great opportunity to mingle and network with professionals in our industry from all over the nation. You can learn a few things, but more importantly, you rub shoulders with the business leaders and make contacts that could lead to potential sales or partnerships in the future. The social mixers are always more important than the seminars anyway.

column10: I drink a lot of milk. I drink milk almost every day.

column9: Let ’ s meet at 12:30. it will probably take us there or four hours to see all of the exhibits.

column1: how come you're still up? Shouldn't you be asleep by now ;

column3: as far as I know, insomnia is usually caused by stress. Are you stressed at all?

column9: you need to take some breaks throughout the day. Studying all day isn ’ t very usually effective.
column10: you ’ re right. I usually end up starting at my computer or checking my email instead of doing my work for class.

column1: Now that you'recommending such enormous fees, producers, directors, movie-makers must see you in a completely different light.

column3: Then the standard that you set yourself originally must have changed.
column4: Well, if that's the case, I don't mind breaking the image that they might have or the standards that they have. I can only do what I know, and live how I've lived all my life, because I'm a fairly stubborn person.
column5: It seems to me that now you're famous. You've got to go out and be seen at the right places and go to the right parties.
column6: I don't go to parties. The parties I go to are the barbecues I have in my house. Being seen in the right places is something that I don't believe in. I don't believe in going to events just for the sake I of being seen.
column7: Then fans don't see you much in public places.
column8: Yes. I have a very low-key life ; I have a great life. I love what I do and I love how I spend my time, which isn't in a public place.
column9: A lot of people compare you to Julia Roberts. I wondered if there was anyone that you compare yourself to in Hollywood, that you've watched and thought,' Well, they've got something I could use a little bit or could learn a little bit about.'
column10: I've never had one person that I'd idolized. The comparisons to Jul-ia Roberts are incredibly flattering. I don't really know who I would compare myself to. I'd like to be a combination of a lot of people. A little bit of everything, really. I haven't quite figured out where my strengths are yet, and I've definitely found my weaknesses.

column1: When you are in a restaurant you want the waiter to bring the bill, what do you do to attract his attention ;

column3: I went out with my girlfriend to a nice restaurant last night and I noticed that many people shouted for the bill.
column4: That seems a little impolite in such a restaurant.
column5: That ’ s what I thought. I just thought I ’ d ask you and see what you thought of it. Anyway, what did you do yesterday evening?
column6: Well, it was a warm evening, so I stretched my legs. I walked along the canal for a couple of miles. Actually, several other people had the same idea. I saw Bill.
column7: Did you? How is he these days?
column8: He seemed ok. We didn ’ t stop and chat because we were on opposite banks of the canal. We just waved at each other.
column9: I need to move some furniture. Could you help me to lift it?
column10: Of course. What do you want to move first?

column1: Dan, Dan, dude. You have to come over to my house right now!
column2: Is everything OK?
column3: Just get over here!
column4: Come in! Quickly!
column5: So, since when is your house a bank?
column6: What do you mean?
column7: I mean, what ’ s up with the locks and iron bars on your windows.
column8: Security, Dan, security! You can never be too safe you know! A lot of sickos out there. Just the other day they caught that peeping tom red handed! Had a high power telescope and binoculars by his window.
column9: What ’ s the matter with you? Why are you acting all paranoid?
column10: Paranoid? I ’ m not paranoid! I ’ m cautious! You see Dan, we have to be on guard at all time! People just invade your privacy as if they knew you! Telemarketers, solicitors, even your bank! They have way too much information! I like to keep everything on a need to know basis.
column11: OK, well, what did you want to see me about?
column12: You are being watched! Be careful Dan! Be careful!

column1: How was the party yesterday?

column6: So how long did you stay?
column7: I left after the opening dance. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

column6: Graduate Management Admission Test, it contains three parts
column7: Okay, this sounds a little tough, how am I supposed to practice for this?
column8: Up to you, you could have a one on one session with a tutor or group sessions, you can also use free or private computer software. Going to church might help as well!
column9: No matter what I do, I'm going to ace this test and go on to become a corporate fat cat!
column10: Umm... That's the spirit!

column1: This website offers very convenient air tickets booking service. It is quick and accurate.

You can conveniently pay by credit card, so the whole transaction only takes a couple of minutes. They also provide e-tickets, meaning you don ’ t need to go to any office to pick an air ticket. You go to the airport directly and check in with your ID card.

column4: Yes, therefore they are expanding the scope of their service. For example, hotels can be booked through the same site as well.

column1: what was your wedding ceremony like, Abigail ;
column2: my husband and I got married in a registry office with just two friends there as witnesses. But then we had three parties to celebrate.
column3: three parties? That's quite a lot. That must have been expensive!
column4: well, since my husband and I are from two different countries, and we live in a third country, we decided to have one in each country. It wasn't actually that expensive.
column5: were your parents upset that they weren't there to see you get married?
column6: I would have liked them to be there, but they couldn ’ t afford to fly out to see us, and we couldn't afford to fly out to see them, so they understood.
column7: did your husband's family get to meet your family?
column8: my husband's parents flew out to meet my family when we got married in my hometown, so that was great. Some people spend ridiculous amounts of money on extravagant wedding receptions, but we agreed t
column9: that makes sense. Did you go on a honeymoon?
column10: we waited until our one-year anniversary to go on our honeymoon to Africa.

column1: What can I do for you, young man?
column2: I need to rent three pairs of skates for the morning.
column3: What sizes do you need?
column4: One pair of 37, and two pairs of 21. One for me, and the other two for two kids.
column5: Here you are. And here are three crash helmets.
column6: Thanks. Well, those two kids are beginners. What should I do about their safety?
column7: Well, there are a lot to do, but nothing to worry about. First, make sure they don't go far from the railings.
column8: Oh, yeah, maybe I should ask them just to walk along the railings.
column9: That's a good idea. And remind them to be slow at the beginning, not to run into the railings.
column10: OK. Anything else?
column11: Never go to the center of the lake. The ice there is too thin to skate on.
column12: Got it. Thanks for reminding me. And, are there any intensive training courses?

column1: So Kim, have you ever had anything stolen?
column2: Stolen? No, why?
column3: My uncle just had his motorcycle stolen a few nights ago. I was just thinking about how clever criminals are these days.
column4: Criminals are clever? They're only successful when people are careless.
column5: I don't know. The ones who stole my uncle's motorcycle were pretty good.
column6: If your uncle had an alarm system, then it wouldn't have happened.
column7: He did. It was one of the best ones available. But that didn't stop them from disabling 11 it. And on a crowded street too.
column8: Didn't anyone stop them?
column9: You would think that people would be smart enough to stop something like that. No one knew his motorcycle was being stolen. The thieves came in a truck and convinced everybody that my uncle was parked illegally and they were there to tow it away.
column10: Wow, they were good. I guess criminals aren't that dumb after all.
column11: That's not the end. They were so good that they convinced a bystander to help them lift the motorcycle and put it in the truck.

column1: Can I help you ;
column2: Yes. I am a bit confused. My sociology class is supposed to read a chapter in a book called Sociology and the Modern Age. According to the syllabus, the book is in the library, but I haven't been able to find it.
column3: Do you have your syllabus with you? May I see it?
column4: Yes, uh... I put it in the front of my sociology notebook. Oh, here it is.
column5: Let me see. Oh yes. Your professor has placed this book on reserve. That means you cannot find it on the shelves in its usual place. You need to go to a special room called the reserve room. It's down the hall and to the right.
column6: I'm sorry - I still don't understand.
column7: You see, your professor wants every one in the class to read the chapter. If one student removes the book from the library, it is likely that none of the other students will have the opportunity to read it. So, your professor has insured that all students have the opportunity to read it by placing it on reserve.
column8: So, will I be able to find this book?
column9: Yes, when a book is on reserve, a student can go to the reserve room and ask the reserve librarian for the book. The student can have the book for a few hours, and he or she MUST read it in the library during that time. That way, the book stays in the library, and all students have a chance to read it.
column10: Okay. Thank you. I understand now.

column12: Then, after you sand it, you use tack cloth to wipe off any dust or sawdust.

column17: And I can choose any color?
column18: Yes, we have many colors to choose from, sir.
column19: And after the varnish?
column20: After the varnish dries for 24 hours, you can put another coat of varnish on. Or you can put the finish on.The finish is hard and clear. It goes on top of the varnish.
column22: Well, when the finish is dry, the table is done.
column24: It only sounds complicated. It's really very easy. A lot of people here in America finish their own furniture.It' s a good way to save some money. And a lot of people even enjoy it.

column5: Very well. How long do you want the house? All summer?
column6: No, not all summer. Just for six weeks.
column7: I'm afraid I can only rent it for two months.
column8: My holiday is only six weeks, but I think my brother and his family would take it for the other two weeks.Is the house in good condition?
column9: Yes, it is. It was just painted and it has all the modern conveniences.

column1: Who do you think is the greatest novelist in the history of English literature?
column2: Charles Dickens.Actually no one can parallel him in writing.
column3: I'm afraid I can't agree with you on that. I like D.H.Laurence' s novels better.

column1: Have you taken your temperature?
column2: Yes, and it is 37 ° C.
column3: Well, open your mouth and let me have a look. It is nothing serious. You haven't got a fever. But you should take the medicine and need have more rest recently. When you feel well, you could take more exercises, or play sports like basketball, running, and swimming. And eating healthy food, having more fruits and vegetable and drinking milk are good for your heath.
column4: Yes, I see. Thanks a lot.

column1: Are you a wrestler or a boxer?
column2: No.Why?
column3: Your muscular shoulders and chest impress me so.
column4: Oh, really? I go to the rye every day.

column1: Come on in. Let me show you around. Here ’ s the living room ;
column2: Great. The view from this window is wonderful.
column3: This is the kitchen.
column4: It looks new.
column5: Yes. We just renovated a few month ago.
column6: I like it.
column7: Here ’ s the master bedroom.
column8: Wow, it ’ s nice. What did you say about the rent?
column9: $ 900 a month.
column10: Does that include utilities?

column1: Excuse me, sir, Is this the road to the peace Store?
column2: You could get there this way, but it'd be faster to go along the Wort Street.
column3: Where's Wort Street, please?
column4: Turn right at the third intersection, you'll see the street and then walk along the street to the south.
column5: How far is it from the Wort Street?
column6: Just walk for a few minutes, you'll find it.
column7: Thank you very much.

column1: May doesn't get along very well with her mother-in-law.
column2: Yeah. That's just what is troubling John.
column3: Poor John! He is bothering both sides of this bread.
column4: This situation isn't easy to handle.

column1: Cheers! To our first night in our new apartment.
column2: It's so quiet. I'm not really used to it.
column3: All you hear is the crickets and the breeze.
column4: It's a little eerie. I'm sure the silence will begin to grow on me.
column5: Well, I think it's fabulous. And the neighbors don't even seem to exist.
column6: That is a relief. It's a good thing we moved.

column1: Betty, would you please read this letter of application I've just written? I'd like to have your opinion.
column2: I'd be glad to tell you what I think.
column3: Good! I'm interested in your advice.
column4: If I were you, I would change the beginning. You should write about your education first because we like to judge a man by his abilities.
column5: Good idea, Betty. What would you think about the second part?
column6: I think it's too short. You'd better say something about your work experience.
column7: You're right, I'll change it. How about the last part?
column8: Very good. But you should talk about your family, too.
column9: I agree. I appreciate your helping me.

column1: Nurse, I am sure to die soon. They just don't tell me the truth, I know.
column2: But I don't think so. No one has ever said a word that you are to die, only yourself. That means you are not willing to die, right? Actually, you are recovering and what you imagine as your worry is slowing down the treatment. Many cases worse than yours turned out to be hopeful and successful. You must be confident. Your condition is much better physically, but a little bi difficult mentally. The most important thing for you now is cooperation with us.
column3: Is what you said really true?
column4: Of course. I am a nurse and a nurse tells the truth.
column5: Thank you.

column1: Susan, I am inviting you and Frank to our house warming party this weekend.
column2: A house warming party?
column3: Yes, Deborah and I are going to buy a new home in Woodlawn.
column4: Congratulations! That ’ s wonderful. I bet both of you are quite happy.
column5: Well, we have always dreamed of owning our own home, but real estate 1 in this area is extremely expensive.
column6: I understand. That ’ s why Christopher and I want to find a place in a small town, far from the city.
column7: That ’ s a good idea if you can find employment nearby.
column8: I agree. That ’ s why Christopher is already looking for a job in Maine, or Wisconsin.

column1: Good evening.can I help you?
column2: We'd like to have break fast in our room tomorrow ; Would you please arrange it for us?
column3: Sure.
column4: Shall I make an order now?
column5: You don't have to. This is your knob menu.Just tick off the items you want for breakfast. write down the time and hang it outside the door before you go to bed tonight.
column6: That's really convenient.

column1: May I sit here?
column2: I'm afraid this seat is taken.
column3: Oh, is it? Thank you anyway.
column4: You're welcome. If you ask the conductor when he comes by, he should help you find one.
column5: Thank you.

column1: Jenny is going to marry another man next month.
column2: Yes, I know.
column3: But, how can you be so calm. You loved her so much.
column4: At least I ’ m the one who rates with her. I ’ m glad we can still be friends.

column1: Could you please help me to check out the book?
column2: Sure, what's the author's name, please.
column3: I can't remember that clearly. It probably be Charles...
column4: Charles Dickens?
column5: No, no, no. I'm not interested in literature.
column6: OK, do you know the title of the book?
column7: Oh, sorry. I'm always absent-minded. I remember that I've put a note in my pocket.
column8: So, show me the note please.
column9: I can't find it now.
column10: Oh, such bad luck, sir. Can you please name the category of the book?
column11: Let me see. It's not fiction. It's biography.
column12: OK, I'll search it for you. A moment, please.
column13: Thanks.

column1: I ’ m trying to decide what school to apply for.
column2: Are you thinking about a public school or a private one?
column3: I ’ m not sure. What ’ s the difference between them?
column4: Public schools are usually state funded, whereas private schools usually get their funding elsewhere.
column5: Which is better?
column6: One isn ’ t necessarily better than the other. It depends a lot on the school administration and the teachers.
column7: I hear you have to wear uniforms at private schools.
column8: Yeah, sometimes.

column1: Thank you, 175 yuan.
column2: Here you go.
column3: Here is your change and your receipt.Do you have goods unpaid on you, sir
column4: No, I don't think so.
column5: I'm sorry I need to call the security to have a look.
column6: There must be a mistake.
column7: Sorry, sir, it's my job to make sure the goods are paid.
column8: Wait, can you check these sunglasses I bought it in the second floor. I think they forgot to demagnetize it.
column9: Sure. Ah... That's the problem. Have you paid for it
column10: Of course I did. Here is the receipt.
column11: Let me see... Oh, I am awfully sorry sir.
column12: That's all right.

column1: Do you take a bus to and from work?
column2: Yeah, everyday. And there ’ s only one choice.All the other buses are going the other direction.
column3: Hmm. I have the same problem. When I leave work, it ’ s always rush hour.So the buses are always crowded.
column4: Oh, yeah, it ’ s terrible. I will tell you the funniest thing I have seen in China. It ’ s when so many people try to get onto one city bus, and the last guy is squeezed in so tight that the door is tightly pressed against his butt.
column5: That sounds terrible the way you describe it. But you know, not long ago I really suffered on the bus.
column6: What happened? Were you having a hard time getting on a bus?
column7: You just can ’ t imagine! I waited for the first bus but it was too full, so I waited for the second, and it was still very crowded. Then I decided not to wait for the next one, and got on the second bus. It was so full that I had to stand on one foot! No kidding!
column8: Hmm. Good exercise, uh?
column9: Yeah, absolutely!
column10: And it ’ s so much fun. One day, the bodies were so tightly packed that some girl ’ s behind was pressed against my front. I was afraid to put my hands down for fear of accidentally groping her.
column11: You were so happy, weren ’ t you?
column12: What do you think? I ’ m a good boy.

column1: Martin.
column2: Hi. John, it ’ s Emily. How ’ s everything?
column3: Great, thanks. What ’ s up?
column4: Oh, I was just thinking about getting a bite to eat. Have you had lunch yet?

column1: Does this TV work well?
column2: Yes, it is almost new here.
column3: Is it a color TV or a black and white TV?
column4: It is a color TV. You know, the rich people like the digital one now. So they have no room for them.

column1: hi, I'm Lucas, I just moved in next door.
column2: oh, hi Lucas, come on in. I'm Barbara. Nice to meet you.
column3: nice to meet you too.
column4: would you like something to drink? I've got tea and some grape juice.
column5: thanks. Some tea would be nice. Chinese tea is great. I really like your tea set. Where did you get it?
column6: oh, there is a supermarket not far from here. But there is also a tea house around the corner, where you can get tea and a tea set as well.
column7: oh yeah, I saw the tea house the other day. I think I might go and have a look sometime. It's a nice neighborhood here.
column8: you are right about that. It's quiet and very convenient. You can get to the bus and the subway stations within ten minutes'walk. There's a grocery store, a book store, a gym, and many restaurants
column9: there's a gym nearby? That's exciting! I really want to start to go to gym as soon as possible. I've been lazy this summer holiday and have put on some weight.
column10: well, if you want we can go together sometime. Actually I was thinking of going this afternoon, if you like, you can join me and I can show you the neighborhood along the way.
column11: that would be wonderful. Thanks!

column1: Taxi! Taxi!
column2: Where to, sir?
column3: I ’ d like to go to the railway station please.
column4: Please hop in.
column5: Is it a long run to the station?
column6: It ’ ll take about 20 minutes.

column8: Yes, they are.
column9: Is it the rush hour now?
column10: Yes, it is. Are you in a hurry sir?
column11: No, I ’ m not. Would you please drive slowly and carefully?
column12: Yes, sir.

column1: Excuse me. May I ask you some questions?
column2: Sure. What do you want to know?
column3: Could you please tell me how many credits would be required for a bachelor's degree?
column4: Well, you have to get 166 credits, including required courses and optional courses.
column5: OK. And how long does it take to get a bachelor's degree?
column6: It can be completed in four years normally.
column7: I see. Thank you very much.
column8: You're welcome.

column1: Well, you know what, don ’ t do it, ‘ cause the minute you do, they lose all respect for you.

column3: Out of hand.
column4: Confusing. But not, because it ’ s nothing.
column5: Where ’ d you meet him?
column6: Oh, listen, I can ’ t even remember. Ok, on my birthday, I wandered into over 30 rooms, for a joke, sort of and he was there, and we started chatting...
column7: About what?
column8: Oh, books, and music, how much we both love New York. Harmless, harmless, meaningless. Bouquets of sharpened pencils. Oh.
column9: Excuse me?
column10: Forget it. We don ’ t talk about anything personal, so I don ’ t know his name or what he does or where he lives exactly. So it ’ ll be really easy for me to stop seeing him, because I ’ m not...

column2: Merry Christmas, Lee!
column3: Linda, thank you for this wonderful Christmas dinner. I really enjoyed it.
column4: Thank you for coming. I'm glad you liked it.

column1: Hey, Ray, what are you doing right now?
column2: Not much. Joann. Do you want to hang out?
column3: Yes, I do. I ’ m at home myself right now with nothing much to do.
column4: Me, too. What would you like to do?
column5: Well, we could go to a movie. Have you see Shrek 2?
column6: I have, actually. How about the movie, Million Dollar Baby with Clint Eastwood?
column7: Hmm... I ’ Ve seen that, too. We could go for a walk in the park.
column8: We could, but it looks like it ’ s going to rain soon.
column9: I guess that ’ s out. Why don ’ t we go shopping?
column10: I ’ d really rather not. I ’ ll be too tempted to buy something that I can ’ t afford!
column11: Ok. I guess we ’ d be not do that, either, then. What do you want to do?
column12: I don ’ t know. Do you want to go bowling at the new bowling alley on 1st street?
column13: I would like to, but I injured my wrist last weekend.
column14: Let ’ s see. Do you want to go to a bar and sing some karaoke?
column15: That sounds interesting, but I can ’ t drink alcohol with the medicine I ’ m taking.
column16: Doesn ’ t sound like that ’ s be fun, then. Do you want to come here?
column17: I don ’ t have a car.
column18: Goodness, we ’ re not having much luck here, are we?
column19: No. do you have a car?
column20: No, but I could take the bus.
column21: Oh, good. Why don ’ t you take the bus to mine and we could play Mah Tiang?
column22: That sounds great! Have you eaten?
column23: Not yet. I ’ ll cook dinner and have it ready by the time you get here.
column24: Perfect. Are you prepared to give me all your money?
column25: Huh? We are going to play for money, aren ’ t we?
column26: Oh, right. I suppose so. As long as you promise to lose!
column27: Hey... as long as I ’ m not alone on a Saturday night, I don ’ t really care what I do!

column1: Hello.Hot water overflowed from the bathtub.Will you help me?

column4: Then will you put all the towels under the bathroom door?

column7: I'm sorry I was too tired to fall asleep.
column8: When you woke up, the water was coming out of the tub.
column9: Right.Can I compensate for the damage with the travel accident insurance?

column4: That's convenient.Thank you.

column2: It is unnecessary. I'll see you off at the airport.

column1: I'll come see you tomorrow.
column2: Promise?

column1: I will take part in the finals soon.
column2: Come on. I stand behind you.

column1: Hello baseball fans, and welcome back to today ’ s game! My name is Rick Fields and of course, I am here, once again, with the man that seals the deal, Bob Copeland.
column2: It ’ s a beautiful day to see two world class teams face each other and fight for their right to be called champions.
column3: Well, the national anthem has just been sung, and the umpire has started the game. It ’ s time to play ball!
column4: Roger Vargas is up at bat. The pitcher winds up and strike one!
column5: A very nice curve ball by the pitcher. The catcher gives him the sign, he winds up and Vargas gets a line drive!
column6: The players are scrambling to get the ball. Vargas gets to first base and he ’ s still going! The outfielder throws it to second! Vargas slides! He ’ s safe!
column7: Great play!
column8: We have a runner on third and up at bat is Brian Okapi! There ’ s the pitch, he hits it! It ’ s going, going, that ball is gone!
column9: Home run by Okapi! That puts this team ahead by two as we are at the bottom of the fifth inning here at Richie Stadium!

column1: Professor Wang looks so handsome today. He is wearing a light brown suit and a pink tie.
column2: He always wears an extremely becoming suit with tie.
column3: He ’ s quite particular about what he wears, especially about his ties. He gets different tie each day.
column4: A light brown suit and a pink tie today, and a light blue shirt and a blue tie yesterday. A perfect match!
column5: The tie is necessary for man. It makes you look so attractive in a super tie.
column6: Match is important ; well, the way of tying is also important.
column7: My father dose not know how to tie a tie, for he often wears a cravat.
column8: My father wears a tie every day, but he can ’ t do it himself. My mother helps him with his tie every morning.
column9: You mother is not only a patient mother but also a gentle wife.

column1: Mark. Where have you been? I ’ Ve been calling you all morning.
column2: I ’ Ve been playing computer games.
column3: What? So you blew me off yesterday and today over a stupid video game? What game is so important that you have no time for me anymore? What are you playing?
column4: It ’ s called Counter Strike.It ’ s a first person shooter game.It ’ s awesome.It ’ s a multi player game where you can go online and compete against players from all over the world.
column5: You ’ Ve been wasting your time on this? I can ’ t believe it! It doesn ’ t even look fun or challenging!
column6: My laptop is on my bed. If you think it ’ s so easy then get on line and try to beat me.
column7: Fine!
column8: Damp it! How are you killing me with a single shot? It ’ s not fair! I don ’ t want to play anymore! Let ’ s go get something to eat.
column9: Can you bring me something? I am totally hooked on this game!

column1: Do you like the room?
column2: Yes. What is the rent?
column3: $ 300 per month.
column4: Then what's the rent due date?
column5: At the beginning of the month. Besides, you should pay me $ 1000 as deposit.

column1: Good morning. I ’ m thinking about buying some new furniture for my living room. Could you help me?
column2: Certainly. As you can see, we have several three-piece suites on sale. Feel free to sit down and test how comfortable they are.
column3: I came to your store yesterday and have come back today to make a final decision. I think I like the black leather suite. It ’ s on sale, isn't it?
column4: Yes. The price has been reduced by 50 %. It ’ s a real bargain.
column5: I ’ ll take it. I also need to improve the lighting in my living room. Do you have any suggestions?
column6: Those floor lamps are very nice and you can vary the brightness according to whether you ’ re reading or watching tv. How big is your living room?
column7: It ’ s quite large. It ’ s about 40 square meters.
column8: I ’ d suggest you buy two. That allows you to change the brightness of the room better.
column9: OK. I like the design of this lamps. I also need some cushion covers. I ’ ll just browse through those ones over there.

column1: what's your opinion about childless couples? Will you choose to have no kids ;
column2: to be honest, I wouldn't.
column3: why? Do you have to make a choice now?
column4: not really. But it has puzzled me for a long time.
column5: what's the puzzle?
column6: my husband and I prefer to have no kids, but my mother-in-law is very traditional and wants grandkids.
column7: oh, I see. I think the older generation tend to think in a different way.
column8: yes. It seems she can never accept a childless marriage. We had a fight last night.
column9: oh, really? Maybe she is just eager to see her grandchildren.
column10: but it's absolutely our own business to have a child or not.

column2: Yeah, I'm going to be making phone calls all day. What a blast.
column3: I just wanted to say thanks for putting us on the map so fast. I appreciate it.
column4: Save it, Vince. After I put my first million in the bank, I'll say you're welcome.
column5: Fair enough.Keep up the good work.

column1: Hello. My name ’ s Linda Brown. What can I do for you today ;
column2: Hi. I ’ m Tom Peterson. I ’ m looking for a one-bedroom apartment.
column3: Certainly. First, I would like to ask you some questions to identify your needs before I show you what we have.
column4: That ’ s fine.
column5: What price range are you interested in?
column6: Well, between $ 350-400 a month.
column7: Okay. Do you have a special location in mind?
column8: I ’ d like to live somewhere near the university, or at least on a bus line.
column9: When would you like to move in?
column10: As soon as possible.

column1: She is so beautiful, isn't she?
column2: Who?
column3: Julia Roberts.
column4: Yeah, she is so charming. I like her, too.
column5: It's said that her new movie is going to come out.
column6: What's the movie about?
column7: I'm not sure.
column8: Isn't it silly to see a movie that you know nothing about?
column9: I already told you, because Julia Roberts is in it. I like her because she is not only a great actor but also is very generous to give a lot to many kinds of charities.
column10: Yeah, she is great. I also admire her for her concern about society.

column1: Is Tom in?
column2: Wrong number.
column3: Isn't this Li's residence?
column4: No, it is not.
column5: Oh, I'm sorry.

column1: What kind of place shall we rent?
column2: It should be close to the university. Neither of us are good at getting up in the mornings and closer it is, the later we can get up.
column3: Absolutely. That's the most important thing to take into consideration. I'm not too worried about the size of the flat.
column4: Neither am I. so a small place is ok, but we'll get a bigger one if it's not expensive. Do you mind if it's in a noisy area.
column5: I don't mind. I'm not a light sleeper, but quieter is better for when we have to study at home.
column6: Good point. Ok, let's go to the estate agent and see what they can offer us.
column7: Yes, if we're lucky we'll find something in the next few days. I think you had a good idea to start flat hunting early.
column8: How much do you think the rent will be?
column9: I asked a few people who are already living in places near the university and they said it would cost about one hundred pounds a month.

column1: I always feel I ’ m left high and dry with nobody to rely on.
column2: Don ’ t be fool. I ’ ll always side with you.

column1: Are the galaxies in the universe moving through space?
column2: No, the galaxies sit more or less passively in the space around them. But not too much. As the space between galaxies expands, it carries the galaxies further apart - like raisins in an expanding dough.
column3: But I heard that our Milky way galaxy may one day collide with a neighboring galaxy. If galaxies are moving apart from each other, how can they collide?
column4: Well, the universe is a chaotic place, and the gravity from one galaxy, or from a group of galaxies, may disturb the motion of its near neighbors, causing them to collide. However, on average, when you compare two large enough chunks of space, the galaxies in one are moving away from the galaxies in the other.
column5: Wow, you're really informative. Thanks a lot.
column6: You're welcome.

column1: What are you reading?
column2: It ’ s an article about language. It talks about the idea of having a single global language.
column3: It seems that English already is the main global language. Does the article suggest that there should be an artificial language like Esperanto as the world language.
column4: Actually, it suggest English. The main argument is that English is already being studied as a second language in most countries-china, India, mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, and japan. So beginning again with a language like Esperanto would be wasteful. The second argument is that English is used in modern technology far more that any other language. Most emails are sent in English and the vast majority of website use English.
column5: Does the article say anything about other language? How will they survive in an English-speaking world?
column6: The article points out that many languages have been lost and will be lost, but others will continue to be used for generation, even if English continues to be the dominant language.
column7: Right. All the people who speak Chinese. Hindi, French and Spanish aren ’ t suddenly going to stop using those languages.
column8: Exactly. The article suggests that those languages will be used, but that they will only rarely be used in international communication between non-native speakers.
column9: In that case, I shall continue to learning a few basic phrases in other languages.

column8: What does it include?
column9: The facial will start with a thorough cleansing.
column10: Does it include a facial mask and a massage?
column11: Yes. The stimulation mask promotes blood flow and will firm up the skin. You can also choose to either get a hand or back massage as well.
column12: Will you exfoliate the skin as well?
column13: Yes. We'll also apply some of our special day cream that will moisturize our skin and protect it from the sun.
column14: That sounds great. I'll have that one then.
column15: Ok, just follow me.

column1: Hi.Ed, what's up?
column2: Nothing.
column3: Doesn't look like it to me.
column4: Just get out of my face!
column5: Woo, easy.
column6: Leave me alone!
column7: What are you so ticked off about?
column8: I don't want to talk about it.
column9: Maybe I could help.
column10: I blew the finally exam.
column11: You've got be joking.
column12: No, I'm not.
column13: Well, don't get bend on a ship about it.

column2: Where?
column3: Taiwan.
column4: That'll be 64 cents.
column5: Okay. Can I also have a sheet of 20 sixty-four-cent stamps?
column6: Sure. The total comes to twelve dollars and eighty cents.
column7: By the way, how much does it cost to send a package to Taiwan?
column8: That depends on the weight.
column9: I see.

column1: My girlfriend dumped me.
column2: Well, that's life.

column1: What can I get you?

column3: Would you like anything to drink?
column4: I feel like having a Coke.
column5: That's a good idea. I think I'll join you.

column1: Good morning, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: I want to buy a ticket to Sydney tomorrow.
column3: Right now fight BW159 is the only one available, it is a non-direct one.
column4: What's the exact information?
column5: It departs at 4:40 pm tomorrow and arrives in Sydney at 10:20 am. the next morning by way of Melboume.
column6: How long is the layover in Melboume?
column7: About 1 hour. Would you buy it?
column8: Yes. I want a first class single ticket.

column1: So who does he think he is, anyway, I can't believe the way that my boss has been ordering everyone around lately, I mean, it's now like he is the CEO, or anything.
column2: Um... Actually I am guessing you didn't get the MEMO. Your boss was selected to fill the vacancy in the CEO slot. He actually is the CEO now, or will be, as soon as the official press releases and hoopla is done with.
column3: Yikes! you are joking, right? I can't believe it. No wonder he is so stressed and bossy lately. I thought he was just being ostentatious by giving orders to people and all the different departments. What big shoes to fill!
column4: No kidding! When the last CEO left, we were worried about the future of the company.
column5: What does a CEO do anyway? I know the CEO makes the most money in the company, but what does he actually do?
column6: He is responsible to the board of directors for everything that happens in the company. He or she must give leadership to all company officers, as CEO is also responsible for providing the guidance of philosophy of the company, and acting as official representative, or face of the company.
column7: Must be one smart guy.

column1: how are you?
column2: I ’ m fine, thanks. Just trying to get adjusted. It ’ s hard to keep track of everything around here.
column3: That ’ s for sure. You ’ re new, too, huh?
column4: Yeah. I just got here a couple of days ago. How about you?

column1: Where is Pamela?
column2: Is she coming?
column3: She told me she'd be here.
column4: They are announcing your flight. You'd better board the plane.
column5: Are you rushing me?
column6: I am just reminding you about the time. You don't want to miss the plane, do you?
column7: I know what I am doing. Don't worry. Can you do me a favor?
column8: Name it and I'll do it for you.
column9: Take care of Pamela when I am away. She is a nice girl. I don't want her to get hurt or anything.
column10: I've got it.
column11: Thank you. Now I see that you are my true friend. Most of my so-called friends left me at the moment my company went bankrupt. You are the only one who has stood by me the whole time.
column12: I am just doing what I think I should do.
column13: Thank you for being a friend of mine.
column14: This isn't like you... Well, I hope you will have a nice flight and a successful start in business.
column15: Thank you. I have to leave now. If you see Pamela, tell her I'll write to her.

column1: Why didn't you tell me you had a girlfriend ;
column2: Sorry, I thought you knew.
column3: But you should have told me you were in love with her.
column4: Didn't I?
column5: You know you didn't.
column6: Well, I'm telling you now.
column7: Yes, but you might have told me before.
column8: I didn't think you'd be interested.
column9: You can't be serious. How dare you not tell me you were going to marry her?
column10: Sorry, I didn't think it mattered.

column1: Can I help you?

column4: I have to wear it this afternoon. Do you have a urgent service?
column5: Yes, but we charge 50 % more and it only takes 3 hours.
column6: OK. How much should I pay?
column7: 30 yuan.

column4: Okay, it'll be ready in two minutes.

column2: Uh... I mostly just like to listen. You're the groom. Why don't you go first?

column5: I'd better not. Brooke hates the Backstreet Boys!

column1: How do you like skiing, Pat?
column2: I love it. All my life I wanted to learn to ski. Finally I took lessons last year.
column3: I suppose skiing is easy for you.
column4: No, quite the opposite. I thought I'd never stop falling down. Then all of a sudden I started skiing much better.
column5: I see. Do you ski often?
column6: Every chance I get. On weekends I ski all day long. Sometimes I even ski at night.
column7: That sounds great.
column8: Oh, yes. The ski slopes are well lit. It's really nice to ski at night. Why don't you learn to ski?
column9: Not on your life! I know I'd break my leg
column10: Don't be so frightened. It's just a skill.

column1: Why did she do that?
column2: I have no idea. It was completely out of the blue.

column4: Whatever am i going to tell me parents.
column5: Don't worry about that, I am sure they will understand. After all, it was a very difficult exam.
column6: What am I to do?
column7: You can always take it again.

column2: Of course.
column3: It's genuine, I bet.
column4: It's made of genuine ivory, besides, it's of exquisite workmanship. The price is marked 200 yuan.
column5: I'll take it.

column2: You too. Have you lost some weight?

column4: Not some crazy diet fat I hope.
column5: No no, I just changed my eating habits. I eat a balance meal. and I eat less than before.

column1: I heard that Ann had divorced.

column3: Poor Ann. She did not love her husband at all.
column4: Yeah. She married him at her mother's bidding.

column1: How about the hiking? It was freezing yesterday, are you all ok?
column2: Can ’ t be better, it was wonderful. We had a lot of fun there. There was so much joy and walk and breathe the winter air. We arrived at the park at 9 o ’ clock in the morning and didn ’ t leave till 3 o ’ clock in the afternoon.
column3: You had been walking for 6 hours, isn ’ t that boring?
column4: Of course not! We built a snowman, some snow dogs and one big snow fort. We went sliding on the nice hill. It was a real work out. At noon, we had the most special winter picnic outside. Fortunately, we got it all on a video tape. You must come with us next time. I bet you will love it.
column5: Well. You know I hate walking, but I can ’ t wait to see your guys ’ video.

column1: Hey, Karen. Look like you got some sun this weekend.
column2: Yeah? I guess so. I spent the weekend at beach.
column3: That ’ s great. Where did you stay?
column4: Some friends of my parents live out there, and they invited me there.
column5: So, what did you do out there? I mean besides bask in the sun, obviously.
column6: I jogged up and down the beach and played volleyball. You know I never realized how hard it is to run on sand. I couldn ’ t get through a whole game before I had to sit down.
column7: Not to mention cooler. Did you go swimming?
column8: I wanted to, but the water is too cold, and I just wetted in up to my knees.
column9: It all sounds so relaxing. I wish I could get away to the beach like that.
column10: It looks like you could use it. Don ’ t tell me you spent the weekend in the library again.

column1: I need something to eat, please.
column2: Tell me what you're hungry for.
column3: I feel like champagne, lobster tail, and filet mignon, medium rare.
column4: Unfortunately, we're out of filet mignon at the moment. May I suggest the porterhouse instead?
column5: Well, I prefer filet, but porterhouse is good, too.
column6: Perhaps I could interest you in chocolate-covered strawberries with the champagne?
column7: Just the champagne will be fine, thank you.
column8: You'll see this charge on your amenities account.
column9: That's fine.
column10: It won't be long until your food is delivered. I know you'll enjoy it.

column1: Good morning, sir. Can I see your boarding pass, please?
column2: Here you are.
column3: Excuse me, sir. This is your passport.
column4: Really? Ugh... Is there any difference?
column5: Yes. As a matter of fact, you can't board the plane without boarding pass.
column6: Gee. I must have left it in my hotel room.
column7: I'm sorry sir. I can't let you pass.
column8: But when does the plane take off?
column9: Ugh, in about thirty minutes, sir.
column10: Oh, my God! What do I do now? Bone head.
column11: Calm down, sir. You are creating a commotion.
column12: Is that me?
column13: Could be.
column14: Oh, thank God. Thank you, I'll be right back.

column1: Excuse me. Is anyone sitting here?
column2: No, nobody.
column3: You don ’ t mind if I smoke, do you?
column4: Well, to be frank, yes, I do.
column5: Oh, I ’ m sorry. But this isn ’ t a no-smoker, is it? I mean would you mind if I smoke here?
column6: Actually it is. Perhaps you haven ’ t noticed the sign.
column7: Sign? What ’ s sign?
column8: There, on the window.
column9: Oh, sorry. I didn ’ t notice it. Sorry.
column10: That ’ s all right.

column1: It's my first visit to Prague, I'll be here for three days for a conference, then I have a day on my own to do some sightseeing before I head back home. What do you suggest I see when I'm here?
column2: There are many interesting places you should be sure to see. One problem is transportation, however. Because the city is very old, the roads are narrow and congested. If you only have three or four days to visit, you don't want to spend them waiting in traffic in a cab. I suggest you take the subway.
column3: The subway? But is there a subway station next to my hotel? I have to go between the conference center and the hotel several times a day...
column4: No worries, there's a subway station at the conference center itself, and a shuttle from your hotel to the conference center that takes only 5 minutes. When you do your personal sightseeing, you can first take the shuttle to the conference center, then hop on the metro.
column5: Is it expensive to ride on the underground?
column6: You can get a daily pass that will allow you to travel unlimited for the whole day for about 6 dollars. Otherwise, you can pay by trip, which is about 50 cents to 2 dollars each trip, depending on how far you go.
column7: Is it easy to get lost?
column8: No, no.... it's very hard to get lost. There are two lines, one that goes in a circle, the other that is straight. If you get lost, there are always subway attendants that can help you find your way.

column1: It's time to leave the office for the night. Firstly I log off my computer, then I set the electronic security system ;
column2: That's pretty advanced.
column3: Now I'll quickly send a short message to my wife and take the elevator down to the basement.
column4: Is that where you park?
column5: Yes, the car park is under constant video surveillance, so my car is quite safe. Please get in.
column6: Thank you. Where is your key?
column7: There's no need, I have keyless entry, and the steering wheel recognizes my finger prints before starting the car. Now, we can look at the navigation system to find the best route home.
column8: That's amazing, it even shows all the roads that are congested at the moment.
column9: Using GPS I can rely on this to direct me home. Now I just need to find my E-Card to automatically open the gate and we can drive out.
column10: Pretty soon cars will be driving themselves.

column1: Where is the produce?

column4: I don't know. The produce person can tell you, though.

column3: I want to stay under $ 20.

column7: Someone in the main office has a nephew who he thinks can slide right into the Management position I wanted.
column8: All under the precept of keeping the funding? That stinks.

column3: You're not?

column8: Is that right?

column5: You have a very good taste. It's our best seller.

column7: Sure! Look, it suits you well.

column1: the bathroom looks lovely. Did you redecorate it yourself or did you get someone in to do it for you?
column2: I did it myself. I went online and found a lot of website devoted to home improvement. Then I went to DIY shop and bought everything I needed. I ’ m sure I saved a lot of money by doing it mys
column3: so, let ’ s see. You have put new tiles on the floor and replaced a few tiles on the walls. You ’ Ve also added a small cupboard for toiletries. The bath, shower and waterbasin are the sam
column4: yes, they are. I gave them a good clean. They are in good condition and don ’ t need to be replaced.
column5: how long did it take you to do the tiling.
column6: as I hadn ’ t done it before, I had to keep referring to information I got from the internet. Doing the floor tiles took a whole day-from early morning to right through to the evening. The
column7: I think you ’ Ve done a very good job. As least as good as a professional would do. Perhaps I can convince you to redo my bathroom?
column8: you ’ ll be lucky! However, I ’ ll print out the information I got from the internet and you can do it yourself.

column4: Round trip, please.

column7: I am sorry. The flight on Nov. 21st is full.Do you mind if I put your name on the waiting list?
column8: Yes, please. Thank you.

column1: I see you have bought the latest copy of “ beauty and fashion ”. Are there any interesting articles in it?
column2: There ’ s an interesting interview with a top fashion designer about the latest fashions. I enjoyed reading her thought. The “ which? ” section is very interesting this month. They tested facial cleaners. The article recommends “ all clear ” for effectiveness and price.
column3: I like to take the tests that they print in this magazine.
column4: Which tests do you mean?
column5: You know. Tests like ” how jealous are you? ” and “ are you a fashion victim? ”
column6: Oh, I see. I like to do those tests, too, but I don ’ t take them seriously.
column7: Of course not, but sometimes the results make you think about yourself and what you do. According to the jealousy test, I ’ m quite a jealous type of person. Perhaps I need to control my jealousy.

column2: Really, it's so beautiful.
column3: You like it. Well, I'll gather it for you.

column6: It's a private garden.

column1: So click here, then up to the top.

column1: What did you learn at the workshop you went to yesterday? Do you think it was worth the investment to go?
column2: Yeah, I really got a lot of the session. The workshop topic was resolving personal problems. It was led by a professional human resources director. The teacher had a lot of experience, and I think we were all given a really good base to start with.
column3: The workshop was only one afternoon long, do you really think you can learn that much in only a couple of hours?
column4: It depends on the topic, the teacher, and the way the course is set up. Yesterday, even though we only had a short time to discuss the issues, the workshop got us all thinking. We learned some very basic, but very useful methods of dealing with personnel issues.
column5: Sounds like you really learned a lot.
column6: I did... I just hope I can implement all these great ideas that we shared.

column1: Look! It is not working well. Did you try out the bike when you bought it.

column3: But it would save a lot of trouble if you had taken it for a test ride.
column4: I know. I will pay attention to such a thing next time.

column1: Would you like to rent the house?
column2: You bet, as long as I can collect enough money.
column3: I can lend some to you.
column4: Aren't you crazy?

column1: What a beautiful day!
column2: It is really gorgeous out today. I remembered the weatherman said it is supposed to rain.
column3: I heard that it's supposed to get up to 90 degrees Fahrenheit today.
column4: Really? That's unusual for October, isn't it?
column5: Well, you could never tell about the weather here in New York.
column6: Yes, that's true. Still, it's hard to believe. Yesterday our high was only 50 degrees Fahrenheit.

column1: Well, how was your honeymoon?
column2: It was fantastic! We had such a good time. The only problem was that because it was their high season, we spent hours queuing.
column3: Peak periods always entail hours of queuing. At least you got a nice tan though!
column4: Yes, Florida had great weather while we were there. You look tan, too. Did you go somewhere?
column5: My friends and I just got back from Bali.
column6: Wow! Bali Islands have some of the best beaches in the world, don't they?
column7: Yes, we were lucky. My friend's father owns a resort on one of the islands, so we were able to stay for free.
column8: Did you go diving while you were there?
column9: I took a few diving classes, but I didn't really like it, so I did snorkeling instead!
column10: Did you take any pictures in the ocean?
column11: I've got quite a few pictures of all different kinds of fish. I'll show them to you next time I see you.
column12: Have you started planning your christmas vacation yet?
column13: We're planning on going skiing in Switzerland. Do you ski?
column14: No, but I do like snowboarding.
column15: Would you like to go skiing with us for christmas?
column16: I'll talk to my husband about it ; I'm sure he'll say yes! He loves Switzerland!
column17: It is Europe's spotless land of lakes and mountains! Let me know as soon as you can so we can get a discount.
