column1: Excuse me. Do you study Chinese at the university here?
column2: Yes, I do. But my characters are very bad.
column3: It takes a long time to learn Chinese writing.
column4: Are you Chinese?
column5: Yes, I am. I am from Taiwan. I came here to study political science.
column6: How do you like it?
column7: I like it so far. But my English still needs work.
column8: I want to study Mandarin and international relations.
column9: Does the Chinese department here teach regular characters or simplified characters?
column10: They teach regular characters.
column11: I see. I'm from Taiwan, so I know regular characters better than simplified.
column12: You just said your English needs work, yes?
column13: Yes, that's true. Especially my writing. I think my papers aren't good enough. I make too many grammatical mistakes.
column14: Well, I am very serious about learning Chinese.But for me the hard part now is pronunciation.You have the four tones in Chinese. It is very hard. Maybe, if you have time, maybe we could do a language exchange.
column15: You mean you and I?
column16: Yes, why not? I mean, if you come to this cafe often, maybe we could meet here and practice Chinese and English.
column17: That sounds like a good idea. How often would you like to do it?
column18: Let's see... My schedule right now is quite busy.But I think I could spend 90 minutes a week in language exchange.
column19: How would we manage it though? How would we spend the 90 minutes?
column20: First, we could spend 45 minutes working on your English writing.If you want, I could help you edit your papers.Or we could do English conversation. Whatever you want.And then the next 45 minutes you would help me with my Chinese.
column21: Would I help you with writing?
column22: No. For me right now, the important thing is spoken Chinese. I need practice. So you could tutor me in speaking.We could use my textbook, and you could ask me questions.Then you could correct my mistakes.
column23: I think it sounds like a good system. But when is it convenient to meet?
column24: Well, today is Monday.Actually, for me Monday at this time would be the best. I am free from now until 11
column25: Me too. In fact, I'm free until 1
column26: So if you want to meet at 10
column27: It sounds good. I will bring the papers I'm working on.
column28: And I will bring my textbook and a tape recorder. I would like to record some things so I can practice on my own.
column29: Let me give you my phone number.
column30: Sure. I'll give you mine too. Then we can call if we have to cancel for some reason.

column1: Do you know about All Fools' Day?
column2: On that day, people play all kinds of tricks on others, and the one easily taken in is called April fool.
column3: April fool!
column4: April the first is coming.Be careful!

column1: Mom, I've got something to tell you ;
column2: So, please!
column3: Aunt Jane buys a new bike for Tom. He is putting on grand airs.
column4: I bought you a new one last year. Isn't it handsome?
column5: It is great. But Tom's bike is so much better than mine.
column6: Frankly, he is more well-behaved than you.
column7: Nothing of that sort!
column8: Why hasn't the bus come yet? Every morning we have to wait for so long.
column9: Mom, it's OK. I will buy a big car one day. It is faster than the bus.
column10: Really? I am looking forward to that. What about the traffic?

column1: I heard the film was after the novel The Godfather.
column2: Who wrote it?
column3: Mario Puku.
column4: Who're the producer, the director, the stars, heroine and the hero?
column5: I'm always interested in how, but seldom pay much attention to who.

column1: It's not good for business recently.
column2: Not good for business? I don't see eye to eye with you.The new policy offers new opportunities.
column3: Too risky anyway.It' s necessary to look before you leap.

column1: Are you going grocery shopping today?
column2: I am, as a matter of fact. Do you have any special requests?
column3: Yes, please get some white bread, thick cut, some ham, not the processed stuff, some gouda cheese, some galla apples and...
column4: Wait. This is sounding like a major list. Why don't you just come with me?

column1: I don't like this movie. It's a bomb.
column2: Look, I've already paid for the tickets, so whether you like it or not we're going to finish watching it.
column3: Well, give me the Walkman. I'll listen to the music then.
column4: Come on. Give it a chance. The movie just started.

column1: I'm so tired! I don't know how I'm going to make it through this lecture.
column2: the professor is a bit boring today. You need something to perk yourself up. How about a coffee?
column3: I don't really like coffee, to be honest. It's too bitter for me.
column4: well, you need something to wake you up. How about a soda?
column5: most some drinks have too much sugar in them.
column6: the diet sodas don't have any caffeic in them, which one would you like?
column7: I like diet sprite. Does that have any caffeine in it?
column8: unfortunately, it doesn't. how about some diet coke?
column9: I don't care for coke. I heard that coke was first used as a medicine and I don't like medicine. What else has caffeine?
column10: maybe you should try a cappuccino or a latte ; they taste much better than plain brewed coffee.
column11: maybe. How about a mochaccino? Are they any good?
column12: you'll love that. It's just a shot of espresso beans mixed with steam milk and some chocolate syrup.
column13: that's perfect! Would you like one, too? My treat.
column14: thanks, but I'll stick with some jasmine tea. I'm trying to watch my diet.

column1: Have you ever seen coco?
column2: I've seen her on TV but not in the flesh.
column3: I'm so familiar with her songs, but I don't know what kind of person she is in real life.

column1: How old are you?
column2: Nine... but I'll be ten on May 1st.When is your birthday?
column3: I'm older than you! I'll be ten on April 14th.
column4: Are you going to have a birthday party?
column5: Maybe. I'll have to ask my mother.

column1: hi, Lander. What's wrong?
column2: I can hardly make ends meet these days.
column3: same here. I have't brought any new clothes for three months.
column4: my income remains the same but prices just continue to rise.
column5: true. The news says that there is a general increase in the price of daily necessities.
column6: definitely. I have to spend 300 yuan more on food every month.
column7: the biggest price jump is for pork, so most people have to turn to chicken.
column8: is that inflation?
column9: inflation is more than just the rising prices, I guess. But the central bank is warning about the risk of inflation.
column10: has the government taken some measures to curb it?
column11: yes. The government has banned price hikes in some key industries like energy.
column12: but I'm afraid the price hikes will spill over from food into other areas of the economy.
column13: you said it. I think we should tighten our budget and cut our spending.
column14: how?
column15: for a start, we can take the public transport to work. You know, running a car is a big expense.
column16: sounds a good idea.

column1: It is high time you have a talk with him. That may help clear the mists.
column2: I did, but he gives me a runaround.
column3: If I were you, I would put the whole matter on the table.
column4: But he was trying to beat about the bush. And my talk with him was fruitless.

column1: When he told me I had to work overtime, that was it.
column2: The last straw, huh?
column3: Yes, he's really pushed me too far.
column4: I know what you mean.

column1: so, what ’ s new in the kitchen? That refrigerator is new, isn ’ t it?
column2: yes. I needed a large one. Before, I had a separate refrigerator and freezer, but this has both combined into one.
column3: That ’ s usual nowadays. You ’ Ve added a few shelves too.
column4: yes. You know I ’ Ve been cooking more kind of food recently and I needed some extra space for spices and ingredients.
column5: Did you buy new cupboards too?
column6: no, I didn ’ t. I gave them a really good clean, so they just look new. The worktop was in poor condition, so I had a new one added.
column7: I see that you have bought several new pots and pans and utensils.
column8: yes, I have. I need them to help me with these new dished I ’ m trying to make. I need a little more practice before I invite guests over.

column1: I have found it quite different here from China since I came to the United States.
column2: What's the difference?
column3: Some friends of mine took me to the mall to go shopping. It was so big. I think I could get lost if I went there alone.
column4: You must have bought many things in the mall?
column5: Not really many. I was told that on weekends there were always the flea markets, so I decided to come to the flea market to buy a bargain.
column6: It's wise to do it. The Americans have the habit of selling their junk when they are moving to another place, so they usually display all the things they want to sell in their gardens at the weekend. And many things they are selling still look quite new and they are also very useful.
column7: I have heard about it while in China. it is called a " yard sale ". I didn't have any idea of that until today when I came here to the big " yard sale ".
column8: You must have got many useful things for your new apartment.

column1: Hello. This is the front desk. What can I do for you?
column2: Hi. I ’ m calling from Room 209. I couldn ’ t find the TV Guide. Can you send me one, please?
column3: Sure. Anything else?
column4: Yes. There is one more thing.
column5: Go ahead, please.
column6: The mini bar door was open when I checked in. I didn ’ t use it. Could you send someone to check it out?
column7: We ’ ll send someone right up. But don ’ t worry about that. Maybe the service person forgot to do it.
column8: Thanks.

column1: I am very nervous about signing my escrow papers.
column2: Escrow involves a lot of paperwork, but I will explain all of the steps to you as we go along.
column3: What should I have brought with me?
column4: The only thing I will need to see is your driver ’ s license, as I will be notarizing these papers.
column5: I feel a little overwhelmed by so many papers.
column6: Don ’ t worry about how many papers there are. We are going to look at them one at a time.
column7: My boyfriend is an attorney and told me that I could fax him anything if I had a question.
column8: Please get any outside help that you need in understanding your escrow documents.
column9: Is this the last thing that I will need to do before the house becomes mine?
column10: At the close of escrow, the house will be yours!

column1: Hello, Pauline ’ s Furniture Store, Faye speaking. How may I help you?
column2: Hello, I ordered a dining table last week. The order arrived today, but there are several scratches on the surface of the table. I would like to exchange it.
column3: I ’ m terribly sorry about that. We could take it back and deliver a new one to you early next week. Would that suit you?
column4: Well, I'm hosting a dinner party this weekend. Couldn ’ t you make it any sooner?
column5: Please hold on, I'll just check with the delivery department.
column6: OK, thank you.

column1: Sally, I ’ m tired of this Western food. I really miss my mother ’ s Sichuan cooking.
column2: I ’ m sure you do miss that type of cooking. But can ’ t you try to get used to Western food?
column3: I have tried. But Americans like butter, bread, sugar, and cream too much.
column4: I suppose you ’ re right, Lee. Maybe that ’ s why so many Westerners are overweight.
column5: It ’ s interesting that Americans work very hard at their jobs, do not take naps during the day, and yet they can be so heavy.
column6: You see, because we are often busy working, we eat too much fast food, and that food is very fattening.

column1: Do you think Mr. Johnson is a good worker?
column2: Just between you and me, I think he's lazy.
column3: Haven't you ever seen him working late?
column4: No, I haven't.

column1: I used to be down on the sales people until I saw her in action.
column2: She means business, for sure.
column3: Most salespeople seem like half-brains. Zina's definitely an exception.
column4: We'd better get back to work.
column5: Yeah, I'm not too worried about Vince, but I'd hate to face Zina if we don't deliver...

column1: I would like to buy some beef.
column2: What kind do you want?
column3: I need to get ground beef.
column4: How many pounds would you like me to get you?
column5: I need about four pounds.
column6: Exactly what type of ground beef do you want?
column7: Extra lean.
column8: I'll get that for you right now.
column9: I appreciate that.
column10: Don't mention it, I'll just wrap this up for you.
column11: Thanks for your help.

column1: My friend Jean is very beautiful.
column2: What's her figure?
column3: Perfect, and I like her charming eyes too.
column4: What's the color of her eyes?
column5: Dark blue.

column1: May I help you, madam?
column2: Yes, where's the meat counter?
column3: Follow me, please. Here it is. What do you want?
column4: I need to buy some pork for the party. Give me about one kilogram.
column5: OK. Wait a second, please.
column6: I wonder if the chops are fresh.
column7: Yes, of course.
column8: One kilogram, too.
column9: Anything else?
column10: No, thanks.

column1: Oh, boy, I hate to say this, but I really have to leave now.
column2: That ’ s all right. I understand.
column3: I ’ m so sorry.
column4: That ’ s ok. Don ’ t be sorry. We ’ ll talk later.

column1: Do you have a good English-Chinese dictionary?
column2: Sure. How about this one?
column3: Is this the latest edition?
column4: Yes. We have both the paperback and the hardcover.
column5: What's the difference?
column6: The hardcover is more expensive.
column7: Oh! I see. I'll have the paperback, please,

column1: What do you want for your birthday from your parents?
column2: I don't know. Maybe a pair of new shoes.
column3: Why don't you ask them to buy you a PC? You will soon use it at college.
column4: That's a dandy idea. Thank you for reminding me.

column1: Show me a smaller pair of trousers, sir. I am not that fat, you see.
column2: You've come to the right place. We've got various styles and sizes recently. How much do you measure around your waist?
column3: I have no idea. Measure me, please.
column4: OK! 2 Chi round. Try this one. Maybe it's of your size.
column5: ( After trying ) I'm afraid it's still too fight around the stomach.
column6: Let me check the stock. How about this one?
column7: ( After trying ) Mm, a perfect fit. How much?
column8: 150 Yuan.
column9: A little expensive. But I'll buy it anyway. It's hard for me to get a perfect one. Here is 200 Yuan.
column10: Here's your change, 50 Yuan. Welcome back again.

column1: Here is the song list.
column2: Do you have any English songs?
column3: Yes, here you are.
column4: Let me have a look. Everything I do I do it for you 、 Unchained melody 、 My heart will go on. Oh, and I ’ d like to try Everything I do I do it for you.
column5: Let me play it for you.
column6: Is it easy to locate it?
column7: It's very easy. Here it is. Ready? Excellent! You are a good singer. You sing the bass so well.
column8: I used to be a better singer. I haven't sung in the Karaoke for a long time. It's your turn.
column9: I'll sing a Chinese folk song Love song of Hanging, first in Chinese then in English.
column10: That's really my pleasure to listen to a Chinese song.

column1: Ten sheets of rice paper, 25 brushes, two boxes of oil color and two boxes of water color. All these come up to $ 35.50, sir.
column2: Ok, here is $ 50. Oh, can you make out an invoice for me?
column3: Sure, just a minute. Are you an artist, sir?
column4: No, I am a teacher. I teach art.
column5: That must be a very interesting job.
column6: It is. You must be new here. I do my shopping here regularly, once a week.
column7: Do you? Nice to meet you! And here is the invoice and your change.
column8: Thank you. Nice to meet you, too.

column1: Julia, I have good news for you.
column2: What's up?
column3: I have earned a lot of money this week, more than I do in a fortnight.
column4: It is really good news. How much do you earn a week now?
column5: My wages are six hundred dollars a week. But I find a part-time job to supplement my income.
column6: Darling, I know you are a good husband. You don't have to work so hard. After all your health is the most important.
column7: I know, darling. I must earn enough money to buy a car. I do a part-time job to increase my income. Don't worry, I will take care of myself.
column8: I see. You must have more rest.

column1: Excuse me. I've been waiting for my main dish for quite a time.
column2: Yes, sir.Just a minute, please, I'll check with the kitchen.
column3: Thank you for waiting.It takes another ten to fifteen minutes, I'm afraid.
column4: We have an appointment in half an hour.
column5: I see.
column6: Do you have anything else I can have instead?
column7: Well, yes.How about beef stew? We can serve you at once.
column8: I'll take beef stew, then.

column1: Do you want to go shopping with me?
column2: That's a good idea.What time is good for you?
column3: How about Saturday morning?
column4: Sounds good.

column1: Do you know much about computers?
column2: Not a great deal.
column3: I've just been reading an article about them.they' ll be used for all sorts of things now.
column4: For accounting system and things like that, you mean?
column5: Yes, but they are used for other things, too.Do you remember when we went to buy a ticket for the flight to Paris.
column6: Yes?
column7: The man asked where we want to go, then he type out the information on the form and waited for a reply. A few moment later, he gave us two tickets.
column8: Of course, his machine must have been connected to a computer.
column9: That's right.

column1: Good morning. Do I need an appointment?
column2: No, ma'am, there's only one person ahead of you. You won't have to wait long.
column3: Thank you.
column4: All right, madam, it's your turn. What will it be today?
column5: I've been wearing my hair long for years, but now I'd like to try some kind of modern style. What do you suggest for a woman like me, that is, with hair like mine?
column6: Come here, please. We'd like to wash your hair first. That way it will be easier to cut and style. I think you'll like this style. It's very fashionable.
column7: I hope so. I'm really tired of this old-fashioned style that I've been wearing.
column8: Would you like me to blow-dry your hair?
column9: Yes, if you think it will help.
column10: What do you think of it?
column11: It's great! Will it be hard to care for?
column12: Not at all. When you wash it, it will fall into place naturally. You'll probably need another cut in about a month. Shall I make an appointment for you?
column13: By all means.

column1: Good evening, sir. Are you ready to order now ;
column2: Yes. I'd like to try Chinese food. But I don't know anything about it.
column3: Chinese food is divided into eight big cuisines, such as Cantonese food, Sichuan food, Fujisan food, etc. Our restaurant is famous for Sichuan style.
column4: Is there any difference between Cantonese food and Sichuan food?
column5: Yes. Cantonese food is lighter while Sichuan food is spicy and hot.
column6: Really? I like hot food. Can you make a few suggestions?
column7: How about the eggplant and minced pork in dry red chili sauce and the' Tofu' beancurd? They are our specialties.
column8: OK. I ’ ll have them. Is there any soup?
column9: Yes. Sour soup of Sichuan style. It's our chef ’ s recommendation.
column10: That ’ s fine. I'll have a try.

column1: Well, good morning, Tom. I haven't seen you for a long time.
column2: I'd been feeling pretty well until just a few days ago.
column3: What seems to be the trouble now?
column4: I feel run down, tired. I've been having headaches almost every day. And I'm not getting as much sleep as usually do.
column5: Have you been eating properly? Eating the right kind of food is important for your health, you know.
column6: Well, I haven't been eating well, I guess. I usually only have enough time to grab a sandwich and a cup of coffee for lunch.
column7: And what about dinner?
column8: Sometimes I'm too tired to eat anything at all.
column9: That's not good. You don't have a well-balanced diet. Have you been taking vitamin pills?
column10: I don't like to take any medicine at all without talking it over with a doctor first.

column1: Dad, can you lend me some money?
column2: What for?
column3: I want to get a ticket for a concert tonight.
column4: All right.Here' s the money. I suppose I'll have to drive you there.

column1: John, it ’ s time to get up.
column2: It can ’ t be time to get up yet.
column3: It is. Hurry up! You ’ ll be late for school.
column4: What ’ s the time?
column5: It ’ s nearly half past seven.
column6: My watch says ten past.
column7: It ’ s slow. Hurry up! The bus goes at twenty to eight.
column8: Are you sure half past seven?
column9: Positive. I ’ ll put the radio on.
column10: It ’ s only seven o ’ clock. Your watch is fast.
column11: No, it isn ’ t. It ’ s stopped. I forgot to wind it up last night.
column12: I could have stayed in bed for another half hour.

column1: Could we go over some things, because I think my test score is wrong.
column2: What do you think is wrong, the math or the way your answer was scored?
column3: Both.
column4: I am willing to take a second look because teachers make mistakes, too. Will that work for you?
column5: Yeah, I'm ready.
column6: Check your answers against the ones on the answer sheet and let me know where you see the mistake.
column7: These look strange.
column8: Yes, I agree ; let's move on to the calculating of the score. Would that be OK?
column9: OK, let's do the calculation.
column10: We add all of these up and divide by this and that gives us this percentage.
column11: I see.
column12: Anytime you have a question, please feel free to ask!

column1: At what age do children start school in your country?
column2: At five.
column3: Do boys and girls go to school together?
column4: Yes, they do.
column5: Do you think this is a good idea?
column6: Yes, I do.
column7: Do some children go on to university?
column8: Yes, they do.
column9: What examinations do they take first?
column10: O levels and A levels.
column11: How long do you usually stay at university?
column12: Three or four years.

column1: What shall we do after the volleyball match ;
column2: How about going to the Olympic souvenir store to have a look? I remember there is one in the gym.
column3: That's a good idea. I was thinking of buying some gifts for my family.
column4: Me, too. What did you have in mind?
column5: I haven't decided yet, but I think the Olympic Mascots are a must.
column6: I agree. They're very lovely, especially Huanhuan
column7: Is that the red one? That is my favorite, too. Do you know how much they are?
column8: The five dolls are sold together as a set, and they're priced according to the size. The bigger they are the more expensive.
column9: Oh, I see. If I buy more than a set, can I get any discount?
column10: I don't think so. All the souvenirs of the Olympic Games are very hot right now.

column1: I think I'll write a book.
column2: What about?
column3: All of the time tested healthy habits from around the world.
column4: You have done a lot of traveling. I'll bet you've learned quite a bit.
column5: The interesting thing is to see what really works and what's just hype.
column6: Because you can see the results with the general public?
column7: That's right. I think we all have much we can learn from each other.
column8: I would buy that kind of book!

column1: What do we need for the barbecue ;
column2: Well, I ’ Ve bought a lot of meat. I ’ Ve got pork chops, small steaks, chicken wings, and plenty of hot sausages and hamburger patties.
column3: I can ’ t wait to start cooking! I ’ Ve bought the grill and charcoal. Do you have enough plates and utensils?
column4: I think so. I bought some paper plates and cups for people to use. It will save on the washing up!
column5: And if people drop them, they won ’ t break. We ’ ll need to buy some buns to make hot dogs and hamburgers.
column6: They sell them at the shop around the corner. We can go and get some in a few minutes.
column7: I brought some cheese to make cheeseburgers and some onions for the hot dogs. We ’ ll need some tomato ketchup and some barbecue sauce.
column8: I have the sauce, but remind me to get some ketchup at the shop.
column9: How long does it take to cook meat on a barbecue?
column10: It only takes a few minutes. Some people like their meat well done. Others like it rare. The great thing about a barbecue is that everyone can choose how they want their meat cooked.

column1: Everything is OK now, doctor.
column2: That was quick work. Let me have a look at it. Yeah, everything looks fine now. Thank you very much.
column3: You are welcome, doctor.
column4: How much do I owe you?
column5: The total is 87 dollars. Here is the bill.
column6: Really? You worked here for just half an hour. I consider the price very high.

column1: Want to send out for some Chinese?
column2: Some what?
column3: Some Chinese food. I'm hungry, and there's a take-out restaurant near here. We can have them deliver and then watch the news on TV while we eat.
column4: No, I'd rather go out. The Chinese food here is rather different from what I had at home. Maybe we can try some other food today... What about that all-you-can-eat place we passed the other day, the one over in the shopping center?
column5: Okay. I could go for that. It's called Al's Steakhouse. They also have great fried fish, and I love their salad bar. You can go back to refill your plate as often as you like.
column6: Is that the place that serves such large portions of meat?
column7: Yes, their steaks are enormous. Sometimes I can't finish what I've ordered.
column8: What if that happens to me? I hate to let food go to waste.
column9: Don't worry. We'll just get a doggie bag.

column1: Excuse me. When's the next bus?
column2: The next bus will be here in four minutes.
column3: Oh, good. That'll be the number forty four?
column4: No, it's the number fifty-eight.
column5: So when's the next forty-four? Will it be here soon?
column6: No, it won't.
column7: So when will it be here then?
column8: Never.
column9: Never?
column10: That's right. The number forty-four doesn't stop here any more. It's stop is round the corner.

column1: Why don't you come round for a meal one evening next week?
column2: I'd love to.
column3: Which day would suit you?
column4: Any day except Tuesday.
column5: How about Thursday?
column6: Yes, Thursday would be fine. What time shall I come?
column7: Oh, about 6:00. Will that be OK?
column8: Yes, of course. Thank you very much.
column9: See you on Thursday, then.

column1: May I take your order now?
column2: Yes, please. What's special today? Any special recommendations?
column3: Certainly. I would recommend' Songshuguiyu'.
column4: The name sounds fascinating. What is it exactly?
column5: Well, it is sweet and sour fried Mandarin fish.
column6: Sorry, I'm not interested in vinegar.
column7: Then, how about this one?
column8: OK. I'll have that.
column9: Very good. Could I serve you anything else?
column10: Thank you. That's enough.
column11: My pleasure. Just a little while, your order will be ready very soon. Please enjoy your lunch.
column12: Thanks.

column1: At last! The weekend comes again!
column2: Yes. What will you do these two days?
column3: After five days' hard work, I'm surely going to have some fun.
column4: But I'd prefer to stay at home and have a good rest.

column1: Do you know where Helen is?
column2: She's gone to a flower shop. Today is her husband's birthday.
column3: That reminds me. My wedding anniversary is tomorrow.

column1: What do you mean? If he was a good programmer, he should have been raking it in.
column2: The boss wanted to pay Bob with stock options. But Bob didn't want to play that game again.
column3: Again?
column4: At his last start-up, Bob worked for stock and no salary. They folded and he made zip.
column5: Ouch.
column6: Now he only works freelance. Hundred bucks an hour.

column1: Is my car ready yet?
column2: I don't know, sir. What's the number of your car?
column3: It's LF 312 G.
column4: When did you bring it to us?
column5: I bought it here three days ago.
column6: Ah yes, I remember now.
column7: Have your mechanics finished yet?
column8: No, they're still working on it. Let's go into the garage and have a look at it.Isn' t that your car?
column9: Well, it was my car.
column10: Didn't you have a crash?
column11: That's right. I drove it into a lamp post. Can your mechanics repair it?

column1: do you like cooking, Julia?

column4: I usually make a few salads for lunch throughout the week and I make dinner about 6 times a week.

column6: I do. If you cook at home, you can eat healthy food cheaply.
column7: what kind of dishes do you usually make?
column8: I almost always make either a beef roast or a chicken roast with asparagus, parsnips, peas, carrots and potatoes on Sundays.
column9: do you make a lot of traditional British food?
column10: aside from the Sunday roast, we usually eat dangers and mash, toad-in-the-hole, or fish'n chips once a week.
column11: how about spicy food?
column12: my family loves spicy food. We often eat Chinese, Thai, Indian, or Mexican food when we're in the mood for spice.
column13: what's your favorite dish to make?
column14: I absolutely love making mousaka, which is a Greek dish with eggplant. But it takes a lot of time, so I don ’ t often make it.

column1: what do you do when you see a homeless person on the streets begging for money?
column2: I never really give them money because I don't want to contribute to their addictions.
column3: homeless youth can easily become involved with drugs and prostitution. Do you do anything to help them?
column4: I usually ask them if they want some food and then give them something to eat. I figure that if they're homeless, they're probably hungry.
column5: that's a good idea. Do they usually accept the food?
column6: almost always. However, sometimes they get mad at me for not giving them any cash.
column7: it's sad how more and more young people are sleeping on the streets in London now.
column8: the cost of living in London is just too high for most people.
column9: it's true. The economy is in a bit of mess at the moment.
column10: did you know that few people can pay the rent on minimum wage, let alone pay for food and other living costs?
column11: there just isn't enough affordable housing to go around. If only the housing cost would drop, fewer people would be in financial trouble.
column12: added to that is the high unemployment rate right now.
column13: something's got to change---and it's got to happen soon.
column14: politicians like to ignore the problems of the working class. They like to focus on making life easier for the upper class.
column15: I can only hope that one day they will change.

column1: Good morning, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: I'm Bill. I'm in Room 908. Can you change the room for me? It's too noisy. My wife was woken up several times by the noise the baggage elevator made. She said it was too much for her.
column3: I'm awfully sorry, sir. I do apologize. Room 908 is at the end of the corridor. It's possible that the noise is heard early in the morning when all is quiet.
column4: Anyhow, I'd like to change our room.
column5: No problem, sir. We'll manage it, but we don't have any spare room today. Could you wait till tomorrow? The American People-to-people Education Delegation will be leaving tomorrow morning. There'll be some rooms for you to choose from.
column6: All right. I hope we'll be able to enjoy our stay in a quiet suite tomorrow evening and have a sound sleep.
column7: Be sure. I'll make a note of that. Everything will be taken care of. And if there is anything more you need, please let us know.

column1: Thank you.Steven.That was the most magnificent meal I've had abroad.You' ll have to let me reciprocate the next time you're in Beijing.
column2: Don't worry about it, Lin.That' s no big deal.You know, Americans appreciate China's rich culinary culture. Just excuse me for a second while I check the number here and figure out how much to give the waiter.Hmm, by the way, what do you do about tipping in China?
column3: We don't.
column4: No tipping? Now that's what I call a civilized system.
column5: At hotels and some restaurants they add a service charge to the bill, but other than that, tipping isn't customary.
column6: What about cab drivers and porters?
column7: In a cab you just pay what it says on the meter. I generally tip hotel porters 10 yuan per bag, but in first-class hotels they're instructed not to accept gratuities.
column8: You'd have a revolution on your hands if you tried to introduce that sort of system here.

column11: I ’ d like a few cans of coke. We also need a dozen eggs and half a dozen sausages.
column12: let ’ s get a chunk of cheese too. Is that everything.
column13: I think so. I ’ Ve got the shopping list, so let ’ s go.

column1: Have you thought of moving at all, Sarah?
column2: We ’ Ve thought about it, but my husband and I can ’ t afford it right now. The only thing we could afford would be living in the slums, which is something I don ’ t want to do.
column3: Buying a house can be expensive, but there are ways to find cheaper houses.
column4: Like what?
column5: Well, sometimes the city auctions offer houses to the community. You ’ d have to make a quick decision about the offer in a day, but you would definitely save money doing it that way.
column6: That ’ s a good idea. Do you know anyone who has done that before?
column7: Sure, my sister-in-law and her husband just bought a house that way. They ’ re pretty satisfied with it.
column8: Is the house pretty run-down.
column9: Not at all. The woman, who owned it, took good care of it. But when she died, she had no family left and no will, so the government had to sell it for her.
column10: Was it a very old house?
column11: It was about 75 years old. There were a few repairs that needed doing, but it didn ’ t take a lot of money or time.
column12: Is it in a good location?
column13: The area can be a bit rough in the evenings, but the neighbors watch out for each other, so it ’ s ok.

column1: That dog has white long hair. It ’ s lovely.
column2: She is my dog. I like her very much.
column3: What ’ s her name?
column4: Her name is Fluffy. She is a sweet dog.
column5: My dog has spots. He is very strong.
column6: But I don ’ t like big strong dogs.

column1: Room service.What can I do for you?
column2: l am afraid there isn't any fancy soap in my room.
column3: Sorry sir, we will bring you one.Anything else?
column4: Yes.Bring me a bath towel as well.

column1: Can you recognize Mike's father in the crowd?
column2: Yes, he's holding a bunch of books.
column3: Let's run up and give him a hand.

column1: All right. But these are black and I don ’ t like black shoes. They ’ re dull.
column2: Well, black is a better color than pink. Pink ’ s for girls.
column3: Then why are you wearing black shoes?
column4: Because... oh, all right. You win. Let ’ s pay for them and go.
column5: Hey, thanks, mum.

column1: Excuse me. Do you know where I can find the nearest ICCC?
column2: Yes, but it's quite a ways.
column3: Do I need to take a bus?
column4: This bus doesn't take you directly there. You'd have to change buses twice. I suggest you walk. It'll take you less than 20 minutes.
column5: How do I get there on foot?
column6: Go straight ahead through the intersection.
column7: Wait, let me write this down... Alright, I'm ready.
column8: Keep walking till you pass the square, then turn right. Walk past two lights and turn left at the third.
column9: Square... turn right... traffic lights... And then?
column10: Keep walking and look for a tall building.
column11: Tall building... Which side is the building on?
column12: The right side. ICCC should be on the first floor.
column13: Thank you very much.
column14: You're welcome.

column1: Do you have shoes here?
column2: Yes. What do you want to buy?
column3: I want to buy a pair of shoes for an interview.
column4: What size do you wear?
column5: My feet is size 37.

column1: Judy, your husband has a really nice car ;
column2: Thanks. It's a lot better than mine, and it's new.
column3: Where are you going?
column4: We're going to visit my sister in the city.
column5: I didn't know your sister lives in the city, when did she move there?
column6: About a year ago. She lives in an apartment on 3rd street, across from the public library.
column7: I see. It's almost 5:00 PM now, don't you think there will be a lot of traffic?
column8: Oh, we're not driving. We're going to take the subway. The subway only takes about 20 minutes.
column9: Yes, but it can be very crowded around this time. I always feel uncomfortable taking the subway.
column10: I take the subway to work everyday, so I'm used to it now.

column1: Did you hear about Bob and Mary?
column2: No, what happened?
column3: They had an argument and split up.
column4: Really, what's going to happen now?

column1: Good morning, how have you been doing?
column2: I haven ’ t been able to take a deep breath lately, and I need to know why.
column3: Have you had any type of bug lately?
column4: No, I ’ Ve been feeling fairly good most of the time. It just is hard to breathe.
column5: Has anyone ever told you that you have allergies?
column6: No one has ever checked me for allergies.
column7: Does this happen more when you are under stress?
column8: When the weather gets really cold, it gets worse.
column9: I am going to refer you to a pulmonary specialist who can run tests on you for asthma.
column10: Thank you for pursuing this. I appreciate your help.

column1: The Johnson are on their way back. You remember them, don't you?
column2: Johnson? I can't place them.
column3: We met them in Bermuda last May.
column4: They've completely slipped my mind.
column5: The couple with the dogs-think back.
column6: No, I don't recall a thing about them.
column7: Well, I've invited them for brunch.
column8: Hmm, I must be getting absent-minded.

column1: Is there anything I can do for you?
column2: I want to have a trip to Sydney.
column3: Sure. How long is your vacation?
column4: 3 weeks
column5: Well, how do you like this one? You will stay there for 17 days.
column6: It's good. By the way, what kind of clothes do I have to bring with me?
column7: It's summer in Sydney so you have to bring your summer wear.

column1: Do you have girlfriend?
column2: Yes, why?
column3: Well, I came to know a girl three weeks ago. We have so much in common.
column4: So?
column5: So I think I may fall in love with her.
column6: That sounds great. But how do you know that's a crush or a real love?
column7: Then what's the difference between having a crush and falling in real love?
column8: That's a big question. Well, if you're in love, maybe you will take every opportunity to talk to her or telephone her for no reason at all.
column9: That's what I do.
column10: And you think about her all the time?
column11: Yes.
column12: And maybe you suddenly have new interests. I mean you suddenly begin to do things you used to avoid. For instance, you used to sleep in every morning, but because she jogs every morning then you begin to like jogging.
column13: That's it. She likes dogs so much now, and I begin to love dogs.
column14: Oh, congratulations. Sounds like you've found your soul mate.
column15: Thanks, but I know falling in love is one thing while staying in love is another.
column16: Yes, that's right. If you find this person becomes more and more important to you and you can totally trust her, then you can stay in love.
column17: Yeah, falling in love is so good.

column1: Sorry, I overslept. My alarm clock didn't go off this morning.
column2: Again?
column3: That's right, even though I did set the alarm last night.
column4: Your clock never works. Perhaps you should buy a new one.
column5: Well. If it breaks down again tomorrow, I'll definitely buy a new one.
column6: Maybe by then it will be too late.
column7: What do you mean too late?
column8: By that time, you will be fired.

column1: Ouch! The water's too hot!
column2: Get in slowly, sweetie. You'll get used to it. I'm gonna go and make you some chicken soup.
column3: I'm not hungry, Mom.
column4: I know you don't have an appetite, but you need to eat something. You'll get too weak if you don't eat.
column5: Oh... I'm sweating already. It's so hot. I can feel it boiling! Can I get out yet?
column6: That's a good sign. But just soak a little longer, OK?

column1: Good evening, ma'am. May I help you?
column2: Yes. I'd like to use a safety deposit box.
column3: Will the object fit into this size of box?
column4: Let me see. I think it's OK.
column5: Could you fill out this form, please, ma'am?
column6: Here you are.
column7: Thank you, ma'am. Would you like to use it until May 20th?
column8: Yes.
column9: This way, please. Your box number is 522.
column10: Thank you.
column11: If you would like to use the contents during the period of use, please come here in person. After confirming your signature, we will open the box.
column12: I see. Thank you.

column1: Hi, sir. Could you tell me where the Hilton Hotel is ;
column2: Well, there are two Hilton Hotels around here. Which one is your destination?
column3: Eh, let me see. Sorry, I can't remember it, because I've been there only once, accompanied by my friends.
column4: Then, it would be a little bit harder to find out your way. Do you remember the name of the street, or one or two landmarks?
column5: A bookstore, probably. With a yellow and orange logo.
column6: Good, any other clues?
column7: I remembered there is a very busy street several miles away. I waited for the traffic light for a very long time.
column8: Oh, is there a bank near there, Standard Charted possibly?
column9: Oh, yeah, I got it, there is a bank My friend exchanged her money there.
column10: That's the second branch hotel of Hilton. Walk straight down and you will see the bookstore you just mentioned. Turn left, I believe, you will get it.

column1: It's very cold tonight!
column2: Can I get you another blanket?
column3: 0h, that would be nice of you.
column4: I'll turn the heat up.
column5: Yes, please do that.

column1: I feel very miserable. I took the death of my wife very hard, you know.
column2: Cheer up! Let bygones be bygones.
column3: I ’ Ve tried it, not a chance.
column4: It seems you have to take time.

column1: I heard you were promoted to general manager of IBM ’ s China Head quarters.
column2: That ’ s true. I got the news yesterday.
column3: You did a good job for the company. So, this is your first day in the new position. How do you feel?
column4: Not bad. I ’ m confident. And I like challenges.
column5: I believe you are cut out for this position.
column6: Thank you.

column1: Can you please give me a hand? I can ’ t carry the heavy box.
column2: I ’ m afraid not. Don ’ t you see I ’ m looking up a word in the dictionary?
column3: I think you are flicking through it.
column4: Well, wait a minute.

column1: Good morning, Mr.Black. I am the new secretary.
column2: Good morning, Miss White. You are half an hour early.
column3: I don't want to make a bad impression.
column4: Come on over. This is your desk, and this is your time card. Be sure to clock in and out before and after you work.
column5: I will.
column6: One more thing, keep your desk neat. It's the rule. There is no exception, even the art designers have to keep their desks neat.
column7: I'll keep that in mind. Does everything on the desk belong to me?
column8: Not belong. You can use them as long as you work here. When you quit, you ’ ll have to return them to the company.
column9: What's the extension number for my phone?
column10: The operator will put all your calls through. You don't have to worry about that.
column11: Can I make personal phone calls during my office hours?
column12: Of course you can. Every one has his personal matters to deal with more or less, but don't chat over the phone. What's more, don't let it hinder your work and the company's business.
column13: I understand.
column14: When you settle down, I'll show you around and introduce you to the department managers.

column1: I think Yoga might be suitable for me.
column2: Why?
column3: Because it doesn't require a lot of energy and thus easy to keep up.
column4: But I see people sweat a lot doing Yoga too.
column5: I don't know. I just need to try it once. I'm in urgent need of some exercise to lose some weight.
column6: You should try swimming then. It helps you to keep fit.

column1: Are you a newcomer?
column2: Yeah, this is my first visit here.
column3: You speak good English, though.
column4: Thanks, but I speak English with a strong German accent.
column5: But let me tell you, you're doing just fine. I couldn't do half as well as you do when I was learning German.By the way, how long have you been learning English?
column6: On and off, for quite a few years.

column1: He is penny wise and pound-foolish.
column2: Why do you say so?
column3: The trash of the world he sets high price upon, but the heavenly things he shamefully undervalues.
column4: Maybe all of us are the same.

column1: I don ’ t want you to be worried, but our son has some bad habits now. He says painful words everyday.
column2: What words? Can you tell me?
column3: He says kick mommy, beat mommy, don ’ t want mommy, very quickly if I do something that he doesn ’ t like. You know, if I wash his face or change his clothes, things like that.
column4: Honey, I don ’ t know what to tell you. Of course Tony is a young child. But do not underestimate his ability to learn and reason.
column5: Yes, but sometimes he is just not reasonable.
column6: I suggest you treat him with patience, affection, and respect. If he needs to do something, like go to bed, or be washed, etc., please guide or help him to get it done, but lead him with gentleness.
column7: It ’ s easy to say, but I will try.
column8: Motivate Tony to cooperate by rewarding his good behavior. Do not emphasize punishment for bad moods, etc. Do not threaten him with punishment if he resists the actions you desire.
column9: I know my parents sometimes threaten to punish him. But this doesn ’ t work, instead he picks up another bad habit.

column1: How can I help you ;
column2: I'd like to buy some perfume for my girlfriend.
column3: Do you know what kind of scent she usually wears?
column4: She usually doesn't wear anything but a few drops of Chanel No. 5. But I'd like to buy her a new Fragrance.
column5: OK, here are some of our most popular perfumes.
column6: Which one would you recommend?
column7: Personally, I quite like the new perfume from Clinique. It's a subtle flowery scent. What do you think?
column8: That smells great. I'll take one bottle, please.
column9: Would you like to buy any other cosmetics for your girlfriend? We have a full range of products from cosmetics to skin cleansers and moisturizers.
column10: It's OK. She normally just wears a little foundation and some loose powder, and I don't know what shade to buy.

column1: Yes, sir.May I help you?
column2: Please I'd like a ticket to New York.
column3: For today?
column4: No, early saturday morning.
column5: We have a flight that we'll put you there at ten AM.Is that ok?
column6: Nothing earlier? I prefer flight at nine thirty.
column7: I'm afraid not, unless you want a night flight.
column8: No, exactly not
column9: How about afternoon?
column10: Sounds not good. I won't take it.

column1: What do you think of the test?
column2: Rather difficult. How about you?
column3: It wasn't too bad. Were you nervous?
column4: Rather. I'm afraid I didn't do very well.
column5: Oh, I wouldn't worry about it.
column6: That's because you did well.
column7: No, I wouldn't worry about you.
column8: Why?
column9: It seems to me that you always do better than you say.

column1: How do you usually part your hair?
column2: To the right.
column3: ( The hair stylist cuts the customer's hair. ) Almost done. I just have to even things up a bit. ( She shows the customer the results. ) Will that do?
column4: Looks good.
column5: Would you like a shave?
column6: No, thanks.
column7: Okay, let me brush you off. Thank you very much for coming.
column8: Thank you.

column1: Why are you so angry, darling?
column2: Stop picking on me. I am going to be mad.

column1: Ernie, I'm really excited about starting this band together. We're going to be the two coolest students on campus.
column2: I know! It's gonna be great. But what kind of music do you think we should play?
column3: That's a good question. You know I love hip hop, so maybe we can play some Vanilla Ice songs.
column4: Hmm... Vanilla Ice? I know his most famous song, " Ice Ice Baby, " but I don't know his other songs.
column5: That's OK. You can buy his songs on iTunes and listen to them.

column1: Let's have lunch together today.
column2: It's a good idea.
column3: I want a Hamburger and ice cream. What about you?
column4: I don't like Hamburgers. They have no taste.
column5: What about cheese cake or apple pie?
column6: Maybe I want an apple pie.

column1: I'm so glad I bought this watch!
column2: Cool! Flashy red lines!
column3: I think this is the coolest watch I've ever owned.
column4: Is it waterproof?
column5: Isn't that a silly question? You know how much of an athlete I am.
column6: Uh, huh... so what kind of sports do you need a waterproof watch for?
column7: Well, surfing, scuba diving...

column1: How much shall I pay?
column2: Let me see. A roasted duck is 15 dollars. A plate of pork is 10 dollars. A bowl of beef is 6 dollars. Two bottles of beer are 3 dollars.That' ll be a total of 34 dollars.
column3: Here is 40 dollars.Keep the change, please.
column4: Oh, sorry, sir.We take no tips here.Thank you all the same.

column1: Miss Wang, would you mind my asking you a personal question?
column2: No, not at all. Go ahead.
column3: Are you married?
column4: Yes. Is that so important?
column5: Frankly yes. We like to employ married people. By the way, do you have any children?
column6: Yes, I have a three-year-old son.

column1: Can you lend me fifty bucks?
column2: What? Again? Why do you keep running out of money?
column3: I guess I don't earn enough.
column4: No, I think it's how you budget your life, that's the problem.
column5: That's my business, not yours.
column6: True enough, until the time comes that you need to take my money. I don't know where you're wasting your money but I think you need to take a look at what's really important.
column7: So how do you survive from pay day to pay day?
column8: I don't just survive. I put money away as well. I know when I get paid where most of the cash will go, and I stick to my plan. If I follow a budget I don't have any nasty surprises.
column9: I'm not disciplined enough I guess.
column10: In a few months I'm planning to invest my money into some foreign companies. I think you need to reevaluate your spending habits.

column1: I hear little Bob has recovered.
column2: That's a great relief. I was worried about him.
column3: The operation was very successful.
column4: His parents must feel very happy.

column1: I want to rent skis and boots.
column2: Here you are. Have a nice stay here.
column3: Thank you. I am a learner so can you tell me where I can find a ski instructor?
column4: We will find you one. Wait a moment.
column5: Thank you very much.

column1: Excuse me, is there a swimming pool in your hotel?
column2: Yes, the swimming pool is right behind the building. Walk out of the door and you will see it.
column3: What's the fare?
column4: $ 10 per hour.
column5: Thank you.

column1: OK. I just saw a Versace for thirty dollars. This stuff can't be real!
column2: Most of it is. You should sign up.
column3: I'm not sure I'd want to give these people my credit card number.
column4: Didn't you read about Paypal and Bidpai? They are very safe.
column5: Sure, but it's so complicated. They asked for my credit card authorization number.
column6: That's the last three or four numbers on the back of your credit card where your signature is.
column7: I have trouble understanding all these forms... but I'm sure I'll get it.

column1: What do you do in summer?
column2: I love going out into the countryside for walks or bike ride. I love being out in the fresh summer air. How about you?
column3: I don ’ t often go for walks, but I either play sports outside-you know, tennis or badminton-or just sit in the sunshine and read a good book.
column4: What do you do in winter?
column5: Well, I play sports indoors quite often. If I ’ m feeling lazy, I just watch a film at home. I prefer summer to winter.
column6: I think most people do. I like wearing nice, colorful clothes in summer, you know, a nice dress or skirt. It ’ s too cold for those kinds of clothes in winter.
column7: Yes. I like wearing shorts in summer. My legs would freeze!
column8: Do you think we ’ ll have a nice summer this year?
column9: Thanks to global warming, it could be hotter than ever!

column1: May I recommend you Tsingtao beer ;
column2: Tsingtao beer?
column3: Yes, sir. It's one of the best beers in China.
column4: Really?
column5: Yes. The beer is brewed by using carefully selected malts, rice, hops and natural water from the Lao Mountain.
column6: How about its taste?
column7: Fine, sir.
column8: That sounds great. Two Tsingtao beers, please.
column9: Tin or bottle?
column10: Tin, please.

column1: Watch out!
column2: Wow! That car almost hit me.

column1: Jacob, are you interested in helping me out and going on a blind date with a friend of mine?
column2: That depends. What does she look like?
column3: Well, she's got a beautiful face and long curly red hair.
column4: How tall is she?
column5: She's fairly tall, maybe 2 inches taller than me.
column6: Is she chubby?
column7: Not at all. She's actually very athletic.
column8: It sounds like she's pretty good-looking. Does she wear glasses?
column9: No, but she does wear contact lenses.
column10: How's her skin?
column11: She's got a gorgeous complexion with a few freckles on her nose.
column12: Does she have any piercings or tattoos?
column13: I think she has her ears pierced and she definitely has a few tattoos
column14: What's the tattoo on her foot like?
column15: It's a butterfly - everyone in her family has one.
column16: Even her mom?
column17: Yes, even her mom.
column18: What's her personality like?
column19: She's a lot like me.
column20: So there is something wrong with her! It was beginning to sound like she was too good to be true!

column1: Which route are you interested in?
column2: I think the four days' tour from New York to Atlantic City will be fine.
column3: That's a good choice.
column4: What is the departure date?
column5: We have parties every Saturday from June to October.

column1: Can you help me pick out a gift for my daughter ;
column2: She might like a laptop computer.
column3: Yes, that sounds like a good idea.
column4: Might I suggest a Mac?
column5: Okay. How much?
column6: Well, a 15 - inch Pro is $ 2,100.
column7: Oh, that sounds great. I'll take it.
column8: Great. How would you like to pay for it?
column9: Here's my VISA.
column10: Let me ring you up. Okay, sign here, please.

column1: Can you tell me where the produce is?
column2: It's in aisle A.
column3: Do you know what produce is on sale?
column4: I don't know. Check the flyer or check with the produce person.

column1: Driver, bring me to the station.
column2: OK.
column3: Can you please speed up? I am catching the train.
column4: I am sorry. There is a speed limit.
column5: Oh, my god.

column1: Who wants to go first? Allen?
column2: Uh... I mostly just like to listen. You're the groom. Why don't you go first?
column3: OK. Put on something by the Backstreet Boys!
column4: How about " As long as You Love Me "! You can pretend you're singing it to your fiancee Brooke!
column5: I'd better not. Brooke hates the Backstreet Boys!

column1: Is that boy standing there your brother?
column2: No.My brother is playing football there.
column3: He's really a good player.
column4: Thank you for your compliments.

column1: Good afternoon, Pan Am. May I help you?
column2: Yes. I'd like to make a reservation to New York for 18th next month.
column3: Please wait a moment. Let me check for you.The flight is FW 711 and it arrives at 10:00 am.
column4: How long is that journey?
column5: 14 hours.
column6: Thank you.

column1: We have another traditional holiday-the Dragon Boat Festival.
column2: When is it?
column3: It falls on the fifth day of the fifth lunar month.
column4: Could you tell me the origin of the two festivals?
column5: OK. The Dragon Boat Festival is a way to commemorate a great ancient poet named Quyuan. On that day, people will hold a boat race as a symbol of the attempt to save him who threw himself into the river.
column6: Why do people eat rice cakes on that day?
column7: In order to prevent the fish from eating the poet's body.
column8: It sounds so moving.

column1: Mom, you know that Andrea and I sometimes worry about you.
column2: Really? Why would you worry about me? I ’ m just fine.
column3: You ’ re almost 70 years old, Mom! Don ’ t you think it would be better for you if you moved in with us?
column4: No way! I like my apartment, and I like to be independent.
column5: Do you ever get lonely living alone?
column6: Not at all. I see you and your family twice a week, and I enjoy seeing my own friends. I ’ m too busy to feel lonely!

column1: I'm sorry to trouble you but there is a lot of noise in next room.
column2: Oh, is there? Which room is it?
column3: It..., I think the neighbor on the right.
column4: You mean the room 1818?
column5: I'm not sure, but I think so. I'm very exhaust but I can't sleep.
column6: All right madam, I'll check and tell them to be quiet.
column7: If the nest room is still noisy, could you give me a different room please?

column1: I have been working 70 hours this week. I am totally maxed out.
column2: 70 hours? I would be dead if I worked hard like that.

column1: The boat is ready to leave.Everyone come onto the ship, please.
column2: Excuse me, where is my cabin?
column3: Can I see your ticket?
column4: Of course. Here you are.
column5: Your seat is in cabin No. 5, the upper deck. It ’ s near amid ship.
column6: Can you direct the place for me?
column7: There! ( Point out the direction. ) You can see a window there.
column8: I see. Thank you.
column9: You are welcome. Have a good trip!

column1: Excuse me, what time is the next train to New York?
column2: Half past 11.
column3: Is it a through one?
column4: No, it's an express.
column5: Well, please give me a first class ticket.

column1: Thanks for the advice, Mr. Macmillan. I'll keep it in mind. I had better head off though. I ’ m meeting my husband for dinner.
column2: Sure, I'm heading out myself. Enjoy your evening.
column3: Thanks, sir. You too. Drive safely, I hear there ’ s a lot ice on the roads.
column4: Thanks for the warning! See you tomorrow!

column1: Come on, Jenny, we are heading our way to the Opera House.
column2: I am dead tired and I can't walk any further.
column3: Oh, I am sorry, I thought you were not.
column4: Why don't we stop and have a rest here?
column5: Fine. Actually I am a little tired too. Want some water?

column1: I'm sorry to interrupt you. Please take care not to make a mess while you are selecting goods. If you don't want it, please replace it.
column2: Oh, I'm terribly sorry. but I couldn't find the yoghurt I saw here last time.
column3: What's the brand?
column4: San Yuan.
column5: Oh, it's out of stock at the moment. Why don't you choose another brand instead?
column6: I'm not used to other brands.
column7: You can have a try. Maybe you will like it.
column8: OK. I hope so.

column1: Great party, isn't it?
column2: Yeah, really, jane and ted always have great parties.
column3: This is my first, I only met jane last week. she and I teach at the same school.
column4: Oh, so you're a teacher.
column5: Yeah, history, what about you?
column6: I'm in the car business.
column7: Salesman?
column8: Yes, that's right.
column9: Oh, I see, by the way, my name's Mary.
column10: Nice to meet you, I'm jim taylor.

column1: It's taking you forever to do my hair.
column2: Give me a minute.
column3: You should've been done already.

column1: How often do you use the internet?

column5: Yes, I like the job though. Sometimes, I help other people in the office if they ’ re having trouble online.

column7: I think it ’ s fairly useful, but there are two big problems. First, a lot of the information you find online is false. Second, when you buy something online, you don ’ t see it until you actually get it.
column8: How do you solve the website problems when you ’ re buying something online?
column9: What I do is find the website of shops. Then someone from our company visits the shop and buys when they ’ re seen that the products are genuine and suitable.

column1: Why am I being charged $ 10 for a movie that I never ordered?

column1: Oh, my God! I've been cheated!
column2: What? What did you buy?
column3: It's a brick! I can't believe how stupid I was. Damn it!
column4: What is it? Why did you buy a brick?
column5: There was a guy on the sidewalk.He had three new boxes, Panasonic video camera boxes.He said he had to get rid of them quick.
column6: And?
column7: So he said he'd sell me one for twenty dollars. A four-hundred-dollar camera for twenty bucks.
column8: And it's a brick?
column9: Yes.
column10: I can't believe how stupid you are. Why didn't you open the box?
column11: I wanted to. But he said, no, the box is still in its plastic wrap from the store.If it's opened, other people won't believe it's new.
column12: So he had the boxes wrapped in plastic.
column13: Yes, it was the kind of perfect plastic wrap that comes with new products.Look, it even had a bar-code price sticker on it! It looked brand new.
column14: But why would a guy be selling new video cameras for twenty dollars?
column15: He said he had to get rid of them. They were stolen.
column16: Aha! Now I understand.You were trying to buy stolen goods on the sidewalk.So, what I think is, you deserve to get cheated!
column17: C'mon, don't blame me! I thought it was a new camera. We could use it.We were even thinking about buying a camera. I don't understand how he could have such a perfect-looking box.
column18: That's no problem.He just has a friend who works in a shop that can do plastic wrap. That's easy.And probably it's the same shop he got the boxes from.Maybe his friend works in an electronics store. They sell video cameras there. Probably they had a couple video camera boxes lying around.So they get the idea of wrapping bricks to sell to fools like you.Twenty dollars a brick. That's a good profit if they can sell enough bricks.
column19: You're right, Sarah. I was a fool. I can't believe it. How could I fall for such a trick?

column1: There are so many environment problems in the world today. Do you think we can really solve them all or will destroy the world?
column2: I hope that world leaders can get together and agree on a plan for action, but I doubt it ’ ll happen before it ’ s too late.
column3: We need to solve the problem of air pollution before we destroy the atmosphere. There ’ s lots of clean, modern technology, but companies in developed countries say it ’ s expensive. Developing countries put more emphasis on economic development than on environment protection.
column4: Everyone is looking at the issue in the short term, rather than the long term. It ’ s the same with the destruction of the rainforests. Countries and companies just want the wood. They ’ re not thinking about the long-term damage to the forests. We should also remember that the forests are an important natural habitat for thousands of species of animal and plant life.
column5: In other parts of the world, especially in Africa, there is a problem with desertification. Climate change and over-farming are causing farmland to turn into desert. In means that people cannot grow enough food.
column6: It also means that people sometimes fight over the famp 3land that remains. Damaging the environment actually leads to conflict between people.
column7: Have you ever thought about joining an organization committed to protecting the environment? You could get involved with projects to improve the environment.
column8: I think I ’ d like to do that. I could take the things I learn here back to my country when I have finished my studies.

column1: A Westerner said to his Chinese friend. “ Chinese people slurp when drinking soup. It ’ s disgusting. ” The Chinese friend replied, “ Westerners make a lot of noise licking their fingers when eating. It ’ s even worse. ”
column2: Everyone has his own habits, but these habits are not very good. The noise often spoils other people ’ s appetite.
column3: I attended a course on table manners while I was in the United States. Some of the things we learnt included how to place the napkin and utensils and how to pass the bread. Before each course, the teacher would ask if we wanted to learn the Continental European way or the American way. We always said “ American way. ” It ’ s amazing that everyone is so used to their own table manners. What is the Chinese way?
column4: The westerners use knives and forks to eat so it is complicated. The Chinese use a pair of chopsticks and eat out of the same plate. I assume it is less complicated, right?
column5: Not really. I did some research about Chinese table manners. The important rule is to remain silent while eating. Of course, this refers to family meals only. Not talking over meals is supposed to be good for the health. It is impolite if people do not talk to each other during a social party. The table arrangements and serving order for a social party are equally complicated. Each dish should be placed in the correct position. When fish is served, the tail should be pointing at the guest because tail meat is supposed to be tasty. If it is in winter, the stomach should face the right-hand side of the guest because that portion of the fish is very rich in winter. Each dish should be commenced by the eldest person who is seated at the head of the table. The diners should sit close to the table so food won ’ t drop on their cloths. No noise should be made when chewing. No one should move food back to the communal plate even if he doesn ’ t like it. One should drink soup slowly and is not supposed to make a lot of noise. All these table manners are very similar to Western habits.
column6: It seems that people share the same basic sense of etiquette regardless of their background. Apart from the different tools used for eating we seem to follow the same principles. We do not let inappropriate manners spoil other people ’ s appetite.Westerners like to say, “ bon appetite ” before meals which is one way to suggest “ mind your table manners. ” Is there such an expression in Chinese?
column7: Yes. We say “ eat well and drink well. ”

column4: Which financial magazines and newspapers do you think do the best job of checking facts?
column5: Well, for example, The Wall Street Journal is very, very good. Even though it's used on occasion ( as all news organizations are ) by Ces or bankers who leak their mergers in advance in order to get a positive spin.
column6: I like to read Fortune.
column7: Good. Fortune is usually ahead of the curve.And Business Week is very solid, too.
column8: Where does a broadcast company get most of their information? I hope it's not just from press releases.
column9: A good broadcast company usually does far more than press releases.Their people go out and do real reporting, talking to people at the stock exchange, fund managers, analysts, etc.
column10: But sometimes when a flimsy report, or even a rumor gets on television, there's going to be a terrible' echo chamber' effect.

It comes from the information technology industry.. there isn't such a large division between home and office, so people want to work in the clothes they feel more relaxed in.
column3: Maybe so, but it seems kind of strange, which the rest of us in white shirts, dark suites, and ties.

column1: Did you hear what's going on downtown today? All the orders from the factory are staging a demonstration in the streets. Not one of the two thousand employees showed up for work today, and they have gathered outside the city hall to demand better working conditions for all factory employees.
column2: Wow, sounds chaotic... two thousand people in the streets carrying picket signs and shouting slogans. What gave them the motivation to finally organize and call management on the substandard working conditions?

While I did that I also turned on the radio and was listening to one of my favorite songs, and eating some food I had bought at a fast food restaurant, and, um... guess I had too many distractions.
column11: That ’ s definitely true. I ’ m going to have to give you a ticket. Please remember to drive more carefully next time.

column1: Hey, you ’ re early! Where ’ s everyone?

column7: Are you serious? We ’ Ve been friends for years! We can ’ t just change that overnight!
column8: I know! I never had the guts to tell you... until today. So, what do you say? Are you willing to give me a shot?

column9: Early in the New Year I guess.

column1: Who is this on the water buffalo ;

column6: My grand grandfather was a merchant who ran a small business. He couldn't afford to send my grand father to school.
column7: So he became a self-taught man?
column8: Right. Later he was a soldier and a fireman in the village. When he was middle aged, he became a great man, quite famous.
column9: In what field?
column10: As a leader of police officers in charge of the whole country.

column9: The restaurant is on the second floor. Here is the key to your room. It's on the 6th floor, room 609. The elevator is over there. And we also have a cafeteria on the top floor, if you would like something to drink, you can also call room service.

column1: Tomorrow I'll take you to some places that I'm sure you will have interest in.
column2: Where else haven't we been to yet?
column3: They are the Folk Antique Handicrafts and Collectibles Exhibition Halls.
column4: Sounds great! How many kinds of folk collections do they have?
column5: Well. there're actually over 200 kinds of folk collections in this city. That's half the collections of antique objects in China. There's one exhibition half for multiple collection, and several individual display rooms for private collectors.
column6: Private collectors! They must have excellent collections. I'II go and see each of them. What kinds of collections can I see? Come on, don't keep me in suspense!
column7: No hurry! I'II tell you now, The collections include ancient cases and caskets, tea sets, abacuses, precious sea shells and conches, drama costumes, agates, ancient coins, fans, mini-musical instruments, root-carving, rare stones and rocks, model ships, model cars...
column8: Enough! I can't wait anymore.

column9: Yes. You are free to do temporary business with this visa. If you were planning on setting up a new business in the U. S. you might need to apply for a long-term visa.
