column1: Hi Jane, you look great.
column2: You too. Have you lost some weight?
column3: Yes, I took off 4 kilos. I am glad you notice it.
column4: Not some crazy diet fat I hope.
column5: No no, I just changed my eating habits. I eat a balanced meal. and I eat less than before.
column6: Good for you, keep it up.

column1: you haven't spent much time with Sophia lately. Are you speaking to each other at the moment ;
column2: no, we're not. We've been drifting apart for a while.
column3: but you two used to do everything together. I thought you really enjoyed each other's company.
column4: we did, but since she started her new job, all she does is hang out with her new friends from work.
column5: can't you hang out with them, too?
column6: I could, but all they ever talk about is work, so I always end up feeling left out.
column7: maybe you should invite her over for dinner, so it's just the two of you.
column8: I tried that a few weeks ago and she ended bringing a pal from work with her! She's so busy these days that it's just impossible to hang out with her.
column9: it can't be that bad. She was always a really good friend to you.
column10: you're right. She would never talk about me behind my back or hold a grudge. But she just doesn't seem very interested in our friendship anymore.

column1: Please excuse me, but I really have to be going.
column2: Yes, of course. It was nice to see you.
column3: It was nice to see you, too. And please give my regards to Mrs.Robbins.

column1: Hi there! I am looking for a new car. I have this old Ford Pinto that I would like to trade in.
column2: I see. You are in luck this month because all of our models are on sale! it is a perfect time to buy a new car since it ’ s the end of the year.
column3: Perfect! I like this one.
column4: That is the Ford Focus. A very light but powerful vehicle. It comes with dual side airbags, power steering and power windows, tinted windows and your choice of either automatic or manual transmission.
column5: Sounds like a good car! How many miles to the gallon?
column6: It is a very fuel efficient vehicle giving you about 34 miles in the city and 40 on the highway.
column7: That is really convenient. Especially now that fuel prices are so high! What ’ s under the hood?
column8: A very powerful 2.5- liter turbocharged engine, Trust me, this car is fast!
column9: Now for the most difficult question. What is the price tag for this lovely vehicle?
column10: Very affordable sir. You can take it out of this lot today with 0 % down payment and no interest for the first year! You can test drive it now and we can sign the papers when we get back.
column11: Great! Let ’ s do it!

column1: How long have you been in Taiwan?
column2: About 3 years, so I came here 2000.
column3: So, where did you grow up?
column4: Providence, Rhode Island. do you know it?
column5: I am not sure, where exactly is it?
column6: Well, not so far from New York. So what about you? Did you grow up here?
column7: No, I was born in Gaoxiong, I only moved to Taipei after I graduated.

column1: How was your morning jog?
column2: Very good. I feel quite refreshed now! You should come with me sometime - exercise is good for you!
column3: To be honest, I ’ d rather watch television! Where did you go?
column4: I just ran alongside the main road.
column5: Oh you ought to go to the park next time. They have a route for joggers there.
column6: Oh ok, I ’ ll try that tomorrow. It ’ ll probably be better than fighting with the traffic! Go on, why don ’ t you come along?
column7: Oh ok then, I ’ ll come and watch you!

column1: You're acting weird tonight.
column2: I'm just in the mood to act goofy.
column3: What brought this on?
column4: I guess I'm glad exams are over.

column1: What are we going to do? I can't get the car out of this ditch. I'm stuck!
column2: I'm worried, Tom. I haven't seen any other cars for almost an hour.
column3: I know. This is terrible. What can we do? This snow doesn't stop falling!
column4: I told you we should have stayed in town today.The weather report said 100 percent chance of snow.Why did you want to come up here?
column5: I wanted to show you the cabin. We only had another half-hour to go.
column6: Well, now we're stuck. What can we do?
column7: I don't know.
column8: I've heard that when this happens, it's important to save energy.
column9: What do you mean?
column10: We're stranded here, Tom. We may be here a long time.We need to conserve the gas in the car. The car's energy is what will keep us warm.
column11: I have plenty of gas.
column12: Yes, but the gas and the battery both have to stay working.We can't just let the car run and run.If we do, it will die soon. Then we'll freeze.
column13: So what can we do?
column14: Turn the lights off.Then, run the car and the heater only about fifteen minutes every hour.That will conserve the heat as long as possible.
column15: Alright. That's a good idea.
column16: I wish we hadn't come up here. Now we'll probably be here for days.
column17: Days?
column18: Yes, it happens.That is what happens in big snowstorms. People get stranded for days.
column19: Oh, my God! It's good we have food.
column20: Probably we'll survive.But turn the car off for about forty-five minutes. Then we'll turn it on again.

column1: Do you have these shoes in a size 7?
column2: Yes. Let me get you a pair.

column1: Can you book me a single room on March 31?
column2: Sorry, I'm afraid the hotel is full on those dates.Shall I contact another hotel for you?
column3: Yes, please.

column1: Can I help you?
column2: Yes, is there any vacant room for tomorrow?
column3: I am sorry. We are full up for tomorrow.
column4: Well, is there any other hotel nearby?
column5: Yes, the Sunset Hotel is three blocks away. Maybe you can ask them.
column6: Thank you.

column1: Did you read the letter in the paper about smoking? The person who wrote that must be crazy.
column2: I don ’ t think so. I think the government should do everything it can to discourage people from smoking.
column3: Maybe so. But a law banning cigarettes will do no good.
column4: No, you can ’ t suddenly make smoking illegal, but government could prohibit smoking in public places like movies and theatres.

column1: Hi, Nicole. Did you have a good weekend?
column2: Yes, I did. But I feel tired today.
column3: Really? Why?
column4: Well, on Saturday I cleaned the house and played tennis. Then on Sunday I hiked in the country.
column5: And I bet you studied, too.
column6: Yeah. I studied on Sunday evening. What about you?
column7: Well, I didn't clean the house and I didn't study. I stayed in bed and watched TV.
column8: That sounds like fun, but did you exercise?
column9: Sort of. I played golf on my computer!

column1: Now, what seems to be the trouble?
column2: It's nothing serious. But I always have a headache, and I haven't slept properly for several weeks. I've also lost appetite and my eyes are burning.
column3: Mm, you do look rather pale. Let me take your temperature. Would you put the thermometer under your arm, please? Now, let me listen to your pulse. Mm, do you feel weak?
column4: Yes, I never seem to have any energy.
column5: I'll give you a blood test. Would you roll up your sleeve? Just as I thought. You're anemic. You'd better pay more attention to your diet. Eat plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables and food high in protein. And don't stay up late working. Try to get more rest.
column6: Thank you.

column1: So, did I tell you about my New Year ’ s resolution? I ’ Ve decided to go on a diet.
column2: And you ’ re going to completely transform your eating habits, right?
column3: Exactly! I ’ m going to cut out all that junk I eat, no more chips, no more soda, no more fried food.
column4: I ’ Ve heard this one before.
column5: But this time I ’ m going to stick to it. I really mean it! Trust me, Carol, I ’ m going to be a new man in one year ’ s time!
column6: Well, I guess we ’ ll just have to wait and see.
column7: Thanks, honey, that was a great meal. I ’ m stuffed. Do we have any chips left?

column1: Look! There are playing The Matrix today.
column2: You are right, look at the crowd. Do you think we will be able to get tickets?
column3: I don't know. If we can't, we can buy from ticket scalpers.
column4: No way. I'd rather go to another movie house.
column5: Come on. We are already here. Besides, I really wanna see this picture.
column6: All right. Let's see when the next movie is playing?
column7: Seven thirty. There is only 10 minutes left and look at the long line!
column8: Shall we take a chance?
column9: Yeah, let's do so.
column10: It's moving so slow.
column11: What can you expect with this crowd? I am praying that no one will cut in the line.
column12: I don't think anyone will.
column13: I hope not. We are getting closer.. two more... one more... it's our turn.

column1: I ’ m so excited, mother. Oh, a new baby!
column2: My first grandchild.
column3: And my first nephew. He looks a lot like you, mum. He does.
column4: Do you think so? Well, I guess. He does look a lot like me. Oh, he ’ s got Richard ’ s eyes though.
column5: Yes, he does have Richard ’ s eyes. The baby even looks like you than Richard does.
column6: Well, children usually resemble their parents.
column7: It ’ s true. Michelle is a lot like Henry in so many ways. And she is shy with new people just like he is.
column8: You often like comparing children with their parents.
column9: You ’ re right.

column4: Nice meeting you, too.

column2: No, what?
column3: She had to go to the hospital.

column9: Well, it's not just the girl ’ s fault. It's also society's fault - magazines and ads that show - thin models all saying, It's in to be thin. It's hard for them not to listen.
column10: True, but there are limits. Being thin is one thing ; starving oneself to death is another. No one forces them to do this.

column3: Will you sit here, please? How would you like it cut?
column4: I want it short.
column5: But it's short already, sir.
column6: I mean very short, shorter than it is now.
column7: Shall I just trim it?
column8: No, You can cut quite a bit off. I like it to be very short all over. Do you see what I mean?
column9: Oh, I see. You like the Chinese style, don't you?
column10: Yes, in the Chinese style.
column11: Would you like to have a shampoo, sir?
column12: No, thank you.
column13: How about oil or spray?
column14: No, nothing of the kind.
column15: There! How is that?
column16: That's very good!

column1: Bob, you look pale. What happened?
column2: I didn't sleep a wink last night.
column3: Did you have something on your mind? You look so concerned! Maybe I can help you.
column4: Well, I'm under a lot of pressure. My boss is very pushy. He assigned me two projects. Now the deadlines are near and I still haven't finish one of them.
column5: Is there anything I can do for you?
column6: Well, I guess no one can help me but myself. For the moment, I just need someone to talk to so that I can relieve my stress.
column7: I know your feeling. Take it easy.

column1: Hi, I would like to purchase a one way ticket to Brussels, please.
column2: Certainly sir, this is our train schedule. We have an express train departing every morning and an overnight train that departs at nine pm.
column3: How long does it take to get there?
column4: About twelve hours. We currently have tickets available only for first class on the express train. If you ’ d like, you can choose a sleeper on the overnight train which is a bit less expensive.
column5: Yeah, I think that is the best option. Do you serve food on the train? Twelve hours is such a long time!
column6: Yes, of course. There is a dining car towards the front of the train where they serve meals at all times. We do provide complimentary water and coffee for all of our passengers.
column7: Great! I ’ ll take it.
column8: Here you are sir. Your train leaves from platform number nine at nine on the dot. Remember to be here at least thirty minutes before your scheduled departure time or else you might miss your train!
column9: I understand. Thank you very much!
column10: Have a great trip.

column1: I'm feeling hungry.
column2: Isn't it time for dinner?
column3: Yes, let's get something to eat.
column4: How about Mac Donald's?

column1: Hi, I would like to return this TV.
column2: Sure, do you have the receipt?
column3: Yeah here you go. Actually I also want to return this keyboard.
column4: Ok. may I ask what is the reason for returning these products?
column5: The TV flickers a lot when I am watching a movie and at times the image is not very clear.
column6: I see, and what about the keyboard?
column7: I spilled some coffee on it and now it won't work.
column8: I am sorry mam, but we can only exchange or refund defective products, we cannot take responsibility for misuse or damages.
column9: Fine! I don't know why they make these things so delicate anyways.

column1: Do you like the cookies?
column2: I finished them in no time.
column3: Glad you like it.
column4: Mum, when will we have them again?

column1: How do you get along with your co-workers?
column2: I get along pretty well with most of them.It seems there are always a few rotten apples in the bunch, though, Like Margaret. I don't know why management hasn't fired her yet.She' s a terrible gossip.
column3: Do you think management should fire someone just because they gossip?
column4: It's not only that she gossips, but she also tries to start problems among other employees by spreading rumors and telling lies about her co-workers.She' s not trustworthy, and in my opinion, I think she's nuts.
column5: So how do you develop good relationships in the office?
column6: I think one of the important things is just to be considerate of your co-workers'feelings and needs.If you are aware of other people and do your part to make a good working environment, you should be able to get along with most of the people you work with.
column7: I think you're right, but it does seem that there are always a few co — workers that are harder to work with than others.

column1: Did your eye doctor prescribe you contact lenses?
column2: No, I ’ d like to know something about contact lenses.
column3: Oh, I see. We have both hard and soft contact lenses. They are very popular, but a little more expensive than ordinary glasses.
column4: I have found I ’ m short-sighted recently. I need to wear glasses. As a student, it ’ s better for me to wear ordinary glasses instead of contact lenses.
column5: We have many kinds of glasses here. Which frames do you like best?
column6: I think the square-shaped ones will be the best for me.
column7: What about this pair? They are the' in' things now in optical wear. Try them on.
column8: They fit me very well. I like them.
column9: Please go to receive optometry first over there.

column1: I Don't know how they do it! Our competitors have undercut us by 10 % percent on the price of our latest model. There is no way will be able to compete against that. We're barely breaking even with the present prices.
column2: These price wars are disastrous for our bottom line. If they're charging 10 % less than we are, we've got to find a way to lower our price while keeping our profit.
column3: Profits are almost nonexistent now, we can't beat their price. How do they keep their price so low?
column4: We can try to lower our cost of production then. We need a price that we can compete with, something comparable with the competition.
column5: You really think we can make it? I don't have much faith in our ability to lower the price again. We're no match for them, the competition will beat us hands down.

column1: So, what do you think? How do you like New York?
column2: I'm having a great time. I love it. I'm glad we came.
column3: Yeah. I really like the stores and the shopping.
column4: I love the museums, too.
column5: But the traffic is pretty bad.
column6: Yeah. I hate all this traffic. It's really noisy.
column7: Listen, it's almost dinnertime.There are lots of restaurant around here.What do you want to try? Italian? Greek? Japanese? Thai?
column8: I can't stand making decisions. You choose!
column9: OK. Let's go American. Where's the nearest McDonald's?

column1: Good morning, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: I'm Jack in Room 606. Can you change the room for me? It's too noisy. My friend was woken up several times by the noise from upstairs. He said it was too much for him.
column3: I'm awfully sorry, sir. I do apologize. A ten-year-old boy and a mother live upstairs. Maybe the boy is a little bit naughty.
column4: Anyway, I'd like to change our room.
column5: No problem, sir. We'll manage it.

column1: What do you think of the former champ?
column2: There were some bad misses in his defence, so he lost it.
column3: No champion can remain at the top for ever.
column4: I suppose he's not in top form.

column1: This place is so quiet and peaceful. It ’ s really different from my pad at city.
column2: Sure, do you think you could live out here? You know, back to nature at all?
column3: I don ’ t know. I don ’ t mind coming out here for a while, but that will get old pretty soon.
column4: That ’ s what I was thinking. I mean can you imagine Friday night instead of going out with your friends you ’ d have to stay in your tree house and talk to birds and squirrels.
column5: I think I ’ d go lonely if I do like that.
column6: And where would you get a cup of cappuccino?
column7: Now that would be hard to live without. We city folks are pretty spoiled.
column8: Maybe. But I ‘ d rather be spoiled than turn into a crazy guy with a long period to talk to the birds.

column1: Steven, it's ten o'clock. I'm going to bed. I'm beat.
column2: Okay. I'm going to stay up a while. I've got to go over the household budget. We've sightly overspent this month.
column3: Oh, can't you do it tomorrow? It's already past 10.
column4: But I'm not sleepy, darling. I want to finish it today.
column5: Okay. Please close the door to the basement before you go to bed. I don't want the dog down there tonight.
column6: Okay. Good night. Have a good dream.
column7: Good night.

column1: What's the cost of the trousers?
column3: Is there a price reduction?
column4: Sorry, sir. The prices here are all fixed.

column1: I didn't expect to see you at this hour. You must have goofed off again.
column2: Goofed off? Maybe, but I'm not a clock-watcher. I finished doing what I should do and then knock off an hour earlier.
column3: You'll be sorry if the boss finds it out. He may probably give you the bag.
column4: I'm sure of what I'm doing.

column1: I would love to rent this apartment ;
column2: I ’ m happy to hear you say that.
column3: How much are you asking for every month?
column4: I ’ m renting this apartment out for $ 1050 a month.
column5: That is quite a lot of money for just one month.
column6: That is a fair price.
column7: What do you say to $ 850 a month?
column8: That ’ s no good.
column9: It ’ s either $ 850 or nothing at all.
column10: I won ’ t go any lower than $ 1050.

column1: Good afternoon, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: I'd like to get this prescription filled.
column3: No problem. Please wait a minute. ( She goes to the back for a few minutes. ) Here is your medicine, sir. Take two tablets after each meal and once before bed.
column4: Thanks. Do you sell aspirin here?
column5: Yes, our over-the-counter medicine is over there on that shelf.
column6: Oh, I see it. Do you have multi-vitamins?
column7: Yes, right over here.
column8: ( The customer gets the aspirin and vitamins. ) That'll be $ 16.00.
column9: Here's a twenty.
column10: Here's your change. Thank you.

column1: What's the matter, John? you seemed to be restless today.
column2: You see, I've been offered a new job. I can't decide whether to take it or not.
column3: Oh, that's easy. If it's better than the one you are doing now, go for it. That's my advice.
column4: It isn't that easy. I hate to quit my present job. People around here are very nice and the work itself is challenging.
column5: Then what about the salary? Would you get more?
column6: Yes, they say I would get a big sum.
column7: Have you discussed it with your wife?
column8: Yes, she leaves it to me.
column9: As I say it the work is well worth try. After all you can get a higher salary.
column10: I have to think about it.

column1: Room service.what can I do for you?
column2: I would like to have my room cleaned. Would you please send a maid here right now?
column3: OK. Someone will be there right away.
column4: Thank you.

column1: Look at the catalogue, John. I think I want to get this red blouse
column2: Don't you have one like this in blue?
column3: Yah, but it doesn't have a red one.
column4: Do you need every color in the rainbow?
column5: Yes!
column6: Ze ze ze... Women!

column1: There are so many eating utensils on the table. Which ones do I use first?
column2: Use them from the outside in.
column3: I see. A set for appetizers and another for the main course.
column4: Right. We do the same thing at home. Don't you remember?
column5: Oh yeah. The big napkin goes on my lap.
column6: Let's look at our menus.
column7: Cindy, help me order because I'm still not very familiar with American cooking.
column8: Well, we order appetizers first and then entrees.

column1: Here's some flowers, love. Happy Valentine's Day.
column2: Those are beautiful. They smell lovely. Thank you.
column3: This is let you know that I still you after all this years. I knew there are some up and down when I married you, but through at all, you've always been may my Valentine.
column4: Oh, sweet. You've always been my love too.
column5: I don't think I say this enough, but I want to thank you for your kind listen patience, you' Ve always been there for me.
column6: I'll do everything for you, love. You know that, maybe you didn't realize, but you made everyday a enjoys moment and happy occasion.
column7: I am so glad we met one another.

column1: Mary, I think we should stop seeing each other.
column2: But, Bob, we were so good together.
column3: I'm sorry but it's for the best.
column4: I don't understand. We were getting along so well.

column1: Thank God, it's Friday! Time for a drink! Let's hit the bars!
column2: OK. I don't mind going bar hopping with an expert like you.
column3: Should we start with beer or wine or go straight to the hard liquor?
column4: I think I'll have a glass of wine. Let's see... they have red wine, white wine and port. They even have sangria! It's the happy hour special.
column5: Port's too sweet. It's a dessert wine. A dry red French wine would be nice with meat. A glass of chilled white German wine would be good with fish. But, we're not eating and it's hot out, so I think I'll have a tall glass of sangria with ice.
column6: Good choice! But, what's your favorite kind of hard liquor?
column7: I like to stick to the clean stuff, like vodka, gin, white rum and other clear spirits.

column1: Hey, look out!
column2: What happened?
column3: You've just scratched my car. Oh, God, a paint was scratched off.
column4: Where? my car?
column5: No, mine!
column6: Thank goodness!
column7: I've just had it repainted.
column8: That's terrible.
column9: I am sorry to say this, sir, but you should've been more careful.
column10: I apologize for that. But the space is too small.
column11: What about the damage to my car? What are you gonna do about that?
column12: Can we solve this later? I am calling the insurance company.
column13: OK. I gotta call mine too.

column1: Why are you shivering?
column2: It's freezing.

column1: Oh, no. It seems that I've lost my train ticket.
column2: Are you kidding? The train leaves in an hour. Where did you put it?
column3: It was in my pocket, but now I can't find it.
column4: Is it in the other pocket?
column5: No, it is not here. Damn it! I'm going to have to buy another ticket.
column6: Let's go to the inquiry desk first to check whether anyone has got it and turned it in.
column7: OK.

column1: Wow! So many students crowded in. More than I excepted, we are lucky to arrive in hour earlier. Or else we definedly have problems to getting good seats.
column2: I learned my lesson from the last experience. I didn't arrive early enough. So I ended up with a terrible seat, All the way up in the front row. It was one of my worst movie experiences ever.
column3: Yeah, I hate sitting in the front row.
column4: By the way, it was really thoughtful if you to get me the ticket. I really appreciate it, I'll buy some popcorn, and drinks for us.
column5: That would be great.
column6: I'll be back as soon as possible. Oh, I almost forgot I'd better hold on to my ticket stop in case of they let me in.
column7: Ok.

column1: We have a great variety of men's suits, sir.Which particular brand do you prefer?
column2: Pierre Cardin.
column3: How about this one?
column4: It look fine.Can I try it on?

column1: I'm afraid of the darkness.
column2: Don't worry. I'll drive you back.
column3: Thank you.

column1: I'm really sorry, Bob. I accidentally damaged your bike.
column2: Uh-oh. It'll probably cost a lot to fix it.
column3: I'll make it up to you. Let me know how much it costs and I'll give you the money.

column1: Hi. I need more amenities, please.
column2: Could you be a little more specific, sir?
column3: Well, to be more specific, the free stuff, like soap, lotion, and shampoo.
column4: I understand. Now, you're saying that you've already used up all your amenities?
column5: Oh, no! I've got all I need for my stay here.
column6: So, what's the problem?
column7: I need souvenirs!
column8: You want some souvenirs!
column9: Yes, yes. Souvenirs.
column10: But, sir, our souvenir shop carries all those items.
column11: That's not the same thing. If you buy hotel souvenirs, they have no sentimental value.
column12: I understand, sir. I'll call housekeeping. You'll have your souvenirs shortly.

column1: Will you be okay when you immigrate to America?
column2: Sure, I'm looking forward to it.
column3: What about your parents?
column4: I'll get used to not seeing my parents.

column1: We are free this afternoon, aren't we, Mr John?
column2: Yes, we are visiting the exhibition this afternoon, and look around Beijing city, wouldn't we?
column3: It's very kind of you, Mr John.the sightseeing trip between our business talk will be sort of our work division.business can be make for pleasure.what kind of exhibition we're going to see?
column4: It's industrial exhibition, in origin show the results of new industrial products in the city. a lot of products there to meet the needs of home and export
column5: Could you give more detail information about some of the industries you just mentioned?
column6: Yes.take the oil industry for instance.you know there are twenty oil resources in China.you can see many chemical products in the exhibition.such as chemical fabrics as I dress.
column7: What the others?
column8: There are chemical materials, medicines, rubber, plastics and so on, many products and meet the domestic markets, we are also trying to meet international markets.
column9: How about textile industry?
column10: Textile is a traditional industry, which has completely catalogue, and solid basis and has developed in the past few years.the export is great, counting more than 25 % of export products
column11: That's surprising, three days ago when I went to yancheng store, I saw different kinds of textile goods. I've bought some for my wife, some for my friends.they seem very attractive.
column12: That's good. I think they must like them.in recently years, light industry have be developing in Standley, and place a credible role in our industry sister.these industry including leather, bikes, household electric products, clocks, sporting goods and so on.many of them are very popular at home and abroad.
column13: I'm sure I'll enjoy seeing them.and will have more information of your city industry.what is more? I'd like to visit if it is possible.the famous Goumi street in the city.
column14: No problem, this street is nearly built along the both sides of this street.there is stores, restaurant follow the style of tradition chinese building, the guest come there taste very traditional favorite dishes.
column15: I am sure I'll enjoy some real chinese food then.

column1: Hey, let's eat out tonight.
column2: What's the occasion? You won the lottery?
column3: No. Just want to relax a little bit. You don't have to win the lottery to relax, do you?
column4: Well, I am kind of broke.
column5: Come on. It's on me.
column6: Really? It's very nice of you.
column7: Don't be silly. I'll take you anywhere you wanna go.
column8: Wonderful! You know what? I wish you wanted to relax everyday.
column9: Dream on!

column1: Hi, what ’ re you reading?
column2: Oh, it ’ s Death on the Nile. Have you read it?
column3: No, not that one. But I saw the movie. Could I borrow it when you finished.
column4: Sure. I didn ’ t know you liked mysteries.
column5: Oh, I ’ m crazy about them.

column1: I met a girl in elevator this morning. She works in a company upstairs. She said she envied the casual way we dress for work. She complained about the dress rule in her company. It requires everyone to wear formal clothes from Monday to Friday.
column2: Well, I was wondering where those people with professional attire come from. Now, I know the answer.
column3: You know, in a sense, a suits and ties are compulsory for male employees even in July, and no jewelry allowed for most of the female employees. Even the reasonable male leaf is returning the rule, isn ’ t that strict?
column4: To some extent, it is. Anyway, whether they like it or not, they do give people a very good impression.
column5: But it is unjust to judge a book by its cover. If they ’ re not happy or comfortable with their clothes, they can be less productive.

column1: Well, I'm glad you're finally back. I was wondering what happened ;
column2: I feel kind of stupid.
column3: Why?
column4: We got lost coming back. I guess I don't really know this town yet.
column5: You got lost. You're kidding!
column6: No. We took a wrong turn somewhere.And Joseph doesn't know the town at all. So I started giving him directions.But I didn't really know where we were. So we got seriously lost.
column7: You could have called.
column8: I know I could have. But finally we asked someone where we were.
column9: You've been gone for two hours. How could you get lost for so long?
column10: Guess where we ended up.

column1: Merry Christmas, Bill.
column2: Merry Christmas, Jina.
column3: What are you doing there on the computer?
column4: Come have a look, I received many beautiful e-cards. They are from my friends, all over the world. Christmas wishes for all my friends.
column5: That's pretty interesting. Did you get one from Haven? The reason I ask is that I am looking for her number.
column6: Sorry, I don't have it. But I do have her Email. You want me to sent it to you?
column7: Yeah, that would be great. Thanks.
column8: No worries. I just for her card. And you can get her from Email. I would really like to talk to her again. I kind of miss her a little this days.
column9: Thanks million.
column10: My pleasure.

column1: How often does the bus run?
column2: Every five minutes.
column3: Oh, here comes a bus!
column4: It comes on the dot.

column1: Frank ’ s getting married, do you believe this?
column2: Is he really?
column3: Yes, he is. He loves the girl very much.
column4: Who is he marring?
column5: A girl he met on holiday in Spain, I think.
column6: Have they set a date for the wedding?
column7: Not yet.

column1: Excuse me, I need to get to Cambridge today.
column2: Would you like to go by train or by bus?
column3: I am not sure, which one is better?
column4: The bus is cheaper but also slower. It will take about two-and-a-half hours.
column5: And how long does the train take?
column6: If you take the fast train, it will take about 50 minutes.
column7: Where do I catch the train?
column8: The trains for Cambridge leave from King's Cross Station. They run approximately every half hour. Most trains to Cambridge go from Platform 9.
column9: How do I get to King's Cross?
column10: The best way is to take an underground tube train directly to King's Cross. The Underground station is just round the corner from here.
column11: Can you show me on the map?
column12: It is very easy. Just turn right when you leave and then turn right again at the first crossroads. The entrance to the Underground station is about 50 meters further on.
column13: Thank you very much.
column14: You're welcome.

column1: Did you ever get your bus pass?
column2: I don't think I'm going to get one.
column3: Why not?
column4: It's just a waste of cash, man!
column5: Actually, it'll save you money.
column6: Oh, really?
column7: Because you can use your bus pass as many times as you want.
column8: Really?
column9: Yeah, and you never have to worry about scraping for change.
column10: That sounds like a good deal.
column11: Yeah, So, are you going to buy one?
column12: I will.

column1: How do you think about our boss?
column2: He's the nicest boss I've had.
column3: Yes, I think he's the most relaxing person in management.
column4: What's more, he said I was the hardest working person in the office!
column5: That's good. Maybe you'll get promoted.
column6: I hope so.

column1: I'd like to book a ticket to Shanghai ;
column2: When would you like to fly?
column3: As soon as possible. Do you have a flight tomorrow?
column4: I will check, please hold on. Sorry to say that flight is all booked up. Can I book you for the 3rd of September?
column5: That will be OK.
column6: How many people are there in your party?
column7: Just me this time.
column8: What class will you fly? First class? Business class? Or economy class?
column9: Economy class will be fine.
column10: Round trip or one way trip?

column1: May I know where you are going?
column2: Yes. I want to go to Beijing Hotel.
column3: I'm sorry. You are going in the wrong direction.
column4: Oh no! What shall I do?
column5: Don't worry. You can get off at the next stop and go across the street through the overpass. The bus stop is right there.
column6: Thank you very much.
column7: My pleasure.

column1: are you still coming to my place for dinner tomorrow night?
column2: of course. Is the dinner still on?
column3: yes, I was just wondering how you and your roommate were planning on coming to my place.
column4: we were planning on walking both ways since the weather is still nice.
column5: that's what I thought you would do. Listen, I live in a bit of a rough neighborhood. It's just down the street from all the bars. You probably don't want to be walking around after dark.
column6: it can't be that bad.
column7: I wish it wasn't, but there is actually a lot of crime and prostitution around here.
column8: really? I never would have guessed. The criminals must only come out in the evenings, because I've never noticed anything strange when I've been at your house in the daytime.
column9: do me a favor, and take a taxi. It'd make me feel a lot better.
column10: ok, we will. How do you get around in the evenings?
column11: when I first moved in, I walked everywhere. But within a week, I had my purse stolen — just a block away from the police station! Now, I always take public transportation.
column12: has anything else happened to you?
column13: nothing else has happened to me, but I have seen quite a few fights on the streets after the bars close.
column14: well, we'll be careful. Thanks for letting me know.

column1: Did you listen to the weather forecast?
column2: No. Why?
column3: There's a typhoon coming.
column4: No way!
column5: Yep, it should be here by tomorrow night.

column1: Hello, Tony. Fancy meeting you here. How are things going with you?
column2: Not too bad, thanks. And you?
column3: Pretty good! How are your parents these days?
column4: Oh, they are fine. They are enjoying their retirement.
column5: Oh, good. That's nice to hear. Well, I am going to a football match. I need to go.
column6: Say hi to your family for me.
column7: Thanks, I will, byebye!

column1: How was my singing?
column2: Not bad at all.

column1: When were you born may I ask ;
column2: On 20th May 1963.
column3: Do you know what it was according to the lunar calendar?
column4: 27th day of the fourth month.
column5: By the way, could you tell me when the film will begin?
column6: It will begin at five thirty.
column7: I am frigid I can't be there on time.
column8: You can see it tomorrow.
column9: I don't want to miss it today.
column10: See you.

column1: How much do you make a month?
column2: Mind your own business.

column1: Last weekend I didn't want to go out either, so I stayed at home and played video games by myself. It was really fun!
column2: Oh yeah, that sounds pretty cool, I guess...
column3: Yeah, I'm really into video games. In fact, all my friends are on the Internet. I've never met any of them in the real world.
column4: Oh really... well you must be very popular on the Internet. But it's true that it's nice to do some things in the comfort of your own home.

column1: Good afternoon, sir. May I help you?
column2: I booked a table yesterday.
column3: What's your name, please?
column4: Smith.
column5: A minute, please.... Yes, this way, please.

column1: What do you think of this suit? Do I look good or what?
column2: You look great! However, I think you are a little over dressed for dinner.
column3: Didn't they say we're going to the Ritz?
column4: Yes, but not the Ritz Carlton, the " Ritz " is a pizza place with peanut shells on the floor.
column5: In that case, let me make a quick change into my street clothes.
column6: I'll wait right here for you Superman.
column7: Ta da! Let's go to the Ritz!
column8: Can we go to the Carlton next time and can you wear that fabulous suit?

column1: How was your holiday to Cyprus ;
column2: It was so fantastic I didn ’ t really want to come home.
column3: Did you happen to meet someone?
column4: How did you know?
column5: You always act like this when you ’ Ve fallen in love. Who is he? How did you meet?
column6: His name is Tony and we met my first night in Pathos. He works with my sister who lives there.
column7: Was it love at first sight?
column8: Not really. I wasn ’ t looking for a holiday romance, but my sister told me that she had promised him that she ’ d set him up on blind date with me. I didn ’ t think I ’ d have anything to lose, so I went.
column9: And?
column10: Let ’ s just say that by the third date, we both realized that we had fallen in love.

column1: Oh man! I ’ Ve been starving myself for days now and I haven ’ t lost an ounce!
column2: Are you trying to lose weight?
column3: Yeah, my friend is getting married next month and I ’ m supposed to be a bridesmaid. I have to fit into my dress and look nice for her wedding, but I haven ’ t lost any weight! Look at these love handles.
column4: You don ’ t have to starve yourself to lose weight. I think that ’ s where you ’ re going wrong.
column5: Why? If I eat less, then my body will start eating away at my fat reserves, right?
column6: Not really. You should try to not eat foods high in calories, salts or saturated fats. Stay away from oily food and artificial flavors.
column7: So you are saying that I should eat, but I should just watch what I eat?
column8: Yes! You can also try to reduce your intake of carbohydrates and foods that are high in cholesterol. You can have steamed veggies or increase your protein intake found in chicken or fish.
column9: If I do all this do you think I can lose twenty pounds in four weeks?
column10: Don ’ t count on it.

column1: Is there a lot of oil and coal in your country?
column2: There is some, but my country is not amongst the leading producers. The oil and coal deposits are in the north of my country. Your country is a big oil producer, isn ’ t it?
column3: Yes, it is. My country is famous for having that natural resources. We also have a lot of natural gas.
column4: We have some too. Do you have a lot of coal?
column5: No coal has been discovered in my country, but there may be undiscovered deposits. We don ’ t have many metal deposits.
column6: There are a few in my country. We have deposit of gold, but they are very small.
column7: When I traveled around your country, I bought some jewellery made from gold from your country. The jewellery told me that there are few gold mines in your country. The gold was found in mountain steams.
column8: That ’ s right. A few people go panning for gold in rivers.
column9: You have many trees in your country. That ’ s another natural resources.
column10: It ’ s a natural resources that we hardly use. Government policy is to conserve those forests.
column11: I see. That ’ s probably a good idea. Too many forest are being destroyed.
column12: Is your country ’ s environment being damaged by the oil industry?
column13: We have some inspections, but it is very hard to avoid pollution when extracting oil. There has been some damage, but it is under control.

column1: Stephanie! Did you just get to school? But you were up and about when I left the dorm this morning! That was about an hour and a half ago. This happens all the time! Why do you always take so long to get ready the morning?
column2: It ’ s a skill. What can I say? I don ’ t know why, I just have a long routine.
column3: Please explain because it makes no sense to me. How can a girl ’ s routine be so complicated? You get up, you shower, you get dressed, you brush your teeth, you ’ re out the door. Half an hour, tops.
column4: Jacob, you have the luxury of having a haircut that rarely needs styling. I don ’ t. I have to set aside about an hour and a half to get ready in the mornings. Every day, I wake up and head straight for the shower. Every second day, I wash my hair. If it ’ s a hair-washing day, I frequently need to wash my hair twice because it gets really oily. Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too. Because my hair is so long, I seldom manage to take a shower in under twenty minutes. Afterwards, I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew. I take a long time to get dressed in the morning. Every now and then I remember to choose my outfit the night before, but usually I do it in the morning. In all, getting dressed takes about half an hour, at which time my hair is now semi-dry so then I have to style my hair. From time to time I ’ ll put my hair up, but oftentimes I bloody it straight. And then, because of the texture of my hair, I regularly have to flat-iron it to keep it from frizzing. That ’ s another twenty minutes or so. After that, I have my daily makeup routine.
column5: True, I hardly ever see you without your hair done and your makeup on, even when you show up to class in sweatpants. Tell me, how long does it take you to choose that outfit in the morning?
column6: Not funny.

column1: At their last meeting, the stockholders voted unanimously to block the merger of our company with Blycore. All the executive committee was in favor of the merger... I don't understand how the stockholders could have so much power to throw a wrench in the plans...
column2: If they all unite on a certain issue, it's the stockholders who have the final say. You'd think it might be our CEO or the workers, but in fact, the stockholders control the money so they have the most power.
column3: Is it really that simple? It doesn't seem very efficient to run things that way...
column4: It might not be the most efficient, but if you think about it, it makes pretty good sense. The stockholders are our investors. They own the capital in our company, so they should have say about what is done with the company.
column5: I guess I'd buy that...

column1: I need some mascara. Do you have good thickening mascara?

column4: We have a very wide selection of colors. And our eye shadow is specially designed to moisturize the skin. So it is very gentle on your eyelids. Would you like to sample some?

column7: Thank you.

column1: What's the time? My watch has stopped.

column3: Is your watch right?

column1: Is there any cable for the Internet?
column2: Yes.
column3: How much do I need to pay for it?
column4: Nothing. The landlord pays.
column5: Is there a mailbox in the apartment?
column6: Yes. Each apartment has one.
column7: Are there any parking lots for the tenants?
column8: Yes. But you need to pay $ 60 for it each month.
column9: Is there an alarm system in the apartment?
column10: Yes. We set up the new alarm system a few months ago.
column11: Who will take responsibility for the heating system if it has a problem?
column12: Of course we do. It is the landlord ’ s responsibility.
column13: Are smoke detectors provided?
column14: Yes.

column1: Can I help you, sir?
column2: Yes, I am checking out.
column3: Can I have your key and room number, PLS?
column4: Room 1419. Here is my key.
column5: Here is your bill, sir. Could you PLS check it?
column6: It's all right. Pls charge it to my credit card.
column7: Here you are, sir. You are all set. I hope you enjoyed your stay and that next time you are in town, you will stay with us again.
column8: I will. Where can I leave my luggage? I really want to leave after lunch.
column9: The bell captain will put it in storage room. When you are ready to leave, you can claim your luggage from him.
column10: Thanks very much and goodbye!

column1: Can you tell me about some good deals on produce?
column2: The mangoes are on sale today.
column3: What exactly are mangoes?
column4: They have yellowish red skin. It's a fruit with one big seed.
column5: Is the seed edible?
column6: Maybe if you were a parrot. I wouldn't recommend it.
column7: How much does a mango cost?
column8: Normally, they're $ 2 each. Today, they're only $ 1 each.
column9: Maybe I won't like the taste.
column10: It's hard to describe. They're sweet, but also sort of citrusy.
column11: How do I tell the difference between a ripe one and an unripe one?
column12: They're similar to an avocado. When the outside feels soft, they're ripe.
column13: Where do most of them come from?
column14: These are from Mexico.

column1: I want to buy a black suit.

column3: I prefer single breasted suit.
column4: What about this one? It's a very nice 3 - piece suit.
column5: That looks great. Do you have ties here?

column1: Hi, Stephanie. I hear you have a new job.

column5: Not bad. You know I'm an air traffic controller now.

column1: Are these your triplets? They ’ re beautiful! I ’ Ve seen other babies who were nothing but skin and bones at their age. You know, they ’ re absolutely identical of you and John! Are you planning on having any more?
column2: Bite your tongue! I ’ m already at the end of my rope. Some nights I don ’ t sleep at all. John manages to sleep like a log even when the babies are screaming at the top of their lungs.
column3: Well, tell me. How was the labor and delivery?
column4: I wouldn ’ t say that I had the time of my life but at least everything went without a hitch.
column5: Well, hang in there. In twenty years, you ’ ll fell it was well worth it!

column1: This is a nice place, but you need to get some furniture.
column2: I had planned to. I can bring some from my place. And there's some more at my parents'.
column3: Do you have a bed?
column4: Of course, I have. There is one in my old house. And I have another one from college at my parents' house.
column5: That's good. You can put one in this room and put the other one in that room.
column6: Yeah, it is a good idea. You can stay in my house for the night if you would like to.
column7: Yeah. By the way, can I take a shower?
column8: Sure, but I don't have hot water, yet.
column9: Really?
column10: No, they're coming tomorrow morning to turn the gas on. My phone should be working then, too.
column11: Well, do you want to go outside for dinner?
column12: Yeah, I can't cook anything until tomorrow, anyway. Let's go to the restaurant nearby. It's my treat.
column13: OK. Let's go.

column1: Hello! Do you have a place where I can exercise?
column2: Yes, sir. We have a fine exercise facility.
column3: I'm happy to hear that. Now, would you tell me where it is?
column4: You're actually standing above it. Just take the elevator or stairs down one level.
column5: Is the hotel going to charge me a dollar a minute for gym use?
column6: No, sir. There's no extra charge. All you need is your room key to open the door.
column7: And the gym hours are?
column8: Sir, you'll be pleased to know that our gym never closes.
column9: One more question, Do you have a trainer?
column10: We might be getting one in the near future. But at the present time, no.

column1: There's a question I'm not sure whether it is suitable to ask.
column2: You know that I have no secrets toward you.
column3: When you go dinner with John, who foots the bill?
column4: Why asking that? It's often the sort of Dutch treat.

column4: Most anyway.

column6: Yes, I like. But I can't play it well.
column7: Are indoor sports popular?
column8: Basketball and swimming are very popular.

column10: We can play together if you are free.

column6: I don ’ t think it ’ s very nice. And my father doesn ’ t like it. But my mother likes it very much. So we often come here.
column7: How often?
column8: Well, we come here almost every month.
column9: Who ’ s that?
column10: It ’ s my mother. She ’ s fond of swimming. And the man beside her is my father.

column9: It skips around.

column5: Don't worry, do it step by step.

column6: Yes, they have a good reputation for fairness.

column6: Excuse me?
column7: Let me show you the way. Please follow me.

column4: Around 8.
column5: May I have your name please?
column6: Frank London. Any chance of a table by the window?
column7: We have received many bookings.But we'll try our best.
column8: I'll appreciate it if it could be arranged.

column1: Oh, dear! which dress should I choose? I can't make up my mind. Please help me.
column2: You know I don't know anything about fashion.
column3: Which dress do you like best?
column4: Well, they are both all right.
column5: Only all right?
column6: Oh, no. I mean you look very nice in both of them.
column7: Mike, that's no help to me at all. I can't wear both of them at the same time. I want a decision.
column8: But after all, it is your decision, not mine.
column9: Oh, yes. The green dress is very smart. but I can't be sure if it goes with a hat.

column2: So what?
column3: Look, I have two tickets.Will you go with me?
column4: Wow, I like concerts.

column1: Thanks for offering to give me a lift. I'm looking forward to this party, but I didn't want to go alone.
column2: Don't mention it. It's my pleasure. Have you been to one of these large, sit-down dinner parties since you got to New Haven?
column3: No, this is my first. Last week I went to a cookout 5 for new professors at Dean Barksdale's home. I took a taxi because I didn't want to be late. But I was the first one there.
column4: I'll bet you were a little embarrassed.
column5: You're right. The invitation said two to seven. I was there at two o'clock, but most people didn't arrive until three or four. They didn't start cooking until five o ’ clock.
column6: Cookouts often start slowly. A two o'clock start means you arrive any time after two.
column7: Thanks for telling me this.
column8: I was late getting back from the mall, but I'm hurrying.
column9: Why are you in such a hurry? They said, Dinner at eight, and it's only seven-fifteen. I don't want to be the first one there again.
column10: Don't worry. We won't be the first.

column1: Wow! It's hot today! Do you want to get an ice cream cone?
column2: No Let's go to an ice cream parlor! They have way more flavors to choose from there. I feel like having something special like Neapolitan ice cream.
column3: What's that?
column4: It's three different flavors mixed together. Chocolate, strawberry and something green with candied fruit.
column5: Do they have ice cream bars. frozen yogurt or frozen chocolate mousse?
column6: Absolutely! They also have real Italian Galatian and French sorbets. They do a great baked Alaska.
column7: Maybe a vanilla ice cream milkshake would be good. What's your favorite flavor?
column8: Well... l like the traditional flavors like rum raisin, butter pecan. maple walnut, strawberry, chocolate and vanilla. But now there are some new flavors from Asia like green tea and durian.
column9: God! Even talking about it makes me feel like l'm gaining weight!
column10: That's OK. We can go jogging, after we eat!

column1: I think it's important that all people have the ability to read.

column6: Zhouzhuang.

column9: what's the cost?
column10: It's about 300 yuan.

Then you worry about your family, about conditions back home, about your courses, about your money, about everything. I tried to fall asleep but I just had too much on my mind.

column1: Hello, Tom, are you free next Sunday?
column2: I think so. Why did you ask that?
column3: I'm going to have my first baby, so I plan to hold a baby shower next Sunday.
column4: Congratulations! Why do people hold parties before the baby is born?
column5: It's the tradition. But baby showers as we know them today were not common until after World Warri.
column6: In any case, I like baby showers, because they allow friends and family to share the joy and excitement of welcoming a new life into the world.
column7: So you will come, won't you?
column8: Of course. I will prepare a good gift for the new arrival.
column9: Thank you very much.

column1: Hey Annie, who is this picture of?

column3: I think you can say your seventh great grandfather! Cutie! What's his name?
column4: Peter Madsen. A great A if I do say so myself.
column5: Nice pun. What is it you active about him most?
column6: He loved his family and his countrymen and his freedom.
column7: He looks like a very personable man.

column1: Have you ever run into a person who tries bleed you white?

column4: Mark is one of them. He has trouble with a girl who turned out to be a dead beat.

column1: I'm planning to buy a bicycle. As you are quite a cycling enthusiast, I wish you might give me some advice.
column2: With pleasure, chap. But before I start, I need to know what you want a bike for?
column3: My purposes are two-fold. On the one hand, I've grown bored of commuting on suffocating buses every day and decided to ride to work. On the other hand, bicycling is a sport, and I intend to build up my body through constantly taking a ride over the weekends.
column4: Cycling during weekends? Do you me riding on the mountainous countryside just the neighboring towns?
column5: Does that make any difference?
column6: Can't be greater. If you ride on bumpy, hilly roads, a mountain bike is what you need. But if you just ride comfortably along the city lanes, you might choose a road bike.
column7: Are they designed differently?
column8: A road bike features skinny tires and a light-weight frame. Its riding position puts you bent over the handlebars. It's not particularly beefy in construction, and generally, it won't stand up well under heavy loads or on really rough surfaces. In contrast, mountain bikes have wide tires and a stout frame. You sit higher on them and don't have to hunched over.

column1: Hello, I brought a lap-top computer with me. Do you know how can I use the internet in my room?
column2: Well, right now, we can't afford internet use in the rooms. But you can go to the web bar in our hotel. It's on the 12 floor.
column3: Thank you. I think I will go there.

column13: Definitely not.

column5: Don't you think it's too bloody?

column1: What are you reading?
column2: It ’ s an article about language. It talks about the idea of having a single global language.
column3: It seems that English already is the main global language. Does the article suggest that there should be an artificial language like Esperanto as the world language.
column4: Actually, it suggest English. The main argument is that English is already being studied as a second language in most countries-china, India, mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, and japan – so beginning again
column5: Does the article say anything about other language? How will they survive in an English-speaking world?
column6: The article points out that many languages have been lost and will be lost, but others will continue to be used for generation, even if English continues to be the dominant language.

column13: Yes, but I don't want my Mom to tap my phone when I call Clive.

column9: Yes, but other than that, are there any more problems?

column4: I was thinking about it, but I'm never able to keep my New Year's resolution. Last year for example I joined a gym and only went twice.

column6: Yes, Doctor William said that he could come back to work ASAP.

column2: Anything's all right with me. I'm not particular about soups.

column1: What's the matter with me, Doctor? I feel so tired these days.
column2: It's your blood pressure, I'm afraid. It's far too high.
column3: And what's the cause of that?
column4: Overwork-amongst other things. You can't work 24 hours a day. You' Ve got to slow down.
column5: But I can't just slow down.
column6: You've got to, I'm afraid. And look at this. You weigh 200 stones. That's too much for a man of your size.
column7: You mean I've got to lose weight?
column8: Yes. You've got to cut down on bread and potatoes and take more exercise.

column2: I can hardly make ends meet these days.
column3: Same here. I have't brought any new clothes for three months.
column4: My income remains the same but prices just continue to rise.
column5: True. The news says that there is a general increase in the price of daily necessities.
column6: Definitely. I have to spend 300 yuan more on food every month.

column1: How do you spend your day, Helen?
column2: Well, on weekdays I get up around ten. Then I read the paper for an hour and have lunch at about noon.

column4: I start work at three.
column5: And when do you get home at night?
column6: I get home pretty late, around midnight.
column7: So what do you do, exactly?
column8: I'm a TV announcer. Don't you recognize me? I do the weather report on KNT!
column9: Gee, I'm sorry. I don't watch TV.

column1: Margaret, do you think I should enroll in the science course?
column2: Yes, I think so, If you want to graduated this year, you've got to take a science course.
column3: Right, I figure since you are doing premedical, you know about the very courses.
column4: Well, I have to take biology, chemistry, maps and physics.what you need is a good introductory course for non-science majors.
column5: Yes, I really weak in maps, I did poorly in high school.
column6: That's a problem.

column1: So, Emily, how was your day?
column2: I don't think you really want to hear about it.
column3: It can't have been that bad. Go on and tell me about it.
column4: To be honest, it was horrible! My manager is such a pain in the neck!
column5: Why? What happened?
column6: Well, he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them, my manager blamed them on me!
column7: That's not very fair. What did you do?
column8: There wasn't really anything that I could do. There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself. If I had said anything, he would have fired for me for sure.
column9: Does he treat everyone in your department like this?
column10: He treats everyone pretty poorly, but the way he treats me really takes the cake!
column11: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others?
column12: I really have no idea. All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair!
column13: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at you company?
column14: Not really. I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion.
column15: That's very sensible. It sounds like you have a good head on you shoulders.
column16: I try to be sensible about it, but it's not very easy. Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it.
column17: That's so true. When you have a taste for success, you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way.

column1: Shall we have some soup first?
column2: No, thank you. I don't like soup. I'd rather have some fruit juice to start with.
column3: Ok, and what about the main course? Which would you rather have fish or meat?
column4: Meat, I think.
column5: Don't you like fish then?
column6: I do, but I want meat.
column7: Shall we have some white wine then?
column8: Yes, but I prefer red wine with meat.

column10: I just want to have a coffee, I think.
column11: Fine, and after dinner, shall we go to a disco?
column12: No, thanks. I'd like to go straight home. I'm very tired.

column1: I'd like to buy a house about 300m with a garden. Can you help me?
column2: Sure. We've helped more than ten thousand people buy and sell houses. We're the No. 1 realtor in this community. I recommend this house ( He points at a picture ).
column3: Where is it?
column4: On a hill to the east of the Tarsus river. You have a good view of the beautiful sunrise and sunset. You can't find a better home to live in.
column5: How many rooms are there?
column6: Eight rooms, a roomy kitchen, two modem bathrooms, a lovely dining room, a gorgeous living room and three sweet bedrooms. All are built with first-rate materials.
column7: How much is it?
column8: 6 million. You needn't pay the whole price at one time. You just pay 50 % in cash. We'll process the legal documents for you and then you can borrow the other 50 % from a bank and repay it in installments. We ask for only 1 % as commission.
column9: OK. How much is the deposit?
column10: Ten thousand.

column7: You can

column6: Whoa, take it easy there Rambo. Don ’ t get carried away. These weapons are not toys, and you must first learn how to handle them properly. There are basic rules that you must abide by in order to be safe. For example, never handle a weapon that you haven ’ t inspected yourself. Always make sure there isn ’ t anything in the chamber, and never put your finger on the trigger unless you are ready to shoot!
column7: Wow, I didn ’ t know! It always looks so cool and easy in the movies!
column8: The reality is different you know, running and firing a weapon is a lot harder than in the movies! So are you ready?
column9: Let ’ s do it!

column2: You see this is the first time for me to use the swimming pool. I've got no idea about the water temperature of the pool. I'm afraid it might be a little cold.
column3: You don't need to worry about that. madam. We have a warm massage pool, and the temperature is 36 ° C.
column4: I see. But I'm not a good swimmer. Can you tell me how deep the pool is?
column5: Certainly, madam. The deepest place is two meters but you can swim in the shallow area, which is only l. 4 meter in depth. We have separate locker rooms over there and they are free of charge.
column6: That's great! Can you give me the key to the locker? I can't wait to have a try.

column1: What are you studying all day long for? It ’ s summer vacation!
column2: I know! I hate it! But I ’ m taking this crash course in math.
column3: Why?
column4: I have to take my exams for getting into the university, so I need to prepare.
column5: Do you think it will help?
column6: It has to! I ’ Ve been studying every day, eight hours a day! I don ’ t know, but the school has a great success record.
column7: Hmm... Maybe I should sign up too.
column8: I ’ ll pick up an application form for you at school tomorrow.

column1: I'd like to order dinner.
column2: What would you like?
column3: I'd like to order a bottle of champagne, lobster tail, and filet mignon, medium rare.
column4: I'm sorry. We're currently out of filet mignon. May I suggest the porterhouse instead?
column5: I'd prefer the filet, but the porterhouse will do.
column6: And may I suggest chocolate-covered strawberries with the champagne?
column7: Normally, I would take you up on that suggestion, but just the champagne will do for tonight.
column8: Okay, no strawberries. Room service will be charged to your amenities account. Is that all right?
column9: That's fine.
column10: It will be up shortly. Enjoy your food, sir.

column1: Steven, you are always looking in good shape. How do you keep it?
column2: I pay much attention to my daily diet. You know good eating habits help to fortify the body against disease.
column3: Yeah, you are right. Tell me your normal diet.
column4: I eat more fruits and vegetables and limit amounts of fatty and fried foods.
column5: And?
column6: I drink milk every day. It's really good for building strong bones and teeth. I drink tea quite often, for it's protective against kidney cancer.
column7: Oh, no wonder you are healthy.
column8: You are what you eat, and a healthy diet creates a body resistant to disease.
column9: Thanks for sharing your experience with me.
column10: You're welcome!

column1: What ’ s the first thing you do when you go to the bathroom in the morning?
column2: I look at myself in the mirror. Sometimes, it ’ s not a pleasant sight, especially if I have been out late the late before.
column3: Do you usually shower or take a bath?
column4: I usually don ’ t have time for a bath in the mornings, so I just take a shower. Sometimes I need a cold shower to wake me up and sometimes I need a hot one, especially if it ’ s winter and I need to warm up.
column5: Do you shave every morning?
column6: I shave every workday, but I only shave at weekends if I ’ m going out somewhere. If I ’ m staying at home, I don ’ t shave.
column7: Do you brush your teeth twice a day as dentists recommend?
column8: Yes. I brush my teeth in the morning, just before I go to work. It ’ s actually the last thing I do before leaving. Then I brush again before bed.
column9: Your dentist must be proud of you!

column1: Good evening, do you have a reservation?
column2: Yes, we ’ Ve got a reservation. The name is Ann.
column3: Let me see. Ok, this way, please.
column4: This is your table.
column5: And would you like to order now?
column6: Yes.
column7: Here is the menu.
column8: Thank you.

column1: I have to find a living room set.
column2: Where are you planning on looking for one?
column3: I don't know.
column4: I can tell you where I got mine.
column5: Where did you go to find yours?
column6: IKEA has beautiful furniture.
column7: Does the furniture from IKEA cost a lot?
column8: The furniture cost a couple thousand dollars.
column9: How good of quality is the furniture?
column10: It's very sturdy. You get what you pay for.
column11: I don't mind paying for quality workmanship.
column12: I assure you that you're paying for quality.

column1: Hi! Is that the new laptop you brought last week? It looks very nice.
column2: Yes, it is. Thanks. I ’ m just surfing on the internet.
column3: Here? In this cafe? How can you do that?
column4: This cafe offers a wireless internet connection. That means I can get on the net for free while I ’ m here. Of course, I have to buy a cup of coffee!
column5: That ’ s great. Can you do it anywhere?
column6: No. you can only do it when the cafe offers a wireless connection. There are only about 10 or 12 places that offer it in this city.
column7: So, what programs do you have on your laptop?
column8: I ’ Ve got all the usual ones for word processing and then I have a few for creating and editing photographs.
column9: I know you are keen on photography. It ’ s very useful for you to be able to download photos from your digital camera. Then you attach the picture files to emails and send them to anyone, anywhere, at anytime!
column10: It ’ s wonderful, isn ’ t it? Would you like to see some photos that I look recently?

column1: Excuse me. Do you happen to have a gym here?
column2: Yes, sir. I think you'll find our gym quite satisfactory.
column3: So, where do I go to exercise?
column4: It's only one flight down, sir. Just take the elevator or the stairs.
column5: Am I going to be charged extra for using the gym?
column6: Sir, you can use the gym for free. All you need is your room key.
column7: Great! Now tell me, what are the hours of this gym?
column8: Sir, our gym is open around the clock, every day of the week.
column9: Okay. Do you have a trainer to help me work out?
column10: I'm sorry, sir, but we have no trainer.

column1: So it is hard to be a black student on campus?
column2: Yes, in many ways it is. There are many stereotypes I have to deal with in my daily life.
column3: Stereotypes? Like what?
column4: Well, like since I'm black, I must like rap music, come from the inner city, or play basketball well.
column5: I do know you like rap music, but the other two are definitely false. I ’ Ve seen you play basketball.
column6: Hey! But that's not the only problem. There's also the affirmative action stigma.
column7: You mean that people look down upon you because they think you're in school because of a quota? That's not true at all, you're really a smart guy.
column8: I know that, but some people don't think like that. And I get problems from teachers as well.
column9: Teachers? I didn't think that they would be racist at all.
column10: Racist? Not exactly. It's how they look at me and ask for my opinion on a topic, as if I can speak for all black people and give them the black opinion on a subject. Suddenly I become the representative of the black race, as if we all had the same opinion.
column11: I see. It looks like there are still a lot of issues we need to work on in the US.

column1: Excuse me, what time do you expect to land in Berlin?
column2: We should be there by 5 this afternoon.
column3: Do you have any idea how long it will take to clean customs?
column4: Well, it all depends on traffic from other arriving aircraft.

column1: Can I see the paper when you're through, Sally?
column2: OK. I just want to read the comics.
column3: Take your time.

column1: You ’ re new here, right ;
column2: Yes, I am new.
column3: Is this your first semester?
column4: I just transferred from another school.
column5: What school did you transfer from?
column6: I came here from PCC.
column7: Do you like it here so far?
column8: I am really enjoying it here so far.
column9: Which is better, here or PCC?
column10: I think PCC is a lot better than here.

column1: I can't decide whether to go to university or to get a job ;
column2: Well, if I were you, I'd go on studying.
column3: But I don't even know what to study.
column4: If I had chance again, I'd major in English. You're good at language.
column5: That's what my parents want me to do.
column6: You should take their advice. They know what's best for you.
column7: But my friends will have jobs and lots of fun, while I spend all my time doing reading and writing.
column8: But if you go to university, you'll still have time for fun.
column9: Hum, what you say make sense. But you know, I still have to ask my parents for pocket money, and I hate to do so at this age.
column10: And if you try to find a part-time job, you'll have some money too.

column1: Sir, would you like some dessert now?
column2: Please show me the menu again.
column3: Here you are. sir, the chocolate cake is very delicious.
column4: No, thanks. I don't like chocolate. I'd like strawberry pie.
column5: I am afraid there is none.
column6: Then I'll have vanilla ice cream.
column7: Fine. I will bring it right away.

column1: Did you hear? The state is thinking of legalizing gambling in our city! Soon we are gonna have amazing hotels and casinos here which will be good for our business!
column2: Are you serious? Gambling is a vice industry built on deception and fed by the intentional exploitation of human weakness for the sole purpose of monetary gain! It disgusts me.
column3: What are you talking about? How does it exploit people?
column4: Well, to begin with, Gambling is addictive, ruins marriages, destroys families and bankrupts communities. Once you are addicted it is very difficult to stop. People have lost their houses, cars and been left out on the street after becoming addicted. Secondly, it exploits because men become addicted to gambling most often because of the action and risk. Women gamble to escape, and senior citizens will start gambling for the social interaction. Underage gamblers often start gambling on sports with friends and then illegal bookies.
column5: Geez! Now that I think about it, maybe legalizing gambling isn ’ t such a good idea! Although, I have been to Las Vegas, and I didn ’ t become addicted or anything like that.
column6: You cannot predict who will become addicted to gambling. Now excuse me, I have a protest rally to organize!

column1: Hello, Pam.
column2: I'm glad that you can make it.
column3: It looks like there are a lot of people inside.
column4: Yeah. I've invited a lot of friends besides you.
column5: Should I take my shoes off?
column6: We all keep our shoes on indoors.
column7: Where are your parents?
column8: They've gone out so that we could have the house to ourselves.
column9: That's great!

column4: I went to Macy's and picked it out.

column6: Well, I think you look nice today too.

column8: I think that those are some really nice shoes. What kind are they?
column9: These are Chucks.
column10: Your shoes look really nice. How much did you get them for?
column11: They only cost me about forty dollars.
column12: I'm going to go get a pair for myself.

column1: This is the good life! We have it good don ’ t you think?
column2: Yeah of course! Although, don ’ t you ever wonder what could have been?
column3: What do you mean?
column4: Well, sometimes I think of how things could have turned out if I had done things a little differently.
column5: For example?
column6: Like for example, if I hadn ’ t studied architecture, I would have become an artist like I wanted to.
column7: I see. Yeah now that I think of it, I wouldn ’ t have gotten married if I hadn ’ t moved to this town and met Sally.
column8: You see! Everything happens for a reason! We wouldn ’ t even have met if I hadn ’ t been in that car accident ten years ago!
column9: Well, I have no regrets!
column10: I ’ ll drink to that!

column1: Oh, no! Now I'll be late.
column2: Can I give you a hand?
column3: Yes, I'd appreciate it if you could drive me downtown.
column4: Sure thing. I've got time.

column1: Good afternoon! Did you call for a plumber?
column2: Yes, yes I did. Please come in! I ’ m so glad you came! This old house is falling apart! Come on into the bathroom. See, here, there ’ s water leaking everywhere!
column3: I see. Let me have a look. It seems that your toilet is clogged, and that ’ s why it won ’ t flush. Let me just get my plunger. No, that ’ s not working either. I suspect that there ’ s some sort of foreign object in the pipes that ‘ s causing a blockage. That ’ s what ’ s making your toilet overflow.
column4: Oh, that must be because of my four-year-old daughter. She is always flushing things down the toilet. You know how kids are.
column5: Yeah, I have a little one myself. Anyway, these water pipes are really rusty, so they also should be changed. Thatcould be causing water to not drain completely, that might lead to more problems in the future. I would also suggest fixing this faucet that isn ’ t shutting off properly. I could have it all finished by today if it ’ s urgent.
column6: That would be great! Is it expensive?
column7: Let ’ s see... I would say about eight hundred dollars.

column1: How would you like your hair cut?
column2: I want it short.
column3: Then, I'll just trim it.
column4: It will do.

column1: Do you often buy magazines?
column2: I buy a computer magazine every month. It keeps me up-to date with all the latest developments.
column3: Why don ’ t you find the information on the internet instead?
column4: Sometimes it takes too long to find the exact information you are looking for. Besides, I like to read a magazine in a coffee bar sometimes.
column5: Do you have an online edition of that magazine?
column6: Yes, they do. But you can only access all the articles if you have a subscription.
column7: Do you have a subscription?
column8: Yes, I do. The magazine arrives by post at the beginning of each month. Do you every buy magazines?
column9: I only buy them if they look particularly interesting. I don ’ t buy any regularly.

column1: I am sorry, but I can't stay until the end of class.

column8: Hang on. are you sure you want to keep a non-traditional pet?

column1: We'd like to have a look around your house?

column3: Thank you.
column4: This is our courtyard.

column11: Very good idea. Sometimes such pictures can show the house's richness.

column3: He's very handsome, isn't he? What's he like?

column8: Well, haven't you heard?
column9: Heard what? No one ever tells me anything.
column10: Well, apparently, he's been having an affair with his secretary.
column11: Really! How fascinating.
column12: According to Mary, he's divorcing his wife and there's a big fight going on about the children. I thought everyone knew.
column13: Well, what can I say? I didn't know. Oh, I meant to tell you earlier, your blouse doesn't really match your skirt. Those colors don't really suit you either.
column14: Oh. Thanks. Look, I must just go and say hello to someone. I'll be right back.

column4: You are really confident.

column9: She's been good. She is in grade one in Joy Chain high school. And she dreams to be a volunteer in 2008.

column1: Hello?
column2: Hi Tina, It's Joe.
column3: Hi Joe.
column4: How's the weather there today?
column5: It's really cold. It snowed all day and the schools closed early.

column7: It's 30 degrees now. It was even colder this morning.

column9: I was watching the news a little earlier. They said it's probably going to snow tomorrow.

column12: It's not too bad, but it's pretty cold here too. It was about 45 today and it rained this afternoon. I heard it's going to be a little warmer tomorrow.

column1: OK. Do you want a trim, or do you want to get your hair done?

column5: I'm gonna get a relaxer, then flip the ends up like Halle.

column8: I'm afraid I don't. But I do know the price has gone up.
column9: Thanks a lot.

column1: Good morning. Mrs.Smith.

column7: Do you know if she's read this one?

column9: Ah! She has a bad memory. How old is she?
column10: She's eighty-seven.
column11: I suggest you take this book. It's very exciting.
column12: Thank you. That's a good idea. she likes exciting books. Can you suggest another one?

column1: Are you coming or not?
column2: I haven't decided yet.
column3: Well, make up your mind. We need to know.
column4: Ok, count me in.

column4: What's the matter?

column7: I sure did.
column8: You ought to complain. These machine are always out of order.

column1: Hi dude, you look upset, what's up?
column2: haven't been sleeping well recently.
column3: what's the problem?
column4: every night my roommates watch the Korean soap operas till mid-night. I am not a big fan of Korean shows and I don't know how to tell them to stop without hurting their feelings.
column5: well, you can simply tell them you want to sleep, or make an arrangement for a time when the room should quiet down.
column6: yeah, I know, but I find these sorts of things hard to say. They won't like it if I tell them to turn off the TV. Now I just hope the show will end soon.
column7: I understand. I used to live in a dorm with four people. I was great in some aspects. We always went out and and had fun together. But on the other hand, when I wanted some quiet time, and people kept
column8: yeah, I crave my own space. i just so tired of having people around me all time.
