column5: What if I buy around ticket? Can you offer me some more?
column6: Sure. you can get a further discount at 5 %.

column4: She is only after his money.
column5: If I were her, I wouldn't marry a man I don't really love.
column6: But many girls nowaday do want to marry a man filthy with dough.

column1: What ’ s the area of your country?
column2: It ’ s not very big. It ’ s a little over half a million square kilometers.
column3: That sounds quite big! How many people live there?
column4: There are about 30 million people in my country. Most of them live in the north.
column5: What ’ s the average income?
column6: That ’ s the really hard to say. I think most people earn about two thousand dollars a month, if you convert the money from our currency into dollars.
column7: So your country is fairly rich.
column8: I think we are richer than most countries, but not as rich as countries in western Europe. Our biggest problem at the moment is unemployment, which is roughly 8 %. It has doubled over the last four years.
column9: Unemployment in my country is a fraction of that.

column1: Hi, how are you doing?
column2: Everything's great. And you?
column3: Same here.Have you seen any new films recently?
column4: No, I haven't had a chance to. But I have been watching a Chinese TV scries called " Chinese-Style Divorce ".
column5: Oh. really? I saw it two years ago. It's worth seeing and it's thought-provoking.
column6: Yeah. I found it is so close to our life.
column7: It reflects some of our difficulties in this ever-changing world.
column8: You said it. You know, the divorce rate has been on the rise in recent year.
column9: Well, it's said that a lot of young people favor getting married quickly which tend to end quickly too.
column10: I know a couple who divorced a week after getting married.
column11: Oh, that's too short-lived.
column12: That's true. It's said the short-lived marriage is typical of the post - 80s' generation.
column13: II can't agree more. The only-child-generation in China tends to know little about marriage.
column14: Definitely.They don't take relationships and marriages very seriously.
column15: In their mind, love is nothing but passion and marriage is over once the passion is gone.
column16: I think, as the saying goes haste makes waste, it is the same with marriage.

column1: Well, I'm glad you're finally back. I was wondering what happened.
column2: I feel kind of stupid.
column3: Why?
column4: We got lost coming back. I guess I don't really know this town yet.
column5: You got lost. You're kidding!
column6: No. We took a wrong turn somewhere.And Joseph doesn't know the town at all. So I started giving him directions.But I didn't really know where we were. So we got seriously lost.
column7: You could have called.
column8: I know I could have. But finally we asked someone where we were.
column9: You've been gone for two hours. How could you get lost for so long?
column10: Guess where we ended up.
column11: I don't know. Where?
column12: When we finally decided to ask someone, they told us we were in Grangerfield.
column13: Grangerfield! You were in Grangerfield? That's a completely different town! How could you drive to a completely different town?
column14: I don't know.The person we asked had to give us directions to the highway to get back here.
column15: Grangerfield is like a dozen miles away from here.
column16: I know it is. I don't know how it happened.
column17: Hmm, maybe I do.
column18: What?
column19: Maybe I have an idea how it happened.
column20: How?
column21: You were too busy looking at Joseph, and you weren't paying attention to the road.
column22: Oh, that's what you think, huh?
column23: Yes, that's what I think.Maybe the next time you go out with him to buy groceries, you'll get lost for even longer.Maybe six hours or so.
column26: I hope so. I really hope so.
column27: Hah, hah! See? I guessed right. You weren't watching the road at all.
column28: No, I wasn't. It's kind of hard to watch the road when Joseph is behind the wheel.

column1: Hello! How do I restock my minibar?
column2: You've drunk everything, sir?
column3: I finished it all.
column4: Do you want the whole minibar, or just certain items?
column5: Send me up three bottles each of Perrier and Jim Beam.
column6: That's three Jim Beams and three Perriers. Anything else, sir?
column7: The apples in my room were delicious. Bring me a few more, please.
column8: Okay. Are you sure there isn't anything else?
column9: You know, some grape juice would be really nice, too.
column10: Be patient for just a few minutes, sir, and someone will be at your door.

column1: Honey, I need to have a talk with you.
column2: Dad, I have to do my homework.
column3: No, honey, why didn't you go to cram school last night?
column4: Dad, I don't want to talk about it now.
column5: Honey, if you don't want to go to cram school, you should tell me the reason why.
column6: I'm sorry, dad. But I would rather stay at school than go to cram school.

column1: I like double-breasted garment with no belt.Could you show me some?
column2: Here you are.Which size do you wear?
column3: Medium.May I try it on?
column4: Of course.You look terrific in it!

column1: Hey, Mary, can you cut that out?
column2: Cut what out I ’ m not doing anything.
column3: The tapping of your pen on your desk. It ’ s driving me crazy.
column4: Fine! By the way would you mind not slurping your coffee every time you have a cup!
column5: I don ’ t slurp my coffee. And plus, how can you hear it when you ’ re shouting into your phone all the time?
column6: You ’ Ve got to be kidding me! You ’ re complaining about me talking on the phone when you go out for a cigarette break ten times a day to shoot the breeze?
column7: Look, we have a lot of accumulated anger from working in these conditions, and it ’ s probably okay to let off steam once in a while. But, it ’ s probably not a good idea to keep it up I ’ m willing to forgive and forget and if you are.
column8: Fine. Let's call a truce. I'll try to more considerate and to keep the noise down.
column9: Yeah, I ’ ll try to do the same. So, I was wondering you wanna go out to dinner Friday night?

column1: What do you like to do in your spare time?
column2: I am a girl of many interests. I like dance, chess, collecting stamps, travelling and taking photos.
column3: What kind of dance do you like?
column4: I like rumba and tango.
column5: Great. I am not interested in Chinese chess. It is too difficult for me.
column6: You can learn Chinese checkers or military chess. Both of them are much easier.
column7: OK, I will try. As for stamp, don't you think it is an expensive hobby?
column8: Yes, it is. But it is full of fun and knowledge. What about you, what do you like to do as hobby?
column9: I like gardening. I take care of them everyday. I like those flowers and the swing in my garden. If the weather is nice, I would like to lie on the lawn.
column10: Sounds pleasant.

column1: How's your new work, Carl?
column2: A tough job. They even offer in-service training every Wednesday afternoon.
column3: Good for you.
column4: I don't like it. I am not used to this kind of 9 to 5 work hours. Above all, I hate talking to those poker faces everyday.
column5: Well, you have to take the bad with the good.
column6: I guess so. I am badly off and I need this job.

column1: We need to elect club officials before the summer starts.
column2: I guess we should start with nominees first.
column3: Let's make it the first item of business in our next meeting.
column4: We should probably let everyone know ahead of time so they will be prepared.
column5: Can you take care of sending out a bulletin by e-mail to all the club members?
column6: Yes, I can do that this afternoon.
column7: Let's schedule the actual election times the week after the nominations. Doesn't that seem logical?
column8: Yes, let me put it on the calendar.

column1: Do you drink the Robust Milk every day?
column2: Not every day, but occasionally.
column3: It will make you as fit as a fiddle.
column4: I don't believe ads.What' s more, I'm already in perfect health.

column1: That restaurant has six parking spaces.
column2: What are the odds of finding a parking space there?
column3: Almost zero.

column1: Excuse me, Is there a hotel nearby?

column3: how can I get there?
column4: just walk down this road and you'll find it. it's on the right side.

column1: Hi Joe, how are you doing today?
column2: Things are going good today. How have you been doing, Mary?
column3: Things are going well for me, Joe.
column4: Want to go see a movie tonight?
column5: My parents are taking me to dinner tonight.
column6: Could you go with me to the movies on Friday night, instead?
column7: What movie did you want to see?
column8: There is a new horror flick about a rapist serial killer.
column9: I was thinking that I would like to see “ The Secret Life of Bees. ”
column10: Oh great! Sounds like something I need to bring Kleenex to!

column1: Excuse me, what material is it?
column2: Rhaki.Do you want some?
column3: No, where are the cotton cloths?
column4: I will show you.
column5: What is the shrink rate after washing?
column6: Less than 5 %. It's quite durable.

column1: Can you loan me fifty dollars until pay day?
column2: I'm sorry I've already gone through my paycheck for the week.
column3: Thank you just the same.

column1: Hey. Owen! Have you gone on your family vacation yet?
column2: Oh, yes. I got so tired. My son began to cry the moment we got on the train. It was very embarrassing because we took the over-night train and the noise made it difficult for other people in the cabin to sleep.
column3: Didn't you bring his favorite toy?
column4: Yes, we did. Fortunately we put his Teddy Bear in the bag, and finally he fell asleep at mid-night with it in his arms.
column5: Where did you go? You've got a beautiful tan.
column6: My wife didn't like to go to amusement parks, so we compromised and finally went to the seaside. I think vacation in summer is not good.
column7: You must have had a great time. Most children love to play in the sand on the beach and go swimming.
column8: Yes, he was every excited to see the blue sea and picked up many seashells to give as gift for his classmates in kindergarten.
column9: His friends will be very happy to get the little souvenir.
column10: And I taught him how to swim in the sea. It was fun and made him braver than before. After we returned home, he wasn't afraid to sleep alone in his bedroom.

column1: What can I do for you today ;
column2: I need to return a book.
column3: Can I do anything else for you?
column4: I would also like to check out this video.
column5: Is that all?
column6: Yes, just the video.
column7: May I see your library card?
column8: Here you go.
column9: You have to take care of this video.
column10: Oh, I will.

column1: Excuse me, waiter, would you please give us a menu?
column2: Sorry, sir, here you are.
column3: Well, do you have a menu in Chinese?
column4: Please wait a moment, I will bring you one.

column1: Good afternoon ;
column2: Good afternoon! Sit down, please.How are you?
column3: I'm very well, thank you.How are you?
column4: Very well too, thank you very much.Isn' t it a lovely day?
column5: Yes, it's beautiful, but it's also very hot.
column6: Yes.
column7: What's the weather like in your country?
column8: Mm... It's quite warm now.
column9: Where do you live?
column10: In London.Where do you live?

column1: Excuse me. Have you got any books on genetic engineering? I've looked for them everywhere, but I can't find any.
column2: I'm not sure if we've got any now. Books of that kind are on this shelf. Well, I'm afraid we've sold out.
column3: What a pity! I should have come earlier.
column4: Come some time next week if you like. I think we'll have got some by then.
column5: Ok, I will.

column1: Willy, I don't think we have much butter.Can you buy some?
column2: Sure, Mum.In a minute.
column3: Here's the money.And get some salt.
column4: Yes, Mum.

column1: What are you doing there with your mobile phone ;
column2: I'm moblogging!
column3: Moblogging? what does that mean?
column4: Oh, moblogging is a combination of the word' mobile' and' blogging'. It's another form of blogging. Users can publish blog entries to the web from a mobile phone or other mobile devices.
column5: Sounds interesting! That must be very convenient.
column6: Yes, you're right. I can blog wherever and whenever I'm on the move. It's especially good when I'm on a business trip and my laptop happens to be away from me.
column7: How can you do that?
column8: Well, if I simply want to write a few words, I'll send it by email or edit it all from the cell phone browser.
column9: What if you want to publish some photos?
column10: Then I'll shoot some pictures, re-size the images and upload them with text descriptions to my blog.

column1: Um, which of them is the better typist?
column2: Well, Mary types faster than Jones. But I think Jones types more carefully.
column3: Is there any difference in their short hand?
column4: Jones can certainly take down letter more quickly, but Mary ’ s short hand is the best in her class.
column5: How about languages?
column6: Both of them speak excellent French. But I think Mary speaks German more fluently than Jones does.
column7: Um. That doesn ’ t really matter. Because we have more French visitors than German.

column1: Is it your first time to join the sports meeting of Junior High School?
column2: Yes, and it's great. What are the events at the sports meeting?
column3: Long-distance race, dash, hurdle race, relay race, standing long jump, high jump, shotput and so on.
column4: Our neighbor, Bruce, will take part in the relay race. Let's go have a look.
column5: OK, let's go.
column6: The competition will begin in 5 minutes, it's tense here.
column7: Wonderful, Bruce is taking the lead.
column8: Other competitors have almost caught up with him. They are neck and neck.
column9: Come on, Bruce. Come on, Bruce.
column10: Wow, Bruce crossed the line first.

column1: Happy anniversary, sweetheart!
column2: Yes. to our first anniversary and many more to come. Cheers!
column3: I'll drink to that. Thanks for making this a night worth remembering.
column4: Well, it's a special day. They say if you survive the first year, the rest is smooth sailing.
column5: That's good to know. Oh, listen! The band's playing our song.
column6: I requested it. What do you say? Do you have your dancing shoes on?
column7: Always.

column1: Hello, who is speaking?
column2: Hello, this is John. I want to speak to Linda.
column3: This is her.
column4: Hi, Linda, I'm just calling to invite you to a dinner party tomorrow evening.
column5: Really? What time and where?
column6: 7:30 PM at London-Chinese restaurant. I \' ll be at your place at seven to pick you up if you need a ride.
column7: Yes, please, I'll need a ride. I'll be waiting for you then.
column8: See you tomorrow at seven. Make sure your dress a little formally. I heard the restaurant is kind of upscale.
column9: Thank you, see you then.
column10: See you.

column1: What can I do for you?
column2: I was looking for a book, but I couldn ’ t find it.
column3: Did you check our database to see if it was on the shelf?
column4: I already did.
column5: Is it on the shelf?
column6: I didn ’ t see it.
column7: Apparently somebody took that book out of the library.
column8: Will you ever get another copy?
column9: We will definitely be getting another.
column10: Could you please reserve it for me?
column11: That won ’ t be a problem.
column12: Thanks. I really appreciate that.

column1: What's on TV tonight?
column2: Nothing special.

column1: Look! That man who is baking bread is so handsome.
column2: Watch his bread, it seems to be delicious. He had a lot on the ball.
column3: Oh, my god! He ’ s so perfect.

column1: Yeah, but you guys don't stay with the same classmates all day, right?
column2: Right. The people in your math class might not be the people you have science with.
column3: So, you sent out invitations to your whole graduating class?
column4: Yep. And the date is set for homecoming night.
column5: I thought homecoming was a high school dance.
column6: It's a football game the school team plays at home. The dance and reunions are usually that night, too.

column1: Have you met the new manager in customer service?
column2: No, I haven ’ t gotten over there in a few weeks. How is he?
column3: She. She seems to be doing a pretty good job. Of course, anything would be better than that last guy!
column4: You said it! I can't believe he lasted as long as he did.

column1: Good morning. I understand that you ’ Ve got a problem with your washing machine. I ’ m from the repair company.
column2: Excellent. Come in please. The washing machine is in the bathroom upstairs. It keeps breaking down.
column3: When did it first break down?
column4: About ten days ago. I ’ Ve tried to use it since then. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn ’ t. it ’ s very frustrating.
column5: Is it still under warranty. If it is and I can ’ t fix it, it would be quicker and easier to exchange it for a new one.
column6: Yes, it ’ s still under warranty. Over the last few weeks, it ’ s also been making a high-pitch noise when it ’ s in use.
column7: Ok. I ’ ll start by looking at the motor. I ’ ll just unplug it and take a look inside the machine... oh, yes. There ’ s the problem. It ’ s quite simple. I ’ ll sort it out in a few minutes.
column8: What ’ s wrong with it?
column9: Part of the motor is loose. I can put it back in place quite easily.
column10: That ’ s great. Thanks very much. Would you like a cup of tea or coffee?

column1: May I help you?
column2: Could I check out this book?
column3: Let me see your library card.
column4: I need to get one.
column5: You can apply for one right now, if you ’ d like.
column6: Okay. Let me do that right now.
column7: Could you fill out this application?
column8: I ’ m finished. Here you go.
column9: Could you please sign the back of the card?
column10: All right.
column11: That ’ s it.
column12: Now may I check this book out?

column1: You should have seen the T. V. show that was on last night, the topic it covered was really interesting, animal rights.
column2: Do you really believe in that? If they are going to focus on something, they should do it on civil rights.
column3: Yes, but we can ’ t deny that animals are vulnerable, defenseless, and are completely at the mercy of human beings.
column4: I understand your point, but we continue to have transgressions against human rights. If so much attention weren ’ t devoted to the topic of animals, we would then concentrate more on saving a human being instead of protecting a koala.
column5: You can ’ t compare apples and oranges. I believe that both topics are important and that we can ’ t ignore them, the mistreatment of animals can cause a great environmental imbalance. I believe that governments should prohibit activities like poaching.
column6: Well, you are right on that point. This is the reason that I don ’ t buy leather and I try to buy synthetic products.
column7: At least you ’ re doing your part. My contribution is to have a pet in the house that I treat like a member of the family.
column8: As long as you don ’ t treat it better than your wife, it ’ s fine.

column1: how can I help you ;
column2: I'd like to buy some perform for my girlfriend.
column3: do you know what kind of scent she usually wears?
column4: she usually doesn't wear anything but a few drops of Chanel No. 5. But I'd like to buy her a new Fragrance.
column5: ok, here are some of our most popular perfumes.
column6: which one would you recommend?
column7: personally, I quite like the new perfume by Clinique. It's a subtle flowery scent. What do you think?
column8: that smells great. I'll take one bottle, please.
column9: would you like to buy any other cosmetics for your girlfriend? We have a full range of products from cosmetics to skin cleansers and moisturizers.
column10: it's ok. She normally just wears a little foundation and some loose powder, and I wouldn't know what shade to buy.

column1: Mom, this is your third bowl of rice ;
column2: I know but I have no choice. My stomach just keeps crying for more and more.
column3: Why? I never saw you eat so much before.
column4: I've been going to the gym these days. The exercise makes me hungry all the time.
column5: So your stomach is the one that actually gets a lot of work-out.
column6: Don't pull my leg.
column7: This way you'll probably put on more weight. Will you give up?
column8: Surely not. I can feel the results. I'm starting to feel different now.
column9: Then how are you gonna deal with the problem of getting extra weight?
column10: I'm planning to meet my personal trainer to have the work-out plan fixed.

column1: Hi, I ’ m Mary Smith ;
column2: Hello, I ’ m the landlord. John Taylor.
column3: Nice to meet you Mr. Taylor.
column4: Please, call me John.
column5: O. K., John. Well, can I have a look at the place?
column6: Sure. Come on it. We just finished rebuilding everything.
column7: Oh, it hasn ’ t been painted yet.
column8: No, we ’ re going to get that done next week.
column9: Well. It ’ s certainly nice. You ’ Ve done a great job.
column10: Thank you.

column1: May I help you?
column2: My daughter. She is missing. I don ’ t know where she is.
column3: What dose she look like?
column4: She has blond hair and blue eyes.
column5: What was she wearing?
column6: She has a yellow dress on and red sneakers.
column7: When did you last see her?
column8: I just saw her down the street. I don ’ t know where she is.
column9: How long has it been?
column10: Oh, it ’ s been uh... fifteen minutes.

column1: You're going to get into a lot of trouble if you do that.
column2: What makes you say that?
column3: I don't see anything wrong with what we're doing! That's just the problem. In these kind of things, the trouble doesn't always appear at first.
column4: But everything has been so easy.
column5: Everything has gone as smooth as clockwork. Just like we planned! That may be true, but if you were to do it, you would have trouble on the horizon. You always say that.
column6: Yeah, you never look at the positive side of things.
column7: Okay. Have it your way, but don't say I didn't warn you.

column1: Should I go now?
column2: Nice and easy. Just give it a little gas.
column3: Nothing is happening!
column4: First you have to put the car into gear. Move this shifter so the arrow points at D for drive.
column5: What do these other letters mean?
column6: R is for reverse, P is for park, and D1 and D2 are lower gears for going through snow, or up a steep hill.

column1: Are there other chores for us to do?
column2: We also have to vacuum the house.
column3: You used to do this by yourself?
column4: You'd better believe it.
column5: I'll do the second floor and you do the first floor.
column6: No. You're going to do the entire house.
column7: What about you?
column8: I'm going to mow the lawn.

column1: Let's invite Bobbie and John to our party, OK?
column2: You can never do that.
column3: Why?
column4: There's been bad blood between them since Bobbie took away John's girlfriend.

column1: Excuse me, is this the parcel post counter ;
column2: No, it's at counter 1, right over there.
column3: ( At counter 1. ) Do you take parcels here?
column4: Yes.
column5: I want to send this package to Los Angeles, please.
column6: Do you want to send it by air or by regular mail?
column7: I'd like to send it by regular mail.
column8: I ’ ll have to weigh it first. 120 yuan, please.
column9: Here is 200.
column10: Your change, please.

column1: Hey, Jim, you're 15 minutes late. What's up?
column2: I got stuck in a traffic jam.
column3: Hurry up, the show is about to start.
column4: It looks like you're very interested in the circus.
column5: Yes, I love to see the animal show.
column6: I have never seen those before, but since you're so excited it should be good.
column7: I'm sure you'll love it.
column8: Okay, I will go and get some popcorn first.

column1: What do you think of this dress? Do you think it suits me?
column2: Sure. Why don ’ t you try it on? The fitting room is over there.
column3: It ’ s just the right size-a perfect fit! Have you seen anything you like?
column4: I ’ m thinking about buying this sweater. I know it ’ s june now, but it will be perfect for autumn and winter.
column5: It looks too big for you, but I like the color and the material is good quality. Is it on sale?
column6: Yes, it ’ s half price. It ’ s supposed to be too large-that ’ s the fashion.
column7: I might get one too, but in a different colour. I prefer light blue to while.
column8: There. It looks great, don ’ t you think? I ’ m going to get these jeans as well. I need a new pair. I need a new pair. I ‘ m also going to buy this scarf ready for winter.
column9: I ’ m getting this beret – doesn ’ t it look cool? I ’ d like to get some jeans too, but I don ’ t have enough cash on me.
column10: Don ’ t worry. I ’ Ve got my credit card. You can pay me back later.
column11: Thanks! Now I don ’ t need to come back to the shop a second time.

column1: Is there anything I can do for you?
column2: Yes. I have my wallet stolen.
column3: When did you lose it?
column4: I don't know the exact time. Maybe I lost it last night when I was traveling on the bus.
column5: Can you make a description of your wallet?
column6: It's a black leather one.There are my credit card and ID and some money.

column1: Hey, Gucci. I didn't know it would be a charity show. You can see there are many collecting boxes at the entrance.
column2: Oh, I forgot to tell you this. The show is to collect money for children in need. And all the money from ticket selling will go to the Red Cross.
column3: That's really a good thing. Let's do our part.
column4: Good idea.
column5: Who will sing in the show?
column6: A lot of stars, including Andy, Justin, Mendy...
column7: Mendy? Are you sure? I love her songs!
column8: Me too. She is so young and talented. She is not only a singer but also a great composer herself.
column9: Yeah. Though she was so popular, I heard she managed to maintain a low profile.
column10: She is a real star. Not a onetime thing.
column11: But I also heard some people didn't like her music. I don't understand why. She is so amazing!
column12: Well, I suppose people have different tastes on music. Moreover, here stuff is really strong and creative. It takes time for people to accept new things.
column13: You are right. Anyway, things will be different as the days go on. She can get it. I have faith in her.
column14: Sure. That makes a good fan. Do you know what songs she is gonna sing tonight?
column15: Here is the programme. Check it out yourself!
column16: OK.

column1: How is your job search going, Janet?
column2: I found the ideal position. I ’ m working for a plumbing company.
column3: Are you serious? You studied mathematics at college for four years, and now you have a job working with your hands!
column4: Plumbing work requires mathematics knowledge, and creativity. I love this job.
column5: I can see that. But I didn ’ t know you had experience in that line of work.
column6: I didn ’ t, but I applied for an apprenticeship, and since I studied math, AND I have a good attitude, my application was accepted.
column7: Congratulations! You do have the right attitude.

column1: Oh, George, what a beautiful day it is today! The sun is hot and there are just a few clouds scattered here and there! What a perfect day to be at the beach! The kids are going to have so much fun! And we ’ ll be able to relax in the sun while they ’ re playing.
column2: It does seem like the perfect day! I ’ m glad we chose to get out of the city and enjoy the nice weather! This looks like the perfect spot! Ok kids, put on your sunscreen while your mom and I set up camp. Here, Mary, help me lay down these beach towels.
column3: There we go. Can you help me with the umbrella? Perfect.
column4: Ok kids, here ’ sa beach ball and a Frisbee, a pail and a shovel. I want to see an impressive sandcastle by the time we leave. Don ’ t stray too far. Wait! Leave your sandals here or put on your wet shoes.
column5: And stay in the shallow area. I don ’ t want to see you go any farther than that sandbar! It ’ s too deep out there and we didn ’ t bring your floatier.
column6: You ’ re back already? The water was too cold, huh? I ’ ll tell you a secret. Do you see that small pool of water over there? It ’ ll be warmer in there. Go see if you can find some seashells or catch some minnows.
column7: What is that? A jellyfish? Jeremy, put that down right now! It could sting you!
column8: Ah! Not on me! Ow!

column1: Aren't you Jim Green?
column2: Yes, that's right.
column3: I believe we met at a concert last year. I'm Taylor.
column4: Oh, yes. I remember.

column1: What did you say your stop was?
column2: Fifth Avenue.
column3: Oh, then you should have gotten off at the last stop.
column4: I should have?
column5: But don't worry. You can get off at the next stop and walk back. It's not far.

column1: Good morning, can I help you?

column4: Wang Wei, Room 1202.

column9: We accept Master Card, American Express and Visa.
column10: Then I'll put it on my Master Card. Here you are.
column11: Thank you. Would you sign here, please? Here's your receipt.

column1: Watch out! You're too close to the fire place.
column2: Don't worry, but my clothes are made of leathers.
column3: Really? That's wonderful!
column4: Thank you for your warning.
column5: Not at all.
column6: Be careful of yourself.

column2: No.
column3: Do you speak English?
column4: A little, but not very well.
column5: How long have you been here?
column6: 2 months.
column7: What do you do for work?
column8: I'm a student. How about you?
column9: I'm a student too.

column1: I'm feeling wonderful.
column2: Are you crazy? The papers make everybody listless. I don't think you are the exception
column3: I'm no exception, and that's why I spent a whole afternoon in the swimming pool.
column4: I'd better exercise my body too.My limbs are rusty now.

column1: That's right. And I'm going to be Vice President of Marketing.
column2: Way to go, Mary. A lot has happened during the last few months, hasn't it?
column3: You can say that again!
column4: What's up with Vince and Elvin?
column5: They work for Zina now.
column6: And they're happy with that?
column7: They're in awe of her. After they saw how she crushed WebTracker... but I guess you know all about that.

column1: You are married to a foreigner, huh? So what ’ s it like?
column2: Well, the first year of our marriage, we had great difficulty getting along. The things that are important to me are not important to him. We had a lot of conflicts.
column3: Yeah, I know what you mean. The first year of any marriage is difficult for all couples, not to mention two people from different cultures.
column4: And now we have a two-year-old boy. We ’ re very happy that he ’ s healthy and smart.
column5: Oh, so he ’ s half Chinese and half American. That ’ s unusual. What languages does he speak, then?
column6: Right now he speaks mostly Chinese, and he can say a few English words. But he will learn.
column7: What does he look like? Can people tell?
column8: Yes, people surely can. He ’ s whiter than the Chinese kids, and his hair is a little blonde. My husband says his eyes are very Chinese though.

column1: Do you know which stop we get off at ;
column2: We still have more to go, I think.
column3: We've been on this bus for a while now.
column4: You're right.
column5: Should we have gotten off the bus already?
column6: I don't think so.
column7: I thought you knew.
column8: Maybe we did miss our stop.
column9: Really?
column10: I'm positive that we missed our stop.

column1: Guess who I saw yesterday?
column2: Who?
column3: My cousin Monk. Have you seen her lately?
column4: Not for a couple of years. What happened to her?
column5: Nothing exactly. She's grown into a very attractive young lady.
column6: Oh, she is.
column7: You know, her long lovely blond hair and beautiful blue eyes really make her stand out from others.
column8: Not surprising. I bet she's very tall and slim.
column9: Yean. Around five feet five inches tall.

column1: I am not sure what to do during the holidays, any suggestions?
column2: Well, going to a cinema, visiting the galleries, exhibitions and museums, finding and meeting old friends, exercising in the health club or mountain biking. There are so many good choices.
column3: The problem is that I find all of them are full of fun. I just don ’ t know what to do first.
column4: Why not start with the most interesting one?
column5: Actually, I ’ m interested in all of them. The more choices we have, the harder to make a decision.
column6: Toss a coin to decide then.

column7: It's a secret.

column6: Number 13 buses run much more frequently, don't they?

column8: Thank you, Henry. I'll get a number 13.
column9: But number 13 buses leave from the center of town. You'll have to walk two miles to catch one.

column4: Good to see you too!

column1: I ’ m sorry, dad. But you can ’ t do that. It ’ s for me to decide.
column2: Oh, I see. You ’ Ve already decided, have you? Now, you listen to me, you ’ re only 19.
column3: I didn ’ t say I ’ d already decided, dad. I said it was for me to decide. There is a difference.
column4: Oh. So you think you can just do whatever you want, do you?
column5: I didn ’ t say that either. I was hoping we could discuss the matter together. I want your advice but I don ’ t want you to tell me what to do. I ’ Ve got to make decisions for myself, dad.

column1: I saw your ad in The New York Times. I am seriously considering one of the apartments listed in it.
column2: We are happy to help you. May I know which one it is?
column3: The two-bedroom apartment on 38th east street.
column4: Oh, it is conveniently located, isn't it?
column5: That's why I think it may suit my needs.
column6: I believe it will. It comes furnished. You can move in immediately after the lease is signed.
column7: The ad says the rent would be 840 dollars per month. Is it true?
column8: Yes. But not including the utilities.
column9: Will it possible for me to rent the apartment on a month-by-month basis?
column10: I believe that can be arranged. But there should be a refundable security deposit, you know.
column11: Oh, that's no problem.

column1: Good morning. I ’ m looking for a one-bedroom apartment downtown.
column2: Certainly, sir. How much rent did you want to pay?
column3: Well, I didn ’ t want to pay more than $ 520 a month.
column4: $ 520 a month? We don ’ t often have apartments as inexpensive as that.We have one apartment for $ 599 a month, on Seventh Avenue. It ’ s near the station.
column5: Is it furnished?
column6: No. it ’ s unfurnished. It has a kitchen, but no oven.There ’ s a garden in the back, but the tenants can ’ t use it.The landlord lives downstairs.Friends are forbidden in the apartment after midnight. No noise and no television after 11
column7: No, thank you! I want an apartment, not a prison.

column1: Does your wife work?
column2: Yes, she does. She works at home.
column3: Oh, I understand. She cooks, cleans and takes care of children. Is that right?
column4: Oh, no. Most of the time I do these things. She is a writer.
column5: You are really a hen-pecked husband.

column1: Good, morning! Can I help you ;
column2: Good morning. Could you tell me the times of trains to London, please?
column3: Yes. There are trains at 7 fifty-nine, 9 eighteen, 10 thirty-two and 11 fifty-five.
column4: What time does the 7 fifty-nine get to London?
column5: At 9 thirty-six. And the 9 eighteen gets to London at 9 fifty-five, the 10 thirty-two at 11 nine.
column6: What about coming back? I'd like to come back about 7 p. m.
column7: There's one at 19 and the next is at 19 forty.
column8: Mmm, how much is it?
column9: Single or return?
column10: Return, please.

column1: What are you doing?
column2: Look at me. I look so old! I look as if I were thirty.

column4: Yes, I am, but I think it ’ s time for some plastic surgery I ’ m tired of these wrinkles and sagging skin. See?
column5: I don ’ t see any wrinkles or sagging skin! You are stop beings ridiculous. Besides, I think that people who get Boto, have facelifts, or tummy tucks look weird.It doesn ’ t look natural.
column6: Whatever, I think I ’ m gonna get liposuction and a nose job and some breast implants as well.
column7: I think you need to get brain surgery. I honestly don ’ t think you need cosmetic surgery.You look amazing.
column8: I thought you were my friend and would support me on this! I just want to feel better about myself and feel more attractive.
column9: You don ’ t need plastic surgery to do that. You are fine the way you are and you have guys drooling all over you! Plus, plastic surgery hurts!
column10: Really?
column11: Yeah! When I got my nose job I was black and blue for a week!

column4: Tracing back, Yoga has a very long history. It was originated before India had approved Yoga and these documents were arranged and written according to the contents passed by mouth to mouth. In other words, Yoga is passed down from ancient times, which cannot be recalled.

column6: If I were you, I wouldn't drink too much.
column7: I often feel so tired.
column8: You better do some exercise every morning.

column1: What do you think of the way people use and treat animals?
column2: I think most people treat animals well, but we are often cruel to animals. When we raise animals for food, the conditions they live in are often poor.
column3: Perhaps people should stop eating animals. We could grow more crops.
column4: What would you do with all the animals? You couldn ’ t just let them go. Besides, some people would still hunt them. Meat has become an integral part of our diet.
column5: We could provide them with better conditions anyway. We should certainly try to improve the conditions at zoos. We should try to recreate the natural conditions as much as possible.
column6: That ’ s true. I think zoo are a good idea, because they allow people to get close to animals. I think it ’ s good for kids to see wild animals.
column7: I agree. I ’ m an adult and I love going to the zoo. I don ’ t like animals experiments though. I believe that we can do tests in other ways.
column8: I read that the number of animals being used in experiments is falling dramatically as new techniques are being introduced.
column9: That ’ s good news. The good thing is that most people treat their pets well.
column10: Sometimes you read about people who have been cruel to pets or other animals, but those stories are rare.
column11: Have you every given money to any of the charities that take care of animals.
column12: Yes, I have. They do an excellent job.

column1: Bob, look at this sentence.' Healthy eating is not about strict nutrition philosophies, staying unrealistically thin, or depriving yourself of foods you love.' It's interesting, isn't it ;
column2: I'd rather say it's confusing. what are those' strict nutrition philosophies' about?
column3: I believe they are careful calculations on proteins, vitamins and calories.
column4: Probably, Rose. That must be the job of nutritionists.
column5: Healthy eating is not about depriving oneself of the foods one loves. So we are free to have whatever foods we love. It is unbelievable.
column6: Oh, believe it or not, I came across an article the other day, saying that pizza is a healthy food.
column7: Seriously?
column8: Yes, I felt exactly the same way as you did just now. Scientists must be crazy in saying so.
column9: Maybe nowadays people hold different opinions on healthy diet.
column10: Absolutely right. I myself sometimes believe that healthy eating is just about feeling great. As long as I have enough energy, it's fine.

column1: What should I get Uncle Teddy?

column3: Are you kidding? That's the stupidest gift one can buy. I don't want to get a tie.

column5: Everybody gets men ties for Christmas. It's too boring. Everybody buys either ties or sweaters. I want a more unique gift.

column8: He would think you were crazy, Caroline.
column9: Yes. An iguana is too strange for a gift, and a tie is too normal.So I have to find something halfway between.
column10: How much do you want to spend?
column11: Well, he was very good to me.He helped me edit my essay for the scholarship contest.So I want to spend at least 75 dollars.
column12: Alright, I have an idea.You know he carries that conservative-looking briefcase every day.
column13: Yes.
column14: Well, he isn't a lawyer, so I don't think he needs to have a briefcase like that.
column15: What should he have then?
column16: I think he would appreciate having a very fine leather bag.But more like a workbag or shoulder bag.You know, not so hard and square like a briefcase.
column17: I think that's a great idea. Men look great with that kind of bag.Where can we buy one?
column18: I don't think this mall has a leather goods store.So we have to go to State Street.
column19: Alright. We can go later then.
column20: We can buy something for Mom and Dad here, and then go buy Uncle Teddy's gift on State Street.
column21: Good plan. What should we get for Mom though?
column22: She said she wants one of those automatic foot massagers. I think they sell them at Sears.
column23: Alright. We can go check at Sears and see if they have them.And what about Dad?
column25: I think it would be a great joke.But I know we'd have to take the iguana back. And the pet store might not let us.So why don't we get him something else? Some clothes maybe.
column27: Oh, shut up about ties! Forget about ties, why not?

column1: Sometimes I think television is too biased. None of them are completely objective.
column2: That's unavoidable, but think, How would you keep up to date without television?
column3: Newspapers or the radio I guess. I just wish TV was more objective.
column4: Look, you can still learn a lot from watching television, you just need to be smart when you're watching. Filter the information and decide if you believe what you are hearing or not.
column5: The internet's a lot worse.
column6: Really? Why?
column7: There's no one moderating it. Anyone around the world can put information onto the net for anyone else to see. The information on the internet is mostly unsubstantiated and you can never know who has written it, or why. A lot of people get conned online.
column8: Again, you need to think carefully. If you don't trust others online, have nothing to do with them.

column1: How do I apply to an American university?
column2: You should go to the library to find some information about American universities, and write to the Admission Office. Then the Admission Office will send you application forms and other related materials. From experience, many applicants write to several universities instead of just one.
column3: I was told that it took a lot of time and effort to apply.
column4: That is true. I'll list for you the requirements of almost all the universities. First of all, you need official transcripts of your undergraduate work, three letters of recommendation from your professors who know your competence, and the official TOEFL ( Test of English as a Foreign Language ) score ( It's usually 550 ). Then you need a financial guarantee, and an application fee of 25 dollars.
column5: What's to come next?
column6: If they agree to enroll you, they will send you a TAP - 66 Form. With TAP - 66, you can apply for a passport from our government, and then apply for a visa from the US Embassy in Beijing.
column7: How long will it take to go over all the procedures?
column8: From 3 to 6 months if everything goes well.
column9: Thank you. I appreciate all your help.
column10: You are welcome. Please feel free to ask if you have any more questions.

column3: That's normal. You have been sitting for three hours, with your attention highly concentrated.
column4: You are wrong, Shirley. I was always absent-minded in the class. I meant to concentrate on the class, but I was just so tired. Maybe I am old.
column5: No. You are just burning yourself out these days. Have a good rest and you will feel energetic again.
column6: One of my friends took the Adult College Entrance Exam last year. He filled the school column with his name, and his score was relinquished.
column7: How could he make such a silly mistake?
column8: He said he hadn't taken any exams for ten years, and couldn't get used to it immediately. He was extremely nervous then.
column9: He lost a very good chance to go to college, didn't he?
column10: Yeah. The test was fairly easy and almost every test-taker could pass that exam. Adult College Entrance Exam is much easier than college entrance exam. And there are fewer subjects.

column1: Are you ok? You seem a bit anxious.
column2: Yeah, I'm OK, I have been having a lot of mood swings lately. I think it has to do with the pills my doctor prescribed that are causing chaos on my hormones.
column3: So you mean you feel ecstatic one minute and then blue the next?
column4: Yeah, it's weird. For example just this morning I was feeling detached and lonely, even though there was really no reason to feel that way.
column5: Well, maybe your mood will swing positively and you will feel confident, brave and hopeful!
column6: I hope you are right.

column1: Hi, Francis, how was your business trip?
column2: It was a nightmare.
column3: What ’ s up?
column4: Actually, the business trip itself was very successful. We arrived on time, we had nice conversations and we settled some important issues for the next year.
column5: Sounds quite fruitful, why do you call it still a nightmare then?
column6: Well, the air line lost my luggage on the return flight and then I lost my carry on bag when I was tackling with the officers in charge. I left the airport three hours later than I expected and then I was caught in a traffic jam. When I finally got home, I was totally exhausted. But I found the elevator was out of service due to a blackout.
column7: This is really a sad story. Did they trace back your luggage?
column8: I am still waiting for their call.
column9: Take it easy, all sufferings have their reward.

column1: Hey, Robert, that's a nice shirt you are wearing. Where did you get it?
column2: Thanks, I like it too. I bought it at the nearby department store.
column3: That's nice. Do you know you can get one at the wholesale market near the zoo for a much lower price?
column4: Yeah, I know that. But at those places. the prices they ask you are ridiculously high, and if you don't bargain hard, you will get ripped-off.
column5: True, learning how to haggle the price is one of the things people have to pick up when they come to China for the first time.
column6: Yeah, but personally I hate bargaining. If I bargain, I might come to a lower price. But I will never know the true price of what I am buying, and I'll always have the feeling that I am over charged at those places.
column7: Yeah, I have the same feeling. Also there is another thing that bothers me the quality. Things in a department store are usually quality-guaranteed. But at a wholesale market, you never know whether what you are buying are of good quality or not.
column8: That's why I like department stores more. Shopping at a wholesale market like the locals is one of the few things I am unable to grow accustomed to.
column9: I understand. While it's always good to follow the local customs, I guess there are exceptions.

column1: May I ask a question?
column2: Yes, what's it?
column3: What does mph stand for?
column4: It's miles per hour.

column1: Excuse me, I've been waiting here for 10 minutes. Do you know how often does No. 636 run?
column2: It runs every 15 minutes. You must have missed it.
column3: It seems you got here at good time. Do you have a bus schedule?
column4: Yes, I do. You can buy a bus schedule in a news stand.
column5: I see, thank you. By the way, is this the right bus for the Museum?
column6: Yes, it is.
column7: Do I have to change?
column8: No. The Museum is the terminal of this bus.
column9: Thanks a lot.
column10: You are welcome.

column1: Peter, why don't you go outside and play basketball with your friends?

column6: Yes, but a football game is next.
column7: Oh, Peter. You really should go and play ball yourself rather than watching games.
column8: I just enjoy watching games.
column9: You really shouldn't watch so much television.

column13: That's what friends are for.

column1: This sucks. I hate buying lingerie. Okay, just find something and get out of here. Alright, these are fine. Oh, no, don ’ t come over here, don ’ t come over here.

column5: Sure that ’ s fine.This is so awkward... what ones do I pick? What size is she?
column6: Well, do you want a thong, some bikini briefs, maybe this nice pair of lacy boy shorts?
column7: Just pick something and get the hell out of here.Um, I'll go with these two.This is mortifying. I just want to get this over with.She better thank me for this...
column8: Here you are, sir. I ’ m sure she ’ ll enjoy them.
column9: Finally!
column10: I ’ m sorry, sir. I ’ m going to have to take a look inside your bag.

column2: How can we relate tiger to this spot, Miss Zhang?
column3: Its name originates from a legend that two tigers run here and made a hole, and then a spring gushed out from it.
column4: How ignorant I am!
column5: The Longing Tea and the Tiger-running Spring water are always considered as the “ Two Wonders in West Lake. ”
column6: I know that tea. It smells fragrant.
column7: That's right. All my guests, attention please. We will have half an hour to visit the spring and take photos. And next spot will be the Moon Reflected in Three Pools.
column8: Janice, David, come here. We take some photos here. I can't imagine how beautiful it is!

column1: Are you ready to go shopping ;

column4: I don ’ t have onions on my list. I ’ ll add them. We should get some tea. Is green tea ok or should we get the same tea that we usually get?
column5: Let ’ s get both. We need some coffee too. Is that on your list?
column6: Yes, it is. Here ’ s my list. Is there anything that I ’ Ve forgotten?

column9: I ’ m not sure. I ’ ll decide at the cheese counter, when I can see what they have. Have we got enough money?
column10: We don ’ t have enough cash, so I ’ ll take my credit card and we can pay with that. Where are the car keys?

column1: My wife and I are thinking about taking our parents with us on a vacation. Do you have any suggestion about where to go?
column2: The choice of destination is very important. It will too energetic for the old people if you make an excursion or go to climb mountains. But they'll be interested in going to the historical places of interest where they can have fun.
column3: Sometimes what young people like is different from the old. Maybe we can go visit first and then do some shopping.
column4: That's a good idea. That will allow both you and your parents to enjoy yourselves.
column5: What should we bring besides a change of clothes, money and some snacks?
column6: It's some medicine the doctor recommends. If you leave it at home, you will find it difficult to face up when the old people suffered a seizure.
column7: Oh, yes! I didn't think about that.Thank you for reminding me. How many days should we spend on a vacation?
column8: You'd better have all a light schedule. You can rest up for a few days if your parents find tired 。
column9: It seems that good planning for a family vacation is important to make sure everyone will be happy.
column10: Yes, that's right. Having an enjoyable time together is the goal.

column1: Can I help you ;
column2: Yes, I need to buy a computer for this semester. I was told it is cheaper to buy computers here.
column3: Well, you heard right. You can get an excellent deal on a new computer here. We have great discounts for students.
column4: I don't know much about computers. But I know I want a desktop computer with a lot of memory. And I need a printer.
column5: Well, first let's consider your computer. Here, for example, is a system I highly recommend-the Power Macintosh G3. it comes with 64 megabytes of total memory.
column6: Is that a lot? Sixty-four?
column7: Yes, it is. It should be enough for any student needs you might have. What department are you in?
column8: History.
column9: Well, so you will mostly be using word processing, for writing papers. I recommend the Corel Word Perfect program for word processing. We can talk about software later. Let's talk about your hardware first. We have a special deal on right now. I should tell you about it, as it only goes until next Tuesday. If you buy one of these fifteen-inch color monitors with a Power Macintosh G3, you can actually get 30 percent off the usual sale price.
column10: Thirty percent?

column1: Mike, shall we book two tickets online?
column2: Fine. Shanghai and Beijing are thousands of miles away. How about bullet train? Faster and relatively cheap, I think.
column3: Yeah. How many tickets remain?
column4: Oh, what a shame. Only sleeping cars have tickets. Others are all out of stock. The price of the sleeping car is almost the same as the airplane.You see, the discount plane tickets are no more than 500 yuan. A good deal, isn't it?
column5: Brilliant idea! That will make our journey rewarding and much safer.

column1: Hello, could you tell me my test results?
column2: Your results are posted on the website. Just put in your password and you can see the exact numbers.

column4: We always contact you by phone to come in if there is a need for follow-up.
column5: How will I know what the results mean on the website?
column6: The purpose of each test is given on the site.
column7: Will the numbers mean anything to me?
column8: The website will give you your results and then tell you what the normal range is.
column9: Can I see all of my test results at once?
column10: Yes, you can see every test for the past five years. You can compare them.

column1: Why don't we Chinese have our own Valentine's Day?
column2: Of course we have. It's on the seventh day of the seventh lunar month.
column3: Oh? Why is that day?
column4: It is said that the Cowherd and the Spinster, the lover stars in heaven, can only meet on the seventh Eve, so this day has become the Lover's Day.

column1: Do you know anything about health food?
column2: It is so popular among people to preserve health now, so I read some books about health food.
column3: Can you give me some examples?

column5: Really? Why we must have warm and fresh water?
column6: Warm water can be good for your stomach, which is empty at that moment. And freshness can keep the water active to clean your digest system.
column7: Anything else?
column8: Yogurt, because it has protein, vitamins and it is acidic. If you drink it everyday, your stomach will be more comfortable.

column1: Is there a city where it's always warm ;
column2: Yes, there are many cities where it's almost always warm.San Diego, for example.
column3: Are there any other cities where it's always hot?
column4: Many.Most of the cities in the southern part of the United States are hot all year.
column5: But why do so many people live there?
column6: Most people grow accustomed to the climate, but there are many others who complain about it all the time.
column7: Are there any cities where it rains a lot?
column8: Several.Two good examples are Seattle, in the state of Washington, and Portland, Oregon.
column9: Tell us about some cold cities.
column10: In the north there are many cities which are very cold in the winter.Boston and Chicago are two of them.

column1: Good morning, I want to send this parcel to Taiwan.
column2: Airmail or surface mail?
column3: How long would surface mail take, compared with airmail?
column4: Oh, anything up to 3 or 4 months for surface mail. It depends on the sailing of the ships. Airmail would only take 1 to 2 weeks.
column5: How much would this parcel cost me by airmail?
column6: Just let me weigh it for you. That's 2 lb. and 6 oz. That's be £ 10.
column7: Thanks. That'll be OK.

column9: Sorry Paul. I couldn't help it. So why doesn't he give you a hand?
column10: He watch the tob too much. Now really I don't know. But I can't handle this much longer.
column11: Well, talk to him, and let me know what happens, OK?

column1: Marquet, do you think I should enroll in the science course?

column1: Are you OK?

column6: I'm OK. I promise. Maybe you don't know that I have done with him for a long time.

column7: I see. Well, we have a lot of Spanish customers, but you wouldn't need to write any Spanish here.
column8: In that case, I'm fit for the position I think.

column4: look at my cell phone. I can listen to music, watch movies, take pictures, play games, surf the web and download documents. It's just like a PAD.
column5: that's cool. I can use the computer and the internet pretty well, but I'm a little bit slow in the latest trends of digital products.
column6: that's Ok. you know, digital devices are becoming smaller and easier to carry, and they won't cost you too much.
column7: yeah, if I buy a cell phone like this, I don't have to take a music player everywhere I go, and I can save the cost of buying an extra mp4.

column10: then any cell phone can meet your need because they generally have memories of over 512MB.

column1: He has worked five years in that bank.

column4: Great minds think alike.

column1: How do you like the play?
column2: It is very dull, and the production isn't very satisfactory, either.
column3: You're absolutely right. I think the acting could be better.

column5: Maybe you're right. But I really don't like it.

column7: Yes, they had constant changes of scene, and I love variety.
column8: Me, too. I hate to sit there and look at the same stage scenery one scene after another.

column4: Stop producing cigarettes.
column5: But that'll affect the national economy.
column6: That's right.But I don't think there are better ways.

column8: Maybe it can take effect.

column1: Hey, Daniel, how's it going ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: Wow, it's so strange for you to say things like that. What had happened?

column6: Yeah, he, with his fleet, came across the Indian Ocean, and arrived at the east coast of Africa.

column5: That's rock and roll with fast tempo.
column6: I like the slow dance. I am good at rumba and waltz.

column11: May I?
column12: Sure.
column13: ( When they are dancing ) You dance gracefully!

column6: Sure. This brand is supposed to be very good, but they're expensive. Those are new products. They come in several colors and sizes. There is also hard, soft, and medium.
column7: Are they cheaper?
column8: This one is 5 % off. That one has no reduction, but you can get a free tube of toothpaste with six toothbrushes.

column1: Hello, I bought the pendant in your shop, just before.

column2: No, my company makes cameras.Well, I'm also a photographer, but two of these are for our display.
column3: I see. And what's in this bag?
column4: Egg tarts.
column5: I thought you said you didn't have any food with you today.
column6: I thought you meant vegetables and meat when you asked me. Things like that. I don't have any vegetables.
column7: I'm sorry, Mr. Lee. Egg tarts are food too. We will have to confiscate these.
column8: Confiscate?
column9: Yes, we will have to dispose of them.
column10: It's too bad. They are very delicious.
column11: I know. One out of every three travelers from Taiwan seems to be carrying them.They are being smuggled in by the thousands.
column12: Oh, well. Not by me.
column13: No, not today at least. Enjoy your visit to the United States, Mr. Lee.
column14: Thank you.

column1: Morning.
column2: Hi there Mr. Anderson! How are you on this fine morning?
column3: Fine, thank you.
column4: It sure is cold this morning, isn ’ t it? I barely even get out of bed!
column5: Yeah. It ’ s pretty cold, alright.
column6: Did you catch the news this morning? I heard that there was a fire on Byron Street.
column7: No, I didn ’ t hear about that.
column8: Did you happen to watch the football game last night? The Patriots scored in the last minute!
column9: No, I don ’ t like football.
column10: Oh... By the way, I saw you with your daughter at the office Christmas party. She is really beautiful!
column11: She ’ s my wife! Oh, here ’ s my floor! Nice talking to you. Goodbye.
column12: Sir this is the 56th floor! We are on the 70th!
column13: That ’ s okay, I ’ ll take the stairs!

column1: How are you doing, Andrew?
column2: Not well. I ’ Ve been feeling pretty lonely lately.
column3: But you have so many friends! How could you be lonely?
column4: You know what they say'a friend to all is a friend to none'. I don ’ t feel like I really know any of my friends. In fact, I should probably call them acquaintances, not friends.
column5: What about me? I ’ m your friend.
column6: I know you are, you are my girlfriend. I wish I had a guy friend to hang out with sometimes.
column7: I know what you mean. I find it difficult to make new friends, too. It ’ s not as easy as it was when we were young, is it?
column8: Not at all.
column9: I ’ Ve made a lot of new friends since I started learning English. Maybe you could join a club or take a class to make some new friends.
column10: That ’ s a good idea.
column11: What kind of qualities do you look for in a friend?
column12: I ’ m not sure. I guess I ’ d like to meet some people who have a positive attitude and want to have a good time.
column13: People who play ultimate Frisbee have a positive attitude ; maybe you should join the ultimate Frisbee club.
column14: That ’ s a possibility. Thanks!

column1: Which team has won?
column2: Neither.The game ended in two all.
column3: But I still think AC milan's defence seems better organized.
column4: But the Brazilian is tougher.

column10: Wow, you are going to be busy this semester! Okay, here you go. You are registered now, you ’ ll have to make your first tuition payment before classes start.

column1: Excuse me. Does this hotel have a fitness facility?

column8: The gym is open seven days a week, twenty-four hours a day.

column10: Unfortunately, no. If you want a trainer, you'll have to use another gym.

column4: So how have you been?
column5: Great! Work is really busy now, but it's fun.

column1: I enjoy the folk song and dance show very much.

column4: The show starts at 7 and is over at around 10 o'clock p. m.

column3: I don ’ t know. The report says it is better than the old vaccines.
column4: Don ’ t count on it. I think the best way to prevent AIDS is to keep yourself clean by having clean sex and keeping a regular sex partner.
column5: Right. That ’ s why doctor say AIDS prevention means cleanness.

column1: Can I bring you anything else?

column4: No, it is my treat.
column5: Are you sure?
column6: Yes, I owed you for last time.
column7: All right. If you insist. Next time it is on me, though.

column7: Yes, this is very light. But the handle is also aluminum.
column8: No problem. Look at this one. Same pan, but with a lightweight wooden handle.

column12: I'm sorry. I forgot to show it to you. Here it is. It comes with the pan.

column2: Fair to middling. A little hard to appreciate.

column4: I'll beat him.
column5: So beat the cat, but don't kill it.

column1: So, Monica, what do you feel like doing this afternoon?
column2: Actually, I had a perfect plan for this afternoon, but it is totally ruined by the sand storm. I woke up this morning and found it was sunny. So I called Lucy and asked her to go shopping with me. We were going to look for a new purse. Now it turned out to be like this. Neither of us wants to go to outside anymore.
column3: That ’ s too bad. I hate sand storms too. It can be worse than any kind of bad weather.
column4: What ’ s wrong with climate? Anyway, I think the sand storm happens more frequently these days than the years before. Can ’ t people do something to stop it?
column5: It is not an easy job. The government is working on it. Lots of trees have been planted in the north of the capital. Also, methods of generating rain are being used by the government to fight against the drought. But of course, it will not work overnight. So, have you come out with a new plan for today?
column6: My new plan is to wait for the end of the sand storm and clean my apartment.

column1: The Blacks got divorced.
column2: Really? Why?
column3: Mr. Black has been getting a little on the side.
column4: Really? I am surprised. He doesn't look like a guy who'd ever cheat on his wife, does he?
column5: No, he doesn't. Anyway, his wife found out that he has been two-timing for a long time.
column6: Well, I am really surprised. By the way, have you done anything behind my back?
column7: No. The only thing I've ever done behind your back is zipping you up.
column8: I like that joke, but I hope it's true.

column4: Come on. Let's split the difference, 15 %.

column1: Would you tell me how I send this parcel to shanghai, China? It contains only books.

column4: That'll be ¥ 150.

column1: Which countries have you been to?
column2: I ’ Ve been to most of the countries in Europe, several countries in asia-china, Japan, korea, and Thailand-and to the united states and Canada.
column3: I thought you had been to Australia too.
column4: No, but I ’ m planning on visiting Australia and new Zealand soon. I ’ Ve heard that they are beautiful countries. Which is the most beautiful country you ’ Ve been to?
column5: I think I ‘ d say norway. It has many picturesque fjords, waterfalls, and mountains.
column6: Isn ’ t it really cold there?
column7: Well, the north of Norway is almost always cold, but further south it can be fairly warm in summer. It ’ s a wet country, so there ’ s snow almost everywhere in winter.
column8: I ’ Ve been to other Scandinavian countries, but not to Norway. Perhaps I should go and do some winter sports there.

column1: You won ’ t believe who ’ s been elected to do overtime on the Baker account! Me! I ’ Ve already logged in 20 hours of overtime!
column2: Wow! Why so much? I thought they were getting you an assistant.
column3: They were supposed to, but so far nobody ’ s turned up, and I ’ m left on my own to do the work. This is the first break I ’ Ve had all day.
column4: They ’ re really running you into the ground. Why don ’ t you ask for some time off? You could take a long weekend and go away somewhere.

column1: So can we play PlayStation later?
column2: Sure, if you're done!
column3: All my games are so lame, Mom. When can I get a new one?
column4: Well, listen, Honey, you've been a big help lately...
column5: Right on. I'm gonna get a new game!
column6: If you take out the garbage and do the dishes, I'll think about it.
column7: I knew there would be a catch!
column8: Nothing in life is free, Son.
column9: Except housework, that is.

column1: I ’ m hungry, let ’ s grab a bite to eat.
column2: Sure! How about we go home and prepare a couple of sandwiches?
column3: Nah! Let ’ s go get a burger and fries.
column4: All you ever do is have unhealthy fast food Pizza, fries, burgers and hot dogs! You have to start eating better!
column5: What are you talking about? I have salads some times.
column6: Yeah right! I ’ m serious! You should also cut down on your sugar intake as well. You drink carbonated drinks that are high in fructose syrup! It ’ s really not healthy!
column7: Fine! I ’ ll start drinking and having home cooked meals that are low in fat. Are you happy now?
column8: It ’ s a start, but I ’ ll be happy when I see you stick to your promise!

column1: It is so quiet here. I like the place.
column2: Me too.
column3: I can't stand the loud noise in the city.
column4: Yes, sometimes I can hardly get asleep at night.
column5: I hope I can stay here longer.
column6: When will your vacation end?
column7: The day after tomorrow.
column8: You will go back tomorrow, right?
column9: Yes, you are right.

column1: Hello.
column2: Hello. Is Steve there?
column3: I'm sorry. He's not here right now.
column4: What time will he be back?
column5: Around five thirty.
column6: This afternoon?
column7: Yes. May I ask who's calling?
column8: This is his friend, Greg.
column9: Okay. I'll tell him you called.
column10: Thanks.

column1: Good. There is the information desk. How do we get to seventieth street, please?
column2: The northern line is what you want.
column3: How much is it?
column4: It ’ s two yuan.
column5: Which way do we go for the northern line?
column6: Just go through the number eight to ticket barrier over there. A train will be in directly.
column7: I appreciate it, thank you.
column8: That ’ s all right.

column1: You must know you've been scheduled to have an operation the day after
column2: Yes. But I don't know the exact time.
column3: The operation starts at 10 0' clock. But you'll get an injection of anaesthesia about 30 to 45 minutes in advance. If your family comes to see you before the operation, they should come before 8: 30.
column4: Oh, I see. I will tell my wife. Thank you for telling me so much.
column5: It's nothing. Did your doctor explain to you about what operation you are going to have?
column6: Yes, of course. I am going to have my appendix removed.
column7: OK. Have you signed the consent?
column8: Yes. Here it is.

column1: How much will it be all together?
column2: $ 200, please.
column3: Can I pay by check?

column6: OK. Here are your robes. You can go shower first.

column1: Hi, Mr. Smith. Are you enjoying the cookout? You don't look too happy.

column3: Is that what people usually do on Memorial Day?
column4: They should. This holiday is about remembering our war dead. But people these days think it's just a holiday for summer sales and cookouts!
column5: I'm sorry to hear that. Thank you for telling me a little more about it.

column1: Good morning, sir. May I help you?

column3: What do they look like?
column4: White.
column5: How tall are they?
column6: They are short, I guess. About the same height as those short flowers over there.
column7: Do they look like roses?
column8: No, they look like little bells.
column9: Oh, lilies of the valley. No, I am sorry. We are all out of them right now.
column10: Oh, that's too bad.
column11: What about roses?
column12: Ok. How many do you suggest?
column13: As many as you like, sir. They are beautiful, aren't they?
column14: Yes, they are.

column1: Jack wonders whether Linda likes him or not.
column2: Why doesn't he ask her?
column3: He is too scared to ask her.
column4: He's a chicken guy.

column1: Hi, come on in. Can I take your coat?
column2: Sure, thanks. I brought you a bottle of wine as well.

column4: Should I take my shoes off?
column5: Whatever you prefer.

column7: Just over three weeks. Would you like a drink?
column8: Sure, what do you have?
column9: I've got white wine, red wine, gin and tonics, ginger ale, lemonade, orange juice, and sprite.
column10: I'll have a glass of red wine please.
column11: One glass of red wine coming up!

column13: There's just going to be 6 of us tonight.
column14: Oh, I thought there were going to be eight. who isn't coming?

column16: That's too bad.They' re such good company.
column17: I think there's someone at the door. Excuse me while I go and get that.

column1: Henry, I want to ask you something.
column2: Say what you want to say.
column3: You see. The wage is not paid yet, I am wondering if you could possibly lend me some money.
column4: I am sorry. But I do not have any money to lend to you.

column1: A ticket to London, please.

column3: Yes, including London Tube.
column4: That'll be twelve pounds.

column3: Thank you so much. By the way, is there a mail service?
column4: Yes, you can take your letters to the counter over there.

column1: Hey daddy! You look great today. I like your tie! By the way, I was wondering can I ;
column2: NO!
column3: I haven't even told you what it is yet!
column4: Okay, okay, what do you want?

column6: Um.. I don ’ t think so. I need the car tonight to pick up your mother.

column8: Who's this Eric guy?
column9: Duh! He's like the hottest and most popular guy at school! Come on, dad! Please!
column10: No can do... sorry.

column1: Don't cover up your sadness. Let it go.
column2: I'm sorry.
column3: It isn't your fault. No one will blame you.
column4: You are so thoughtful.

column1: I am going to celebrate my birthday with you all in a night club this year, what do you say?
column2: Fantastic! I enjoy clubbing, especially those clubs with live bands. The only fly in the ointment is that the air is bad, full of smoke, and the music is too loud, so conversations are not really possible. Once I nearly got burnt by a cigarette.
column3: How did that happen?
column4: A wild dancer dropped it on my left foot and said nothing about it. If I had drunk enough and I would have had the bold to punch him in the face.
column5: Sounds cool! But that is not what a lady should do. People are easy to lose head in a night club and being drunk.

column1: I've really enjoyed your party, Lisa.
column2: Not at all, Sam.
column3: I wish I could stay longer, but I must be going.

column1: Hi, Jone, how are you?
column2: Terrible.
column3: What's wrong?
column4: Someone robbed my apartment last week. The robber took $ 550.
column5: Oh, no! Did you call the police?
column6: No.
column7: Why not?
column8: My English isn't very good. I didn't know what to say to them.
column9: I'm going to give you some advice, Jone.If this happens again, you should call the police immediately. You should try to remember everything. You should explain everything to the police.

column1: Bob! Your eyes look bloodshot. Did you not sleep well?
column2: I had a drop too much last night. I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine. And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table.
column3: You have it right. Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China. Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship, especially in Northern China.
column4: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me. But if I keep gulping down one cup after another, I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick.
column5: You lose face by refusing to drink, and the host might think you refuse to give him face. The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up. This will endear you to your friends.
column6: A few guys even threw a drunken fit last night, crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood.
column7: Then he must be opening his heart to the friends. In a word, as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort, no one will jeer at you.
column8: I got you. Next time. I'll preface a toast with a statement like' I can't drink any more' and then drink anyway.

column1: I saw an interesting program on TV last night. It was about elderly people.
column2: And what did the program say?
column3: It said that people with a positive attitude 7 tend to live longer and happier.
column4: I think that many physicians 8 now agree with that idea.
column5: And the TV program also said that physical exercise helps people deal with stress.
column6: And the most active older people seem to enjoy some kind of physical exercise. My father is over 60 years old, and he lifts weights every day.

column2: French dressing, please.

column4: Oh, French dressing.

column6: We still prefer French dressing.

column6: No, I don't think so.

column1: Abby Park Hotel. Can I help you ;

column4: We will be arriving on Tuesday next week and staying for two days.
column5: We have a double room for you with a nice view of the park. Would that be OK?
