column1: Come on, fellows.Let' s enjoy my wife's cooking!
column2: Em, it's delicious!
column3: Thank you! My wife likes cooking very much.
column4: You're lucky.

column1: Do you want a cigarette?
column2: No, thank you. I've given up, you know.
column3: You don't mind if I have one.
column4: Well, all tight. But you know, smoking does do harm to your health.
column5: Yes, you are right.
column6: Why don't you try and give it up?
column7: I've tried to give up smoking several times, but it's no use.

column1: Johnny, I want to thank you.
column2: What do you mean, Mom? For breaking your best china?
column3: Oh, Johnny, that stuff was dollar store junk. No, I want to thank you for keeping Grandma busy.
column4: Well, it's more like she kept me busy...
column5: I know, and normally she's trying to tell me how to clean my house. So, thank you.
column6: Am I back in your good books?
column7: Not only that, but I'm going to buy you that video game after all!

column1: Today people are hearing about information superhighways and the intermet.
column2: Is this change going to be beneficial for theindividuals like you and me.
column3: Yes, I think so. My friend once used it mostly to play chess, but now he has learnt how to do other things on the Internet.
column4: There's no doubt the Internet will be a powerful commercial medium. It'll connect hundreds of millions of customers and open up huge markets for all kinds of products and services.
column5: That's true. I can imagine companies sending advertisements directly to customers over the net. Customers, in turn, can examine and compare whatever goods they want to buy and tell their computers to find them at the best price offered.
column6: Yeah. It'll be a shoppers heaven. That's the use of net in E-commerce.

column1: How long can I keep these books?
column2: A month. Don't forget to return them by the due date.
column3: What if I can't finish them by then?
column4: Bring them back to the circulation desk and renew them.
column5: Any terrible fines?
column6: Sure.

column1: Have you packed our passports?
column2: Not yet. Do we need to take it with us?
column3: Of course. Otherwise I cannot go abroad.
column4: Is that hard to get a passport?
column5: Not at all. But we do need to keep it with us all the time.
column6: It is hard to believe this little thing is so valuable to us.

column1: Is this the right bus for San Francisco?
column2: It sure is.Can I see your ticket? OK, fine.
column3: When's the first stop?
column4: About two hours out of Los Angeles. Give me the bags, I'll put'em on the bus. Here's your claim tag. Don't lose it.When you get off the bus, give it to me.
column5: Thank you.
column6: Is it all right to smoke on the bus?
column7: Sure, but only in the rear, and only cigarettes. And alcohol is not allowed.
column8: I see. Thank you.

column1: Do you have any siblings?
column2: Yes, I do. I am the oldest child. I have a sister and a brother. My sister is in college and my brother in high school.
column3: How do you get along with them?
column4: We get alone very well.

column1: I ’ m so excited, mother. Oh, a new baby!
column2: My first grandchild.
column3: And my first nephew. He looks a lot like you, mum. He does.
column4: Do you think so? Well, I guess. He does look a lot like me. Oh, he ’ s got Richard ’ s eyes though.
column5: Yes, he does have Richard ’ s eyes. The baby even looks like you than Richard does.
column6: Well, children usually resemble their parents.
column7: It ’ s true. Michelle is a lot like Henry in so many ways. And she is shy with new people just like he is.
column8: You often like comparing children with their parents.
column9: You ’ re right.

column1: What ’ s the difference between football and rugby ;
column2: Those tow games are quite different. First, there ’ s the size of the teams. In football, a team has 11 players. In rugby there are 15 players on each team. The biggest difference is that in football, only the goalkeeper can use his hands. In rugby, the ball is usually carried forward by players, though kicking is permitted.
column3: In rugby, players pass the ball by throwing it to team mates, don ’ t they?
column4: That ’ s right. However, players can only pass the ball backwards. They cannot pass the ball forwards to their team mates. That ’ s a foul.
column5: I know how goals are scored in football, but how about in rugby?
column6: If a team carries the ball over the goal line, they score points. A team can also score points by kicking the ball between two tall posts at each end of the pitch.
column7: There ’ s a lot more physical contact in rugby, isn ’ t there?
column8: Yes. Players usually need to bring a player down to stop him from moving forward with the ball. This is called ” tackling ”, as in football.
column9: The ball is a different shape in rugby, isn ’ t it?
column10: Yes. It ’ s not perfectly round like a football. A rugby ball is oval in shape. There ’ s a match on TV this afternoon. Why don ’ t you watch it with me? I ’ ll try to explain the rules and tactics while we ’ re watching.

column1: Well, I've got a date. Now I need to find a restaurant. Can you help me?
column2: No problem, of course! How much would you like to spend to impress the lady?
column3: Nothing but the best for a pretty woman!
column4: Sir, the restaurant you seek is right here. This hotel has a three-star restaurant.
column5: Well, I sort of suggested that we would go out on the town. Do you have another suggestion?
column6: Gramercy Tavern is at least as good as our own hotel restaurant. Plus, they have live jazz.
column7: Gramercy Tavern, eh? I think I've heard of that before. Call to get us a table, okay?
column8: Right away, sir. She will be impressed with your local knowledge.

column1: Excuse me, sir. Didn't you see the red light?
column2: Oh, I thought I could make a right turn on red here.
column3: No, sir. The sign says No Turn on Red.
column4: Oh, I guess I didn't see it.
column5: I am sorry, sir. But may I see your driver's license and insurance policy, PLS? I have to give you a ticket.
column6: Here they are.
column7: Sign here, PLS. You can appeal to the court within 14 days. This slip has all the information you need. Pls drive safely, sir.
column8: Thank you, Ma ’ am.

column1: Allow me to introduce my self.My name is Jack Black, manager of the company.
column2: How do you do, Mr.Black? Very happy to see you.
column3: Pleasure is mine.Here' s my card.
column4: Thank you, This is mine.

column1: Yes! I finally lost that last five pounds I've been working on forever!
column2: How did you finally do it?
column3: A friend suggested that I stop nibbling between meals.
column4: Like snacking?
column5: You know, a little piece of chocolate here, some chips on the side, candy now and then...
column6: I get what you mean.
column7: Instead, I sit down and have a good snack like a piece of fruit between meals.
column8: I'm impressed. Good for you!

column1: What's going on here?
column2: We're waiting in line to get one of Master Li's Chinese couplets. I got one last year and I had good luck all year!
column3: Master Li? Who's that?
column4: He's Taipei's most famous calligraphy master! Quick! Get in line!
column5: I will! I could use some good luck!

column1: What's the temperature today?
column2: It's about 5 degrees centigrade.
column3: What's the weather forecast for tomorrow?
column4: The weatherman says it's going to snow tomorrow.
column5: Are you used to the climate here?
column6: I think I'll soon get used to it.
column7: What is the average temperature of Beijing?
column8: lt's about 180C, but in winter the temperature may fall to 10-15 degrees below zero. And we have a long winter.
column9: Which season do you like best?
column10: I prefer spring when little by little everything becomes green and the weather is almost always nice.

column1: Excuse me, can you tell me where the breakfast cereals are?
column2: They're in aisle 2A, down that way.
column3: Are the snack foods in that area, too?
column4: Yes, they're in... let me think... Aisle 3B, if I remember right.
column5: Okay, I'll go take a look. Thank you so much for your help.
column6: Don't mention it.

column1: Can you tell me how to reach the bank please?
column2: Which bank? There are two, the Allied Irish Bank and the Bank of Ireland.
column3: I have an AIR pass card and I want to withdraw money from the bank.
column4: You need to go to the Allied Irish Bank which is near the local shopping centre, Dunned Stores.
column5: How do I get there. I have no knowledge of this area.
column6: Cross the road and turn left at the other side. Walk along the footpath until you reach the traffic lights. You will see a shopping centre on the right hand side. Walk across the road and turn right after the shopping centre. Keep going straight for about 100m and the bank is to your left.
column7: It sounds very complicated. How far is it from here?
column8: It's not so complicated. It's about five minutes walk from here. I can draw a map for you if you wish.
column9: Oh, I would really appreciate that. By the way will I be going North or South?
column10: You will be going northwards. You are now in the the Western part of the city and the Allied Irish Bank is situated in the North East. Here's a rough sketch of the area.

column1: Haven't seen you for a long time
column2: I've been away on a vacation.
column3: I bet you had a wonderful time
column4: Yeah, beautiful sunshine, pleasant scenery and many new friends
column5: Sounds great

column1: Could you do me a favour? Please give me some confidential information.
column2: Don ’ t put me on the spot. You know, I can ’ t do that.

column1: Jimmy, I ’ d like to wear this robe for tonight cocktail party. What do you think of it?
column2: Don ’ t dress like that. You ’ ll make fool yourself. You look stupid in that robe.
column3: What? But it is my favorite piece of clothing.
column4: Maybe it is. But it ’ s out of fashion.
column5: What am I going to do?
column6: Let ’ s go downtown and pick up some fashionable clothes for you.

column1: Would you like to come by and play bridge?
column2: Well, let's see.Why don't we go dancing for a change? We haven't done that for a long time.
column3: Well, to tell the truth, I don't really feel like it tonight. I had a pretty hard day and I'm sort of tired.
column4: Hmm.Well, in that case, we could go to the movies.
column5: Oh, we always go to the movies.Can' t we do something different?
column6: Well, do you have any suggestions?
column7: Let's see.How do you feel about playing bridge?
column8: It's OK with me, but we don't have any beer and things.
column9: Well, shall I call Janet and ask her and Tom to come over, and I'll go to the store and buy some stuff.
column10: OK.

column1: So Dick, how about getting some coffee for tonight?
column2: Coffee? I don ’ t honestly like that kind of stuff.
column3: Come on, you can at least try a little, besides your cigarette.
column4: What ’ s wrong with that? Cigarette is the thing I go crazy for.
column5: Not for me, Dick.

column1: How did you enjoy your family party at “ ginger ’ s ”? I hear that they have a lovely menu and buffet.
column2: Oh, it was great. We had seafood buffet. They do one every Friday. The waiters and waitresses are very good. They are very attentive, but don ’ t hang around the table.
column3: I like the buffets they have, but if often order a la carte, because I don ’ t feel extremely hungry. I like the wine list there too.
column4: Yes, so do I. they have wines from all over the world. There is a good range of prices to suit every pocket. We ordered some Australian red wine, which tasted delicious and wasn ’ t expensive.
column5: Some restaurants allow you to take your own wine and just charge you corkage, but the don ’ t do that at “ ginger ’ s ”. what was included in the seafood buffet?
column6: They had almost every kind of seafood. There were oyster, shrimp, prawns, crabs, and fish. I ate a lot of smoked salmon.
column7: Did they have lobster?
column8: No, they didn ’ t. you could order it from the menu. I think that lobster is too expensive to be included in the buffet.
column9: Yes, it probably is. I don ’ t like ordering oysters in restaurants. You never know whether they are fresh.
column10: I know. I didn ’ t eat any, but a few people in our group did and no one got sick.
column11: When you eat out, do you usually eat from the buffet?
column12: Not usually. I usually just order a main course and have a dessert if I ’ m still hungry afterwards.
column13: Oh, you don ’ t usually have a starter?
column14: No, I might have a soup if it ’ s a cold winter day.

column1: Good afternoon, sir, is there anything I can do for you?
column2: Yes. I can't find my sweater. I have my laundry sent to you yesterday but when the washing is done. I find my swatter missing.
column3: Well, it's our fault.We are sorry for that.Would you please fill out the form? We will pay for you.
column4: That's fine. Maybe you should be more careful.

column1: Don't throw paper on the floor, Bill.
column2: Where shall I put it, miss?
column3: Put it in the waste-paper basket, please.
column4: But Peter and Tony put all their paper in the basket a few moments ago.Now it's full.
column5: In that case, take the basket outside and empty it.
column6: Yes, miss.
column7: Where did you empty the basket, Bill?
column8: In the playground, miss.
column9: Silly boy! The dustbin is at the back of the school. Now pick up the paperand put it in the dustbiri.

column1: Hi, Kate.
column2: Hi, Don. What a surprise!
column3: Yeah, I saw someone walking like you, but I wasn ’ t sure. We haven ’ t seen each other for how long? Almost three months? But you look quite different now.
column4: Have you noticed what has changed?
column5: Oh, you look quite slender and more vivacious. What have you been taking? Are you on a diet?
column6: Yes. I ’ m on a diet, but I ’ Ve not taken anything. I just eat less and exercise more. And it really worked in the past three months. I ’ Ve lost twelve pounds.
column7: Wow! That ’ s great. I sincerely want to achieve my weight loss goals, but it ’ s difficult for me to keep up the exercise. Also you know, old habits are hard to break.
column8: What kind of exercise do you think I do? I just go to dance everyday after work. I ’ m taking an amateur dance class. I dance two hours everyday.
column9: Dance? You only go dancing? That ’ s not hard. I can do that.
column10: Sure. Join my class next week.

column1: Good morning. Sanyu Restaurant. May I help you?
column2: What time do you open this evening?
column3: We open at 6:30, sir.
column4: I see. I'd like to reserve a table for two.
column5: Yes, sir. What time would you like your table, sir?
column6: I'm not sure, perhaps around 8 pm.
column7: Fine! I'll reserve a table for two at 8 pm, sir. May I have your name, please?
column8: Davis.
column9: Thank you, Mr. Davis.
column10: Oh, any chance of a table by the window? My wife loves the bird's eye view. As it's her birthday, I want it to be a celebration.
column11: I see. We have already received many bookings and though I can't guarantee anything, please be assured that we'll try our best, Mr. Davis. I hope you'll understand.
column12: I do, but I would appreciate you, if it could be arranged.
column13: We'll try our best.
column14: Thank you.

column1: I hear your daughter graduated from high school as the valedictorian.
column2: Thank you.
column3: Where is she going to college?
column4: She has been admitted to Yale with a scholarship.
column5: Really? That's the icing on the cake. Congratulation again!
column6: Thank you.

column1: Whew! I had to wait for almost an hour to get to the front of the line.
column2: You have much patience.
column3: Wow! Your calligraphy is very beautiful. It was worth the wait!
column4: Thank you. Today I'm writing a kind of poem called a Chinese couplet.
column5: What does it say?
column6: This is an especially famous one. It says " May the passing days bring you health and longevity. May this season of renewal find you basked in riches. "
column7: That's very nice. Is it for sale?
column8: No. I never sell my artwork.
column9: Really? Then what do you do with it?
column10: I give it away. Here, this one is for you.
column11: Wow! Really? Are you sure? Now I'll have a lucky year!
column12: Remember, real luck must be created ( by ) yourself, and then it cannot be given or taken away...

column1: You were right. It's raining again.
column2: I told you so.

column1: Steven, would you like to go dance with us tonight?
column2: John, I am just not in the mood for this.
column3: You look so upset. What's going on?
column4: I lost the table tennis game yesterday.
column5: Oh, what a pity!
column6: I just don ’ t want to play table tennis any more.
column7: Is it that bad? It ’ s nothing more than a game.
column8: My opponent bowled me with the very first ball. I was wondering if it's appropriate for me to play table tennis.
column9: Oh, come on! Failure is the mother of success. Don ’ t lose heart. I'm sure you'll succeed.
column10: Perhaps you are right. But I still need some time to recover from the failure.
column11: I understand.

column1: Please come in!
column2: Hi. Steven. I just drop in and want to have a chat with you.
column3: Oh, so nice of you to come here. Have a seat. Please make yourself at home.
column4: OK. ( Sit on the sofa ) Wow! Your house was decorated so beautiful.
column5: Thank you. My wife would be very happy to hear this.
column6: She must have done a lot of work on it.
column7: You bet.

column1: I'm sorry, but I can't go.
column2: Why not?
column3: I have to see my daughter.
column4: When poyou have to see her?
column5: I have an appointment at one fifteen.

column1: Good morning. Mrs.Smith.
column2: Good morning! Can you help me, please? I'm looking for some books for my mother.
column3: Well, what kind of books does she like?
column4: She's very fond of detective stories?
column5: I see. Has she read any detective stories?
column6: Oh, yes!
column7: Do you know if she's read this one?
column8: I'm not sure, but she probably won't remember if she has! She's very forgetful!
column9: Ah! She has a bad memory. How old is she?
column10: She's eighty-seven.
column11: I suggest you take this book. It's very exciting.
column12: Thank you. That's a good idea.she likes exciting books. Can you suggest another one?

column1: Jim was late again.
column2: It's not like him to be late.

column1: Want to meet for lunch this Saturday?
column2: Sorry, I can't. I am busy.
column3: What are you doing?
column4: I always do volunteer work on the first Saturday of every month.
column5: What kind of volunteer work?
column6: I help out at the children's hospital. I help plan activities.
column7: Oh, yeah?
column8: Yes, it ’ s exciting. This month we are doing crossword puzzles.

column1: Good evening, I have a reservation under the name of Tomlinson.
column2: Ok I ’ Ve found it. Checking out on the 27th?
column3: That ’ s right.
column4: Can I take a credit card for the deposit?
column5: Yes, sure. Also, I ’ d like a non-smoking room please.
column6: Certainly madam. Here ’ s your key. Your room is on the 7th floor and on the left. Room 781. Check out is at 12 noon.

column1: What are you guys doing?
column2: Just having a chat.

column1: We should keep Frank at arm's length.
column2: Yeah. He's known as a sly dog. He's done many people in.
column3: He hits below the belt.
column4: And he may cash in on people whenever chances are provided.

column1: Could you introduce to me the man over there?
column2: Certainly.Let' s to and meet him now.
column3: You're so kind.

column1: Did you smell something? It smells so great.
column2: It must come from the bakery on the corner.They are baking cookies. Their cookies are very popular in town.
column3: How come I never knew that? Do they have a new baker or something?
column4: I think so. The bakery invited a famous baker from the USA. He is good at making cookies.
column5: Let's go and get some cookies. I am hungry now.
column6: Look at the swiss roll over there, they look delicious, too, I am thinking about buying one.
column7: You can taste some before you buy it. They have food tasting at the counter.
column8: I am starting loving this bakery now.
column9: It's one of my favorite bakeries.
column10: You should have told me earlier. I am a cookie lover.

column1: Happy Anniversary, honey.
column2: I thought you had forgotten.
column3: After the trouble I got into last year, no way.
column4: Thank you honey, it means a lot to me.

column1: Excuse me, do you have A tale of Two Cities? I'd like a copy of it.
column2: Who is the author?
column3: Charles Dickens.
column4: Sorry, we' re sold out right now.Please come back next week.
column5: Ok, Thanks.

column1: Let ’ s play a game!
column2: OK! How about Scrabble?
column3: No, no, a friend of mine taught me this really fun game. I ’ m going to describe someone ’ s face, and you guess who it is!
column4: OK!
column5: Let ’ s see. He has a roman nose, bushy eyebrows and dimples!
column6: Our cousin Pete! My turn! She has a pointy nose, sunken eyes and a mole on her chin!
column7: Aunt Rose! That mole is so huge! OK, my turn. He has a crooked nose and full lips. He has quite a few freckles and an oval face. Oh, he is also bald!
column8: Your future husband!
column9: Not funny.

column1: My uncle passed away last night.
column2: My condolences.

column1: I ’ m thinking about redecorating my bedroom. I bought this magazine in order to get some ideas. What do you think of this?
column2: That looks good. The room in the picture is bigger than your bedroom, so you wouldn ’ t be able to put all the furniture in your room.
column3: I ’ d like to have the bad and the wardrobe.
column4: You would fit both of them in your bedroom. Perhaps you could also get the dressing table. I think that one would look good in your bedroom.
column5: Yes, it would. It ’ s very expensive though.
column6: Everything in this magazine seems expensive. You could probably find something similar in a discount furniture store.
column7: Yes. I ’ m sure I could find something similar at one. I ’ d also like to get a new carpet for my bedroom.
column8: You can get cheap carpets easily. Another idea is to buy a rug. That would cover a lot of the carpet and you wouldn ’ t have to replace the carpet. It would save you a lot of work.
column9: That ’ s a good idea. I ’ m really looking forward to redoing my bedroom.

column1: pompous. How may I help you?
column2: Yes, I'd like to reserve a table for dinner.
column3: How large a group are you expecting?
column4: Six couples.
column5: Would you like to reserve a private dining room?
column6: That sounds like a good idea.
column7: All right. May I have your name, Sir?
column8: My name is Ron Kollwitz.

column1: It is difficult for old people to do away with old ideas.
column2: So the reform can not be carried out well.
column3: The government is making efforts to change situation.
column4: Easier said than done.

column1: You didn't tell me she was married!
column2: I tried. You were preoccupied.
column3: I got carried away. I made such a fool of myself. They were both laughing at me!
column4: You got drunk, and you were hilarious. Lighten up.
column5: That guy was definitely a Don.
column6: So now you can say you had a mafia experience. Ha-ha.
column7: Yeah. If I leave Little Italy alive...
column8: Are you kidding? Don had fun scaring you. He'd probably buy you dinner if we go back.

column1: I'm so hungry. Shall we go eat now, Rick ;
column2: sure. Where do you want to go? Are you in the mood for anything in particular?
column3: how about some dumplings? I just can't get enough of them.
column4: dumplings again?! Oh, Amy, let's try something new!
column5: well, what do you have in mind?
column6: how about the Mongolian hot pot?
column7: oh, it's too spicy for me. Don't you remember last time when I tasted the lamb? It was so spicy my eyes teared up!
column8: maybe we can try Yuanyang pot this time. You can choose the non-spicy soup base.
column9: sounds great. Do they serve noodles? I am in the mood for some tasty noodles as well.
column10: yes. The sliced noodles they offer are among the most authentic Shanti cuisines.

column1: I want to leave the motorbike outdoors.
column2: Fine, just don't do it at night.
column3: Why not?
column4: The cold weather will damage the engine.

column1: Why do you want to go to the U. S.?
column2: I want to enrich my knowledge in management. The United States is an ideal place for me.
column3: What will you do when you come home?
column4: Before I work in the office, I was a teacher. So if possible, I'd like to come back to some school to pass on my new knowledge to more people.
column5: Do you feel your English is good enough for the course?
column6: Yes. You know, English is my present working language. Besides, I scored very high in TOEFL.
column7: Who will be your supporter during your stay in the States?
column8: I will support myself. In recent years, I have saved enough money for my study in the U. S.
column9: How long do you expect to stay there?
column10: I will be there for three years.

column1: Good afternoon.
column2: My goodness! It ’ s the afternoon? Doesn ’ t the time fly! Do come in and sit down.
column3: Thank you.
column4: What ’ s the time? My watch has stopped.
column5: It ’ s half past twelve.
column6: When do you have lunch?
column7: From one to two.
column8: What do you normally eat?
column9: We usually go to the cafeteria.
column10: Oh, it ’ s time to have lunch now.
column11: let ’ s go together.

column1: Could I speak to the apartment manager ;
column2: I am the apartment manager. How can I help you?
column3: I wanted to know if that apartment on Main Street is still for rent.
column4: I haven't rented it out yet. Would you like to see it?
column5: Yes, I want to see it.
column6: How about today at 6 p. m.?
column7: That time is okay with me.
column8: Very good. We'll meet at 6. Do you need directions?
column9: No, thank you. I go by there on my way to work.
column10: If you're interested, you can fill out an application form.

column1: Good evening, sir. What can I do for you?
column2: Good evening. Would you please offer a table far from the entrance for us?
column3: Yes, of course. This way, please.

column1: What are you up to tonight, Steve?
column2: I'm going to a disco with my friends.
column3: That sounds like fun. Have a good time.

column1: Hi, can I help you?
column2: Yes, please. I'm looking for a sofa.
column3: What about this one?
column4: May it be used as a sofa in the day and a bed during the night?
column5: Oh, you want a convertible sofa. This way, please. Over there is the one you want.

column1: My throat is really dry.
column2: Do you want to go get something to drink?
column3: Yes, I'm parched.
column4: What did you want to drink?
column5: I was thinking about getting a soda.
column6: Do you know that soda doesn't quench your thirst?
column7: Why not?
column8: Soda is really bad for you.
column9: I don't know what else to drink.
column10: You're supposed to drink water when you're dehydrated.
column11: I would like some water.
column12: That's what will keep you from being thirsty.

column1: What do you think of the new television channel? Aren't the programs awful?
column2: I quite agree with you. They are terrible. They are complete waste of time, but my wife disagrees with me.
column3: Actually, what bothers me is the violence. There are far too many detective and police shows.
column4: I couldn't agree with you more. There aren't enough educational programs, and even the news shows are not well done.
column5: You are absolutely right. They are too brief. They don't tell you anything.

column1: Did you move into your new apartment ;
column2: Yes, but I ’ m afraid it ’ s still a mess. I haven ’ t put anything away yet.
column3: Don ’ t worry. It ’ ll probably take you about three weeks to get everything organized.
column4: Don ’ t say that. It looks like a dump now. I can ’ t stand it.
column5: Have you taken a walk around your neighborhood yet?
column6: Unfortunately, yes.
column7: What do you mean by that?
column8: I took a long walk through the neighborhood this morning on my way to the train station. It took me 20 minutes.
column9: Yes, but you only pay 800 dollars a month. Emm, it ’ s hard to decide which is better, shorter commuting time or lower rent.
column10: I thought paying a lower rent would be better, but now I ’ m not sure.

column1: So I'm on the fifth floor? How come this hotel has no fourth floor.
column2: Four is an unlucky number here, Peter.Four sounds like death in Chinese.Hotels often have no fourth floor.
column3: I see.Oh, I know what I wanted to ask.How much should I tip this guy?
column4: People don't usually tip here, but you can.Fifty dollars should be more enough.

column1: John dates her seven times a week.
column2: Really? That's a straws in the wind.
column3: I think so. Maybe he's fallen for her.
column4: Yeah. They suit each other. A perfect match between a man and a girl.

column1: Brian, do you know how to speak English ;
column2: Yes.
column3: Where did you learn?
column4: I learned in college.
column5: You speak really well.
column6: Thank you.
column7: How long have you been in the U. S.?
column8: 3 weeks.
column9: Is your wife with you?
column10: Yes, she just got here yesterday.

column1: What's the name of the singer who sings this song?
column2: I can't remember.
column3: It's on the tip of my tongue. I think it starts with a' B'.

column1: Come here at once, John. Will you?
column2: Yes, mum. I'm coming.
column3: And bring you homework with you, please.
column4: Oh, must I?
column5: Yes, you must.

column1: Alice, your father is amazing. He ’ s 90 years old and he lives alone in that big house.
column2: I know. He doesn ’ t like to ask anyone for help. My dad insists on paying his own bills and taking care of himself!
column3: That sounds like my Grandmother. She was always stubbornly independent.
column4: It seems that folks like my father and your grandmother are determined to be on their own.
column5: They see their independence as a kind of character strength.
column6: Sometimes they are too independent.

column1: Let's speed up. We're going to be late again.
column2: If we hurry, can we get there in time?
column3: I hope so.

column1: I made my little brother cry.
column2: Shame on you!

column1: Sheila, what time should we meet tomorrow?
column2: The usual time. Half past two in the afternoon.
column3: What place?
column4: The usual place. In front of the treasure house.
column5: And what should I wear?
column6: Your usual shirt and shoes.
column7: What are you going to wear?
column8: Nothing unusual, I ’ m afraid.
column9: Sheila, how about that fashionable blue dress?
column10: Good. That ’ s something unusual.

column1: Susan, good evening.Why are you so dressed up ;
column2: I'm on my way out to a New Year's banquet.How do I look? Is my make-up ok?
column3: You look great.Your make-up is perfect.
column4: Do your think I should wear a different dress?
column5: No, the one you have on looks fabulous, especially with your hair like that.
column6: Thanks for saying.Do you have any ideas which necklace I should wear?
column7: With that dress I'd like to say your white diamond necklace would look perfect.
column8: Thanks for helping out.Now Im ready, what are you doing tonight?
column9: Not much, Just a house party with some friends.
column10: Sounds fun.Anyone I know?

column1: I want to buy some running shoes. Maybe New Balance.
column2: Why do you need running shoes? You aren't a runner.
column3: But I exercise at the club. And I use the stepping machine.So I need good running shoes.
column4: That's not the same.Maybe you want to buy running-shoe-style shoes, but not real running shoes.
column5: What's the difference?
column6: There isn't much difference. But there is some difference.For one thing, real running shoes are much more expensive.They have very lightweight materials.They' re designed for serious runner
column7: And what are running-shoe-style shoes?
column8: They look like running shoes.They have the same shape. And you can use them for running too.But they're not so serious. They aren't designed for serious runners.You can use them for exerce
column9: But they aren't as light, right?
column10: That's right.If you want a really lightweight shoe, you should buy a high-quality running shoe.
column11: That's what I want.For exercising at the club. I can even spend 100 dollars on them. I don't care.
column12: But it's a waste of money. You won't really run in them! You don't need such a shoe to use exercise machines. It's just a waste of money.
column13: My sister has New Balance running shoes. I want shoes just like hers. I don't care if they're expensive. And they look cool too.
column14: Well, do what you like.There are different kinds of New Balance shoes though.You don't have to buy the most expensive.
column15: I want the best.My sister said good shoes are very important. For support. They support your feet.
column16: Your sister is a fitness expert, huh?
column17: No, but she exercises more than me.
column18: I really think you are stubborn about some things.But here. Let's look at the New Balance shoes.
column19: Here it is. This is what my sister has.
column20: Yes, that's it. That's their top model.
column21: I wonder if they have my size.
column22: Well, we can wait for the assistant to help us, or we can look through the boxes down here. What is your size?
column24: Well, here you are. Size six. Woman's. 137 dollars.Wow, what a waste of money!
column25: It's none of your business. Let me try them on.

column1: May I help you?
column2: Yes. I'm looking for a green dress.
column3: What size do you wear? These dresses are on sale.
column4: I wear size 32. This one looks nice. Where may I try it on?
column5: Come this way. Here's the dressing room.
column6: How does it look?
column7: It looks nice. And it's not expensive.
column8: How much is it?
column9: It's only $ 20.
column10: I'll take it.

column1: Yeah, look at all those new buildings going up! Mr. Zhang, the traffic is pretty smooth. But we were told the roads from the airport to downtown were quite crowded and traffic jams could be as long as half an hour.
column2: Yes, they were. But it has already past. The traffic from the airport to downtown has been relieved after the completion of Yan'an Aerial Road.
column3: We've never expected that Shanghai is such a big metropolis, same as New York city. David, would it be a good idea to rent a car here? I've got an international driver's license with a pretty good record in the States.
column4: That's wonderful. OK. I'll remember that. But I have to warn you that you must drive very carefully in the downtown area, for there're no separate lanes for motor vehicles and bicycles in some places, and still quite a few people don't take road regulations seriously.

column1: Your garden is looking beautiful this summer. The flowers are really colorful.
column2: Thank you. I have roses, tulips, and daffodils. Do you like the rockery with the smaller flowers?
column3: Yes, I do. Those are violets, aren ’ t they?
column4: Yes, they are. This afternoon, I ’ m going to prune the hedge.
column5: The lower branches on that tree are hanging very low. Would you like me to cut them off for you?
column6: Thank you! That would be very kind of you. I have a saw in the garden shed.
column7: When the lower branches are removed, you ’ ll be able to sit under the tree.
column8: Tomorrow, I ’ ll cut the grass. Then the garden will lock perfect.
column9: Just make sure children don ’ t play in the flower beds and destroy the flowers.

column1: I'd like to send this parcel to Spain, please.
column2: Do you want to send it by airmail or by surface mail?
column3: Well, how long will it take if I send it by surface mail?
column4: About five weeks.
column5: Oh, dear. It won't get there for New Year's Day if I send it by surface mail. How much will it cost if I send it by air?
column6: Just a moment. I'll weigh it.

column1: Would you find any other available flight to Tokyo?
column2: Sure. We try our best.
column3: Thank you.
column4: Mr.Chen, are you sure you're taking BA - 007 back to Tokyo?
column5: Yes, of course. I think our travel agent would have made the reservation for us.
column6: I'm afraid this flight is all booked up.
column7: Are you sure? We can't really take it? I reconfirmed with Miss Peterson the other day.
column8: I'm afraid so except we have many no-show passengers.

column1: Watsup, ladies! Y'll looking ’ fine tonight. May I have this dance?
column2: He's cute! He looks like Tiger Woods! But, I can't dance...
column3: It's all good. I'll show you all the right moves. My name's Malik.
column4: Nice to meet you. I'm Wen, and this is Nikki.
column5: How you feeling ’, vista? Mind if I take your friend' round the dance floor?
column6: She doesn't mind if you don't mind getting your feet stepped on.
column7: Right. Cool! Let's go!

column1: The government has to face a lot of social problems now.
column2: I think it is unemployment that gives rise to such social problems.
column3: But it is very difficult for any government to handle it efficiently.
column4: You are right.

column1: Next please.
column2: I want to send this letter to the US by airmail.
column3: That'll be five yuan forty, please.

column1: I think I've looked everywhere, but I haven't seen a swimming pool here.
column2: This hotel has no full-size pool, but we do have swim stations in our gym.
column3: Swim stations? Whoever heard of such a thing?
column4: You swim in a swim station just like you run on a treadmill.
column5: All that exercise in a little pool! Do I have to pay anything?
column6: The swim stations are available to all guests for no charge.
column7: Very good. Now can you tell me the hours of operation?
column8: They're available anytime between 7 a. m. and 10 p. m., seven days a week.
column9: Wow! I can't wait to change into my trunks!
column10: The swim stations are very popular, sir. I hope you don't find a line down there.

column1: I really like the apartment, but I was wondering if I could change some things.
column2: What would you like to change?
column3: I would like to have different carpet.
column4: I would be willing to put in a different color carpet if you pay the price difference.
column5: How much more would it cost?
column6: It would cost between 2 and 10 dollars more per square yard.
column7: While I am at it, would it be possible to switch paint colors?
column8: I would be willing to look at a different color. You need to bring me a sample.
column9: When can my apartment be painted and ready to go?
column10: You can have the new carpet and paint by next Monday.

column1: I like the kid. He's so lovely.
column2: How old is he?
column3: Twelve. He's very sensible for his age.

column1: Your family must be busy shopping for Christmas, now.
column2: Oh yeah and decorating the house too was colored paper and pictures. they will put a Christmas tree just inside the front door, pained toys and colored electric lights along the branches and plays all the gift packages under it.
column3: Woo, your home will beautiful on Christmas.
column4: Sure our thing.
column5: I do wish your christmas and happy new year.
column6: Thanks.

column1: Are you okay, man? You don ’ t look very well.
column2: Ugh, I feel terrible. I went out last night with Trevor, and things got a little out of hand.
column3: Nice! So, where did you guys go?
column4: We hit a couple of local bars, and met up with some friends. Everything was cool until Mike came along, and it turned out that it was his birthday yesterday!
column5: Oh no! Mike ’ s birthday is a drinkfest for sure!
column6: Tell me about it! We drank everything in the bar!
column7: Is that why you missed work today?
column8: Yeah. I woke up this morning feeling really nauseous. I threw up like five times.
column9: Www!
column10: I was so dehydrated that I drank like a gallon of water, and my head has been pounding all day. I swear, I ’ m never gonna drink again!
column11: Too bad man, tonight is Tracy ’ s going away party and she asked if you were gonna go.
column12: Oh, yeah. I ’ m there!

column1: Hi, did you call for an exterminator?
column2: Yes! Thank goodness you ’ re here.These bugs are driving us crazy!
column3: What sort of pest are we dealing with?
column4: We just bought this house and it is infected with just about everything. We have termites in the wood, cockroaches all over the place, and last night I saw a huge rat out in the backyard!
column5: Well, there ’ s nothing we can ’ t handle. I ’ ll spray the floorboards and walls to get rid of the cockroaches, but the termites will be harder to get rid of. We will have to cover the entire house and fumigate it. Unfortunately that means you will have to find a place to stay for the next three days.
column6: No problem, just get rid of the bugs!

column1: Welcome back! How was your vacation?
column2: It was fantastic, but I'm glad to be back! Being a tourist is really tiring!
column3: Where did you end up going?
column4: Because it's off-season, we got a really good package deal to Paris, so we went there.
column5: I've always wanted to go to Paris. The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous tourist attractions in the world! Did you go to the top?
column6: That was the first thing we did. I have a few pictures. Do you want to see them?
column7: Sure. What's this one a picture of?
column8: Oh, that's a picture of me on our fourth day of travelling. I'm standing next to a famous foundation in the centre of the city.
column9: You don't look very happy in that picture.
column10: No, by that time, I was sick of sightseeing. I had had enough of art galleries, cathedrals, fountains, statues, and palaces!
column11: So what did you do?
column12: We spent that afternoon walking around a flea market. We had a few coffees, watched a movie, and went for a swim in the pool at the hotel.
column13: My travel agent always reminds me to plan a day of relaxing for every 3 days of sightseeing. Did you go to the Louvre?
column14: Of course! You can't go to Paris without going to their famous art gallery! I was surprised by how small the Mona Lisa was though.
column15: That's what everyone says! I can't wait to see it for myself some day.

column1: May, do you mind helping me prepare for the picnic?
column2: Sure. Have you checked the weather report?
column3: Yes. It says it will be sunny all day. No sign of rain at all.This is your father's favorite sausage. Sandwiches for you and Daniel.
column4: No, thanks Mom. I'd like some toast and chicken wings.
column5: Okay. Please take some fruit salad and crackers for me.
column6: Done. Oh, don't forget to take napkins disposable plates, cups and picnic blanket.
column7: All set. May, can you help me take all these things to the living room?
column8: Yes, madam.
column9: Ask Daniel to give you a hand?
column10: No, mom, I can manage it by myself. His help just causes more trouble.

column1: Do you mind if I get a lift in your car, please?
column2: I don ’ t see any problem ; only the car is a bit old.
column3: Oh you ’ re so kind!
column4: Get in.

column1: I don't think I'm getting better.
column2: Believe me, you really look much better than before.
column3: I'm still not sure whether I can recover from it.

column1: Did you have a part-time job when you were still in school?
column2: No, I was way too busy studying all the time. How about you?
column3: Yeah, I worked about twenty hours a week in a pizza restaurant.
column4: What was that like?
column5: It was always very busy there.
column6: What did you do?
column7: I stood behind the register and took pizza orders.
column8: Did you get any perks on the job?
column9: Yeah, I got to eat as much pizza as I could for free.

column1: People are funny ;
column2: They sure are.
column3: Did you hear about the pilot?
column4: The one that stole a small plane?
column5: Yes, he stole a plane in Canada and flew into the U. S.
column6: Did they catch him?
column7: Yes. After two U. S. fighter jets followed him for an hour, he landed on a highway.
column8: Did he crash?
column9: No, he just landed the plane and walked to a restaurant.
column10: Did the cops find out why he flew into the U. S.?

column1: Can I help you?
column2: I'd like to buy a new mobile phone please.
column3: Ok, would you like a phone with camera and MP3 player?
column4: Yes please. And I ’ d like to be able to make video calls too.

column1: Look at these newlyweds. They seem as if they are on top of the world.
column2: Yes, they do. It's great for them to tie the knot and get married.
column3: People who have just got married feel that the world is right before them.
column4: Nothing seems to be happier for them.

column1: I can't go to your party.
column2: That's too bad.

column1: Come on! It's time to go!
column2: Wait a minute! Just hold your horses! What's your hurry, anyway?
column3: Well, I've got to stop and get gas in the car, first.
column4: That won't take long.
column5: Well, it won't if there no line at the pump.
column6: Well, I'm not quite ready.
column7: I'll give you five more minutes, then I'm going on without you!
column8: You wouldn't do a thing like that!
column9: Oh, yes, I would!

column1: May I have a look at that vase, please?
column2: Of course. It's the best one I have here---and it's only 300 yuan.
column3: Oh, it's really nice, but to tell the truth, that's far too expensive.
column4: Really? Even for such an excellent one?

column1: Hello. Can I talk to David?
column2: One second, please. ( a few seconds later, the receiver comes back and says ) Hello?
column3: Yes.
column4: I ’ m sorry. David is out to lunch right now.
column5: Okay. I ’ m his wife. Could you tell him to call me back when he returns?
column6: Sure. Does he know where to call you?
column7: Oh, thanks. Please tell him to call my cell-phone number.
column8: Ok, I will.
column9: Thank you very much.
column10: No problem.

column1: Hi, Madam, I'm new here, could you tell me where is boarding gate?
column2: What's your flight number?
column3: Wait a second, please. Oh, it's CA193.
column4: Are you a transfer passenger, sir?
column5: Yes.
column6: Then the north line is the right track for you to take.
column7: It's so nice of you.

column1: Who stands out in your mind as a man or woman of sound character?
column2: If I think of famous people, I think of Abraham Lincoln.
column3: He's the US president, who walked five miles just to give a lady her change, isn't he?
column4: That's the one. He also was famous for never giving up on his goals.
column5: That's right. He ran for office quite a few times before he was finally elected.
column6: And I also admire him for his courage in fighting for equal rights.
column7: He had great vision, didn't he?
column8: And humility. I would have liked to meet him personally.

column1: I can't believe that.
column2: What?
column3: I've never heard Mary cursed anybody. But I heard she cursed another driver when she drove me back home today.
column4: Oh. Why did she do that?
column5: The car behind ours suddenly accelerated and hit our Car.

column1: Can you make out what he's saying?
column2: No, it's too loud in here.

column1: Hello ;
column2: Hello, Debbie. This is Donald.
column3: Oh, hi, Donald.
column4: What happened yesterday? You forgot our date, didn ’ t you?
column5: Well, it rained hard all day and I had a bad cold, so I decided to stay home.
column6: You did? But I tried to call you at least twenty times and nobody answered.
column7: Oh, the telephone lines were damaged by the storm. They repaired them yesterday.
column8: What did David do yesterday? Did he and Judy go dancing?
column9: No, they stayed home and played cards with the children.
column10: And what did you do? Did you play cards, too?

column1: Now I understand. But I don't smoke or drink.So what am I supposed to buy in here?
column2: You can buy some of these nice butterflies.
column3: No, I'm sorry. I don't think it is nice to have butterflies mounted in boxes.It is kind of disgusting.
column4: What? You feel sorry for the butterflies?
column5: Yes. I think they should just let them fly free, and not try to sell them to foreigners. It is a kind of destruction of nature.
column6: Well, I agree with you. I'd rather think that the butterflies are flying around in the mountains. I just wonder if they really catch so many that it affects the butterfly population.
column7: Who knows? Hey, I like these jade bears here.
column8: How much are they?
column9: This one is 2300 dollars.Maybe I should buy it for my mother. What do you think?
column10: If you want. Didn't you buy her a small vase already?
column11: Yes, but she would like this a lot. She likes to collect little things like this.
column12: Alright. Buy it then. I won't buy anything. Well, maybe I'll buy some Cognac.
column13: Maybe I could buy some Cognac for my brother. He always drinks it.
column14: Let's go ask about it.

column1: Have you ever been to Xi ’ an?
column2: Yes, I ’ Ve been there several times on business trips. But I have never really seen the terra-cotta warriors as it is outside the city.
column3: I ’ Ve heard many people saying that it is a place worth touring. I really want to see the old walls and terra-cotta warriors one day. Of course I won ’ t miss the local food either. You know, the sites interests a food in scenery, food is a key factor when visiting a place.
column4: I agree. As long as the food is not too bizarre once I saw some people eating insects. That is frightening.
column5: Sure it is. Is it convenient to get there by plane?
column6: Well, the airport is quite far from the downtown area, but it is still more convenient than taking the train.

column1: Have you ever run into a person who tries to bleed you white?
column2: I am always on the look out for such girls.
column3: I hear that some guys splash all their money about on them.
column4: Mark is one of them. He has trouble with a girl who turned out to be a dead beat.

column1: Do you want to rent a car?
column2: Yes, I want one with automatic transmission.
column3: I think that one fits you. Do you need insurance?
column4: Full insurance, please.
column5: OK, by the way, fill the gas tank when you return the car.

column1: Let me tell you what happened to my homework.
column2: OK, go ahead--what is the excuse THIS time?
column3: Actually, I did it, but then it got lost.
column4: Could you have gotten it done at another time?
column5: Yes, I could.
column6: You have never missed an assignment before--when will you be making this one up?
column7: I'll make it up early next week.
column8: That would work, but don't let it happen again.
column9: I'll try.
column10: That will solve it then. Let's work hard to not let it happen again.

column1: I'm bored and got nothing to do tonight.
column2: How about coming with me to meet my American friends?
column3: Hey, that sounds great.
column4: Okay, I'll pick you up at eight o'clock.

column1: Good morning, sir. Here is the hotel's sauna room. What can I do for you?
column2: Yes. This is the first time I've come here. Could you please tell me something about it?
column3: Sure Those who have heart disease or high blood pressure are not allowed to take sauna, for their sake.
column4: Thank you for telling me about this. What should I do here?
column5: First, change your shoes to slippers. Then walk up to the changing room to get prepared for a shower.
column6: OK. How about after the shower?
column7: After the shower, step into the washroom with birch switches, dip them in the warm water and briskly whisk them over your skin.
column8: That sounds comfortable.
column9: Yes, then enter the bathroom, There is a stove tired with wood in the room, and on the top of the stove, there is a pile of stones, which keep the heat. Throw some water on the stones, and dry steam is given off.

column1: Mom?
column2: Mm?
column3: Can my friend, Tom Mitchum, come home with me for lunch tomorrow?
column4: Of course, Jim. Have I met Tom before?
column5: Mm — hmm. You met him last summer. He is small and very smart.
column6: Oh, yes. I remember Tom. His family comes from Maine, right?
column7: Yes.

column1: Wow! What a beautiful scenic spot! It's so open. And just breathe that fresh air, you can almost taste its freshness.
column2: You can have a bird view of Guiling City from the top of the mountain.
column3: Wonderful! I'll often come here for mountain climbing.
column4: You should. Many Guiliners, especially the old and the young, will climb mountains here in the morning.
column5: No wonder people say
column6: Quick! Pass me your binoculars. Look at that bird... I've never seen one of those before. It's indigenous to Guiling, and an endangered species too. This is lucky!
column7: I didn't know you liked bird-watching.
column8: I don't really. I just like wildlife, and you don't get to see too much of it in the city. This place is full of it.

column1: Hi, I Want a room, please.
column2: Good afternoon, sir. Welcome to our hotel.What kind of room would you like, sir?
column3: A double room for my wife and me, please.

column1: Good afternoon, Ladies. May I help you ;
column2: Can we have two a joining double room, sir?
column3: Have you made a reservation ladies?
column4: I ’ m afraid not.
column5: One moment, please. I have to check if there are room available. I ’ m sorry ladies. We have only two double room available, but they are on different floors. Would you mind that?
column6: We prefer they are on same floor because we have a problem check late that night.
column7: May I suggest family sweet? You all just have a consolation.
column8: what ’ s it like?
column9: It ’ s a big room with a king - size double bed and two single beds. You ’ Ve get also an roller-wheels.
column10: That ’ s great. How much is it?

column1: Hello, miss. I would like to check out.
column2: Well, sir. If you want to check out now, we will charge you $ 200 as well.
column3: Why? I have stayed for 3 nights.
column4: Well, the check out time is 12:00 o'clock everyday, if you checked out after 15:00, we have to charge you for another day.

column1: I want to get on the bus already ;
column2: It just isn't on time today.
column3: It was supposed to be here thirty minutes ago.
column4: I think it'll be here pretty soon.
column5: I need to get to work, so it better.
column6: I really do hate public transportation.
column7: I agree, it's just never on time.
column8: That's right.
column9: I also hate having to stand at a bus stop in all kinds of weather.
column10: Oh, that's the worst.

column1: Hello! Can I help you?
column2: Well, I am looking for some winter clothes for my fiancee.
column3: Oh, it's the high time for you purchasing in our clothes shop. We are now having a preseason sale on all our winter apparel.
column4: Really? What's that?
column5: Every thing for winter is 20 % off.
column6: I think my fiancee may favor the sweater in the shop window. Would you like to help me look for any skirts that go with this sweater?
column7: Sure, we have both skirts and trousers that would look well with the sweater. Look at this section.
column8: I especially like this flowery skirts. My fiancee will look very elegant in this.
column9: You have a good taste. It's very much in style this year.
column10: I don't think the green one fits her complexion. Do you have any skirts in light color or tan?
column11: Look on the rack to the right.
column12: Oh, yes. I'll take this one. Can I pay by traveler ’ s check?
column13: It's ok.

column1: How are Zina's new programmers working out?
column2: I hate to admit it, but they're good. And fast. The Filipino kid is a genius.
column3: So you'll make the Stars.com deadline, and have us up and running next week?
column4: It'll be close, but we'll make it.
column5: Good. After Stars.com starts paying us, we won't need Vikam's cash anymore.
column6: And if we don't need them, we won't need Zina, either.

column1: Hello.
column2: This is Soft, may I speak to Lamely?

column6: Would you like to go to an activation with me?

column1: well, I finished my last final today ;
column2: the end of all the hard work for my master's. what a nice feeling to get my degree!
column3: do you want to attend the convocation?
column4: certainly. After years of hard work, I wouldn't miss it. By the way, where can I find cap and gown?
column5: do you want to have them made or do you want to rent them?
column6: oh, I think they're provided by the school for that special day.
column7: no. those you have to provide for yourself.
column8: what do most of the students do?
column9: well, most of them only need a cap and gown for that particular convocation service, but some of the education majors have had them made, because they will be faculty members, and they'll need them f
column10: then, I might as well have them made.

column1: Hello. Holiday Inn. How can I help you?
column2: Yes. I booked a single room in your hotel for this Friday. But I ’ m sorry to say that I have to cancel it. My wife is very sick now. I don ’ t think she ’ ll be able to travel by this Friday.
column3: Oh, I ’ m sorry to hear that.
column4: Thank you. Can I cancel my reservation?
column5: Certainly. May I have your name, please?
column6: My name is Tom Smith.
column7: Okay. I have canceled your reservation, Mr. Smith.
column8: Thank you very much.
column9: You ’ re welcome. I hope your wife is feeling better soon.

column1: Mary, there's one more thing that you must do for me before you leave.
column2: What is it?
column3: You have to take the math and English evaluation tests.
column4: Why?
column5: Because you're from a foreign country. The school needs to find out how good you are at both basic skills.
column6: It's so that I can be put into the right math and English classes, right?
column7: You are a smart girl!
column8: This is going to take more time than I thought.

column1: What ’ s wrong with you? Why are you scratching so much?
column2: I feel itchy! I can ’ t stand it anymore! I think I may be coming down with something. I feel lightheaded and weak.
column3: Let me have a look. Whoa! Get away from me!
column4: What ’ s wrong?
column5: I think you have chicken pox! You are contagious! Get away! Don ’ t breathe on me!
column6: Maybe it ’ s just a rash or an allergy! We can ’ t be sure until I see a doctor.
column7: Well in the meantime you are a biohazard! I didn ’ t get it when I was a kid and I ’ Ve heard that you can even die if you get it as an adult!
column8: Are you serious? You always blow things out of proportion. In any case, I think I ’ ll go take an oatmeal bath.

column1: Daniel, you know? Lisa has invited us to have dinner this afternoon.
column2: Really? Let ’ s hit the road.

column1: Hello, this is Wang Lu and I am calling to confirm my reservation.
column2: What ’ s your flight number?
column3: It's ZN741 to Atlanta on July 1st.
column4: Just for yourself?
column5: Chen Hong, too.
column6: Hold on, please. Yes.you ’ re booked on ZN741 to Atlanta on July 18th. Your seats are in the first class section.
column7: Thank you vary much.

column1: Have you ever been to Japan? I'm going in the fall.
column2: Yeah, I've been there twice.
column3: Really? Tell me about it. What's it like?
column4: Oh, it's fantastic.
column5: Where did you go?
column6: On my first trip I went to Tokyo, and on my second trip I visited Kyoto.
column7: What did you think of Tokyo?
column8: Very big and exciting, but very crowded, too.
column9: Yeah. I've seen pictures of the crowds!
column10: And the restaurant are excellent... but they're kind of expensive.
column11: And how about Kyoto?
column12: Kyoto is lovely. It's full of beautiful old temples and gardens.It' s a very historic city.
column13: How was the weather?
column14: I was in Tokyo in August, and it was really hot and humid. I went to Kyoto in October.It was hot and sunny, but there was no humidity.
column15: Sounds perfect. I can't wait!

column1: I ’ m sick of my job, I always have to work late at night, and the company keeps me working in the office.
column2: Why don ’ t you find a new career where you can do what you enjoy, being outside working during the day?
column3: What do you suggest? I can ’ t afford to quit my job until I get a new one.
column4: Maybe you have two choices. You could attend school during the day, or you could get a position that provides training.

column1: Hi. are you new here?
column2: Yes. I moved here last week.
column3: I'm Steven, your neighbour.
column4: I'm Charlie. Nice to meet you.
column5: Nice to meet you, too.
column6: Since we live in the same neighbourhood, maybe we can help each other from now on.
column7: I guess so. I live next door but one, and hope you'll drop in now and then.
column8: Thank you. I will.

column1: I think I'll get some new goggles.
column2: Good idea. I'll get some, too.
column3: We also need some sunscreen. What about beach towels?
column4: Sure. We have to have something to lie on while we're catching some rays.
column5: I think I'll get a hat, too.
column6: No hat for me, but I'm getting this cool pair of shades.
column7: Okay, I guess that's it. Let's go pay for this stuff.

column1: Oh, my god!
column2: What!
column3: That's the cutest little doll I've ever seen in my life!
column4: Chill out. It's just Kenny from South Park.
column5: What park? You found a doll in a park? Gross!
column6: South Park is a popular cartoon. You're so out of it, Jen
column7: Well, don't blame me! I never get a chance to watch TV.

column1: Please put your baggage on the counter and open it, let me have a look.
column2: Yes, sir. Please examine it.
column3: Anything subject to duty in your suitcase?
column4: No, sir. Nothing except my personal belongings, such as clothes, notebooks and some gifts.
column5: Any cigarettes or liquor?
column6: I have cigarettes for my own use.
column7: I think you'll have to pay some duty on these cigarettes because they exceed the quota. And this article is liable for duty.
column8: How much duty should I pay?
column9: One hundred dollars.
column10: Here is the money.
column11: Just a moment. I'll make out your duty memo. ( Writing and giving the memo to Mr. Green ) Take it and pay the girl over there.
column12: Thank you.

column1: How do you like the food sold in this sidewalk snack booth?
column2: At least, it is better than my boxed lunch at work. I'm so fed up with the bland food. Thank you for having lunch with me!
column3: Any time. But I don't mind eating boxed lunch. The food sanitation is really good too.
column4: It's hard to believe that you like it. You are so easy to be satisfied.
column5: Hey, it's not that bad. The food is nutritious and it's really convenient. I don't want to spend too much time on eating stuff.
column6: Eating is important. You are what you eat. It's not only a daily routine.
column7: Well, will you just go back to work after lunch?
column8: No. I'm going to pay the bill for the company's lunch.
column9: But you didn't eat anything today.
column10: Well, the bill is paid by month. That's probably the only thing that I like about a take-out restaurant.
column11: All right. I'm going to the McDonald's.
column12: For what? I thought you didn't like western food.
column13: No, I never did. It's for my son. He loves it, and I made an agreement with him that he can eat it once a week.
column14: That's really smart. My son Daniel is the same with your son. I just don't get it, why all the kids prefer western food to traditional food.
column15: Me, either. But, it's for sure that the children market is a really big one.
column16: That's for sure. It's always hard for the parents to say no to their children.

column1: Come in, come in, what can I do for you?
column2: Professor Donald, are you giving your advanced geology course again next semester?
column3: Yes, I am applying on it.
column4: I wonder if I could enroll in it. I know it is a graduate course and I' m a junior, but...
column5: Aren't you a bit young? I have a lot of qualified seniors to take the course and they usually have a hard time keeping up.
column6: I know, but geology of the American west is my major interest and I have done a large reading in the field.
column7: Well, if you think you are ready, I'll let you enroll.
column8: Oh, thanks, professor Donald.this is very nice of you.

column1: I enjoyed talking to you.
column2: I enjoyed talking to you too.
column3: We should hang out some time.
column4: I think that would be nice.
column5: Is there anything you would like to do next time?
column6: Do you want to go out to eat?
column7: I'd like that.
column8: So I'll see you next time.
column9: I'm going to call you soon.
column10: I'll talk to you later.
column11: See you soon.
column12: Goodbye.

column1: Hi. This is a Receptionist Desk. How can I help you?
column2: Yes. I just checked in, but I need to change my room.
column3: What ’ s the problem?
column4: I reserved a non-smoking room, but the smell of smoke in this room is so strong that I can ’ t endure it.
column5: I ’ m sorry. I ’ ll arrange a non-smoking room for you right away. The doorman is going to help you with your luggage. I do apologize for the inconvenience.
column6: That ’ s ok. Thanks.

column1: Recently, there prevails' Net Love'!
column2: What's Net Love?
column3: Two people chat on the Net and step by step fall into love! It's Net Love.
column4: Ridiculous! They haven't met! Maybe they're the same sex!
column5: Maybe yesterday you've received a man's woos. He's called' Beast'?
column6: How could you know?
column7: I watched the screen display!
column8: Do you know' He' is Ms. Rebecca!
column9: It's typical Net Love, and a typical lesbians' homosex! HA!
column10: Impossible!

column1: I'm so hungry! I haven't late eaten all day!
column2: Take your mind off it. Look, Crys.This magazine is on China's top ten beauties!
column3: They're all so thin! Her cheekbones are great.
column4: She doesn't have an ounce of fat on her face.
column5: The mag says she's 165 centimeters tall and 38 kilos. If only we could be that thin then...
column6: Not even drinking milk for one month would get us like that.
column7: Oh, bathroom blues.
column8: Look at this girl's gray dress.
column9: I went to try it on yesterday, but it only came in extra small.
column10: Last time I wore extra small was when I was in fifth grade.
column11: ( Weigh herself ) Hey, I lost a kilo in a week with my all-fruit diet. If I keep going, I can wear that dress next month.
column12: So why are you dieting this time anyway? Another guy?
column13: Dieting. It's the price we pay to make men notice us.
column14: The girls in this magazine are so slender.
column15: They're also way younger than us.
column16: True.You know, I First started dieting when I was ten.
column17: You never worked out?
column18: Oh, no. Too much work. I hate to sweat. It's so gross.

column1: Bob is getting on in years.
column2: Yeah, I'm very worried about his health.
column3: He looks tired all the time.
column4: He's working too hard.

column1: Have you got any better?
column2: That's the best there is.
column3: Okay, I'll take one.
column4: That'll be $ 200, sir.

column1: There are so many record players here. That is hard to choose.
column2: Look at this one. It has a radio and cassette player and built in speakers.
column3: I'd rather get one with separated speakers.They give a clear sound.
column4: Yes, but we shouldn't get any thing too big. Remember it has to fit in with our living room furniture.
column5: That's right. Now this one looks alright? It's a detached or do you prefer this one? It's Sony.
column6: Let's ask the salesmen for a demonstration.

column1: It's your turn, sir. I'm sorry that you had to wait. Saturday is a busy day for us.
column2: I suppose so. A haircut, please.
column3: How do you want your hair cut? Any particular way?
column4: I'd just like a trim, and don't cut it too short.
column5: Yes, sir. How about the sideburns?
column6: I think they only need a little trimming.
column7: Can I use the clippers?
column8: No, don't use them, please.
column9: Oh, all right, sir.
column10: Would you trim off a bit more there, above the ear?
column11: Don't you think it needs a little taken off on top, too?
column12: I guess that would be better.
column13: ( Raising a lock ) About like this?
column14: No, not that much. Now, yes, that's fine.
column15: Shave also, s ir?
column16: Yes.
column17: How do you want your moustache trimmed?

column1: Ahh... What a fine day! I do feel like an outdoor exercise.
column2: How about taking a walk in the park?
column3: OK.It' s delightful to have a walk in the park with the air so fresh.
column4: ( After they enter the park ) Oh, it's so quiet here.We have the park to ourselves, only you and me!
column5: Don't you see many people over there? Just on your left.
column6: Oh, I see them.Some are doing Taijiquan, some are performing swordplay, some are practising the Chinese Wushu.
column7: A growing keep-fit fever is sweeping over China.

column1: Did you order the cake?
column2: Oh, I forgot.
column3: Get on the phone right now. It might not be too late.
column4: I ’ m so sorry! OK, so you just want a simple message on it.
column5: Yeah. How about' Happy Birthday Tony, from the gang.'
column6: I ’ m on it!

column1: Do you want black or white coffee ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: Look! there's a Folk concert tomorrow evening. Do you Want to go?
column4: I don't like Folk music very much.
column5: What kind of music do you like?
column6: I like classical music. Do you?
column7: Not very much. Classical music sends me to sleep
column8: I don't believe you.
column9: It ’ s true.
column10: You are funny!

column1: Well, my particular interest is collecting stamps, especially the rare ones. What about you?
column2: I ’ m afraid that ’ s not my cup of tea. I just find skin-diving attracting.
column3: So have you ever been to the stamp display of the town?

column1: I'm taking my date to a restaurant. Could you tell me about one or two good ones?
column2: My pleasure! How much would you like to spend on your date?
column3: She will want an excellent restaurant, of course.
column4: You should know that our hotel chef was trained in Paris. The service and food are world-class.
column5: I wanted to go out somewhere, not stay here. Do you know of another good restaurant?
column6: You can't go wrong with Gramercy Tavern. It's famous for its food, service, and live jazz.
column7: I like that! Could you please call them to see if we can get in tonight?
column8: At once, sir. You'll love this place, I assure you.

column1: Shall I get you another cup of coffee?
column2: Yes, please. That is very kind of you.
column3: Shall I make more sandwiches?
column4: No, thanks. I ’ Ve had plenty.

column1: Oh, this is Monica ;
column2: Please visit t.cn.
column3: Yes. Let's first define the inspection right.
column4: Following the rules of world business, the exporters have the right to inspect the goods before the delivery, while the importers have the right to re-inspect the goods after their arrival.
column5: Would you tell me how the inspection is conducted before shipment and by which agency?
column6: Inspection is to be done by the China Commodity Inspection and Testing Bureau. Usually inspection is conducted within five days before each shipment.
column7: And can you tell me about the re-inspection?
column8: Yes. The re-inspection should be made within seven days upon the arrival, and if any discrepancy is found, the claim must be raised within one month.
column9: I see. How do they make testing and analysis of this item?
column10: They always use the standard and method laid down in the contract.

column1: OH, This is the famous Emperor Palace building.
column2: It ’ s huge.
column3: Would you like to go to the top?
column4: Yes, of course.
column5: The view is breath-taking.

column1: Show us our itineraries, please.
column2: We'll first go to Mount Tai, then we'll go to Sichuan by air, after that we'll be leaving for Tibet.
column3: How long will the trip take?
column4: At least 20 days.

column1: Has Mien sold his house yet?
column2: Yes, he has. He sold it last week.
column3: Has he moved to his new house yet?
column4: No, not yet. He's still here. He's going to move tomorrow.
column5: When? Tomorrow morning?
column6: No. Tomorrow afternoon. I'll miss him. He has always been a good neighbour.
column7: He's a very nice person. We will all miss him.
column8: When will the new people move into this house?
column9: I think that they will move in the day after tomorrow.
column10: Will you see Mien today, Janey?
column11: Yes, I will.
column12: Please give him my regards. Poor Mien! He didn't want to leave this house.
column13: No, he didn't want to leave, but his wife did!

column1: Okay, next question. If Eric asked you out on a date, what would you say?
column2: Duh! I would say yes! Eric is the most popular kid in school! Okay, my turn. What would you do if you won the lottery?
column3: Let ’ s see... If I won the lottery, I would buy two tickets for a trip around the world.
column4: If you buy me a ticket I will go with you for sure!
column5: My dad will freak out if I even mention a trip like that!
column6: Alright this is a good one. What would your mom say if you told her you are going to get married?
column7: If I told her that, she would faint and have me committed!

column1: Paul, is this Paul, isn't it?
column2: Well, well, Mike.Fancy meeting you here.
column3: Small world, isn't it?
column4: Yes, I haven't seen you for four years.How time flies!

column1: I ’ m betting the New York Yankees win. How about you?
column2: Well, I ’ m favor of the Red Sox. They ’ Ve had a good season.
column3: Sorry, guys. Could I just interrupt for a moment? My money is on the Yankees!
column4: That ’ s not a very good pick. I ’ m against the Yankees.
column5: Hey, Ken. Good luck if you already put your money on the Red Sox.
column6: Yeah, I ’ m with you on that.

column1: Are you ready for your first driving lesson ;
column2: Yes. Which one is the brake again?
column3: The pedal on your left is the brake and the one on your right is the gas.
column4: I ’ m glad this car is an automatic. I don't like having to change gears.
column5: Automatics are very simple to drive. The first thing you should do is put your seat belt on.
column6: You should also put yours on. you never know what will happen with me in the driver ’ s seat!
column7: Very funny. Next you should check your side mirrors and your rear view mirror. Can you see out of them?
column8: I can ’ t see anything out of the side mirror on your side of the car. Could you move it forward a bit, please?
column9: How ’ s that?
column10: That ’ s better. Now what?

column1: Open you suitcase, please.
column2: OK.Here you are.
column3: Do you have anything to declare?
column4: No, I don't.
column5: Any cigarette, liquor?
column6: Yes, I have two cartons of cigarettes, one bottle of whisky.
column7: What's this white powder? Are they drugs?
column8: No, this is the medicine for the stomach.
column9: May I open one of these? Let me taste it.
column10: Yes, sir.Go ahead.Here you are.

column1: when do most children start school in your country ;
column2: In America, most children start primary school at the age of five.
column3: How much time do primary school students usually spend at school every day?
column4: Kindergarten students usually only go to school for about four hours every day, but after that, they spend about eight hours in school every day.
column5: do they have to go to school on Saturdays?
column6: no, most children in America only go to school Monday through Friday.
column7: how many subjects do they have to study?
column8: In most schools, they study about nine subjects.
column9: do students have to wear uniforms in schools in America?
column10: some private schools require their students to wear uniforms, but public schools don't.

column1: That'll be eight dollars, please.
column2: Here's ten. Keep the change.

column1: I feel like going for a drink, it's been a long day.
column2: Great idea! Peter, I could use the drink.
column3: How about the new bar across road?
column4: Sounds good. The food there is fantastic too.
column5: I agree, I had lunch there last week.
column6: Excellent! That sounds like a plan.

column1: Excuse me. Could you tell me if the bus goes the national history museum?
column2: No. It doesn ’ t. There ’ s no through bus to the national history museum Madam..

column4: You can transfer at Cuchan Men.
column5: How far is it?
column6: Well, it ’ s only three stops from here.
column7: I see. Thanks a lot.
column8: You ’ re welcome.

column1: Cute... Here. These beans are already ground. Now for step three
column2: So soon?
column3: You have to brew the grinds while they're fresh and drink it immediately for the best flavor.
column4: OK! Hurry, then! Here's my cup. I can't wait for step four!
column5: There is no step four...
column6: Yes, there is, drinking your coffee!

column1: I wonder how Sarah and Mat are.
column2: Don't you know they've already broken up?
column3: I'm not surprised. She's a plain Jane.
column4: And he's so handsome.

column1: You're not looking happy.What' s the matter?
column2: Oh, nothing special. I'm just a bit tired.
column3: With the job?
column4: With everything, with everybody, with all this!
column5: A good suggestion for you.You need a holiday.
column6: It wasn't always like this, you know.
column7: What do you mean?
column8: Well, I mean.We always do the same thing.There' s no variety in our lives.
column9: You need a holiday.That' s what's the matter.
column10: Certainly, perhaps.

column1: Hello, is this housekeeper?
column2: Yes ma'am, may I help you?
column3: This is room eleven-seven and we have just checked in.
column4: Yes?
column5: Our room hasn't been cleaned up yet.So would you send one of your housekeepers to clean up our room?
column6: Oh, yes, ma'am. We'll come right away then.Your room number and your name, please.
column7: Our room number is eleven-seven and my name is Terry Chen.
column8: Thank you.Would you hang up and wait?

column1: Hi Bill, I saw your grandma yesterday.
column2: Oh where was that?
column3: I was running around the track at my college and there she was walking around the same track.
column4: Grannie always tries to stay fit and healthy. She is always making us kids eat the proper foods.
column5: Well, it pays off for her. How old is she anyway?
column6: She will be 86 next month.
column7: That is truly amazing!

column1: Have you seen the movie Batwoman?
column2: No, not yet. Is it good?
column3: Yes, it's quite amusing, actually. Good plot, and Sharon Stone's in it.
column4: Oh, she's good. She must be getting on a bit now.
column5: Yeah, but she looks amazing.
column6: So what's the movie about?
column7: Well, it's about this woman who got murdered because she discovered some company secrets about the cosmetics company she worked for. But then she got reincarnated as a cat.
column8: Huh?
column9: I know. Stay with me. She then decided to get her revenge by revealing the company secret and killing the boss. First, though, she had to discover her true cat nature. At the end she had a big fight with Sharon Stone, who was the real danger in the company.
